11.title: The Alliance

choices: Alexa pokes her head around town
But while there, to her surprise, she run into a teammate!
111.content:
Pandaria, a land shrouded by mystery and mist, or at least formerly shrouded, as the recent events of The Cataclysm had shaken the land free from its cover deep in the South Seas, and unfortunately for its native people, led to the continent becoming the newest staging ground for the ever escalating conflict between the Alliance and the Horde, with Warchief Garrosh Hellscream's forces seeking to plunder the land of its vast resources and riches for his ever growing war machine, while King Varian Wrynn and his fellow allies attempt to thwart the orc and hopefully establish a new set of ties with the Pandaren people.

With threats of war and conflict surrounding multiple sides though, there were still those who were lucky enough to avoid such harsh realities. Or, in some cases, “lucky”, as for Corporal Alexa Birdsong, she would much rather be in the thick of battle right now than in, what she would consider, the lowly reconnaissance and research mission she was handed.

“Examine the Valley of the Four Winds, verify if whether or not it's true that they have some 'miracle' rapid food growth process, and find out if it's at all applicable to the Alliance and her people”, a young blonde haired woman huffed as she trudged closer to Halfhill, the supposed center of commerce in this admittedly beautiful and exotic valley. Standing at medium height, a lithe young rogue, barely into her 20s, Alexa was one of the SI:7's fresher faces, but with numbers thinning across the board due to continuous war and strife, she was being flung head first into the latest battle between factions for the fate of Azeroth. One of those minor instances of strife happened just recently, as a set of skirmishes with the native wildlife in the Jade Forest had led to the rest of her squadron becoming MIA.

“Proceed with the mission at all costs”, she grimaced as she rubbed a sore bruise through her specialized leather armor. Her tender ache was delivered to her personally from a wild Hozen and its tribe of mischief-makers. “I swear, those miserable little freaks... I'll pay back every single one of them once the team is back together!” Her face turned beet red as she tightly clenched her fist. The dagger at her side ready and waiting to get some action. Right now though she needed to get her bearings, and if nothing else could be done about her team, she still had to at least report something on this goose hunt. Maybe afterward she could get reassigned to some real action.

The perturbed agent honestly found it a bit ironic. She grew up on a farm in Elwynn and joined the Stormwind military as a way to escape the rural life. She spent her youth running around getting into roguery and doing everything she could to not cement herself as just some dirt plowing bumpkin, and happily, she found her toned acrobatic figure a perfect match for the Alliance's spy organization, but here she was, asked to survey farmland and chum it up with the local yokels. The Pandaren she'd met so far on her journey seemed nice enough, if a little... corpulent. But who was she to judge? She always tried to be open minded on most things, and here was a whole new race and culture right before her. They were certainly more welcoming than those damned monkeys, to say the least.

Before she could continue her pondering though, her nose caught a whiff of something absolutely enticing. A mix of smells and otherworldly aromas she could hardly place. A far flung from the boar stew back home, and the rations she currently didn't have due to an unfortunate Hozen hold up. Just over the horizon she could see her target. The center of all the farmers, cooks, and brewers of the land, as well as hopefully home to an inn where she could rest her feet.

At that moment, her stomach rumbled.

As well as hopefully home to a good meal. That she could probably bet good money on.
111.title: A Land of Abundance

As this is going on Alexa checks her hostess out. Akira has massive E cup breasts and a two tiered gut that appears to be slipping out the bottom of her kimono top. Akira's rear is round and perky despite being huge her brown shorts are incredibly tight looking on her rear. Her thighs are big to carry her weight she is also bare pawed like most pandarians. Alexa blushes slightly realizing what she did.

1112.title: But while there, to her surprise, she run into ...

choices: Katinka, the Hammer of Dawn.
Vetaala, the novice mage.
Someone else?
112.content:
Katinka, the Hammer of Dawn: Renowned among the Draenei as a fearsome paladin of justice, Katinka has vowed to destroy the Burning Legion wherever they may stand against the Light. For millenia she has studied the tactics and patterns of the Legion's armies, leading offensives against them. Seemingly undefeated, Katinka learns of the resurfacing of an old nemesis, the Nathrezim B'tharimos. She is hated by both the Legion and many orcs for her battles against the original Horde before the shattering of Draenor into Outland.

Age: Appears to be in her mid thirties.
Appearance: White hair tied back in a ponytail, alabaster skin. Katinka has a strong hourglass build, though she still has her feminine curves. She wears a set of brilliant, golden platemail and wields a massive, golden hammer.

Vetaala: An up and coming mage, Vetaala is always eager to learn new spells and read old tomes. Something of a bookworm, she would rather spend her days reading than adventuring. However, she never turns down the opportunity to explore new places of magical inquiry. When not studying, she likes to practice conjuring sweets in her free time.

Age: Appears to be in her early twenties.
Appearance: Black hair swept to one side, rich blue skin. Slender build, though she looks like she'd be a natural apple shape if she gained any weight. She wears a set of blue and gold robes, and wields an enchanted mageblade.

choices: The mischievous Merribelle was eavesdropping!
Vetaala's gloomy professor stood on the other side, eager for a progress report.
1122211.content:
Vetaala sat idly in her study, leaning far back in her padded chair. A heavy, dusty tome sat in her lap. A slightly smaller tome hug clasped between her slender fingers, and a stack of other odd books lay strewn about her desk. Clearly, she had been doing quite a bit of reading. The Draenei sighed to herself, lowered her book, and gently rubbed her eyes. “Ohhh, I’ll never finish at this rate…”

Five years of study at the Violet Citadel brought Vetaala to her crowning achievement. Or so it would have, if she managed to ever finish it. The past year showed little progress on her thesis for professorship.

Conjuration is the school of creating objects out of pure arcane energy. For as long as there have been mages, they have practiced the art of conjuring food and drink to sustain them in their spellcasting. However, the consumables created in the traditional manner have little to no flavor, often tasting bland and unappetizing. It was a means to an end and nothing more.

Seeing it as an opportunity to mark her place in the annals of magister history, Vetaala selected the conjured as her school of focus. The mage knew if she could succeed in making an easy, flavorful conjured meal, she would be awarded her professorship without question.

Vetaala groaned, reaching a hand down to her lower back, rubbing it tenderly. The dimly lit study did little to encourage further reading. “Gah! I need a break!” Scooting back in her chair, the mage rises to her hooves. Her luminescent blue eyes glimpsed her profile in the adjacent standing mirror. “I look like a mess!” Vetaala’s hair was a tousled bouquet of black curls. Her eyes lowered to her figure, and she grinned with delight. “Still got the rest of it though.~” She flexes childishly, admiring her svelte physique. Years of study had not hindered her daily exercises, and the young Draenei kept her tummy toned and her legs strong. Her rump was pert and taught, displaying her rigorous routine.

After a moment to magically align her hair into a more stylish bedhead look, the arcanist let out a meek yawn. “Mmm, I wonder if Merribelle is awake yet…” Eager to find her human friend, the Draenei trotted toward the door to her study, swinging it open. On the other side, she was met with an unexpected surprise!

113.title: Night Elf

choices: A tower overlooking an autumnal landscape. (Archmage Xylem's tower, Azshara)
A strange city of magic she's only seen in books until now! (Dalaran)
Somewhere else entirely... (Reader's Choice!)
1131.content:
She strode amongst the Horde warriors as their blades bounced off of her magical armor, a vision of arcane might and beauty as fire and frost rained from the heavens and brought her foes low by the dozen. Her long, wavy seafoam hair and implausibly revealing robes billowed in the wind as she caught sight of the great brute Garrosh Hellscream himself, towering on a throne of skulls and fire and spikes, Anduin Wrynn and Wrathion tied up by his side and screaming for her aid. Chuckling, she avoided his thrown axes and barrels and turned her full arcane arsenal on him, transforming the great orc warchief into a harmless sheep. The two handsome men gazed at her, clearly awestruck at her beauty. Anduin's eyes sparkled, his dewy lips parting with wonderment. "Belyssa!" Even Wrathion's scheming face melted into amazement and admiration, and maybe more. "Belyssa..."

-----

"BELYSSA FULLMOON."

The feeling of a staff rapping lightly against her skull knocked the night elf from her blissful reverie. Around her, her fellow apprentices were giggling and tittering as the hard face of her highborne master, Harroth Silverdew glowered down at her. "Meditating, are we? Perhaps now that your mind has been cleared, you can follow my instructions and perform a simple spell." The withered old night elf gazed at the rest of the class, who had produced an assortment of conjured treats. "I assume you remember how to conjure refreshments?"

Belyssa rubbed the soreness from her head, and brought her hands together, concentrating and channeling magic energies. She hadn't grown up with such forces... No Darnassian had, in such a long time. But the waifish elf had always wanted nothing more, even before the return of the Highborne, when there was no greater taboo amongst the kaldorei. It wasn't until the Cataclysm that she'd finally had a chance to seek out an apprenticeship... But things weren't going so well, as evidenced by the food she'd just conjured. If you could call the stale bread and clouded water she created food. Harroth just looked at the unappetizing assortment with a sigh.

"Almost makes me wish I'd stayed in Feralas. Belyssa, I want you to see me after class."

Belyssa's face fell, and the rest of the lesson seemed to drag on for eternity. Finally, the other students filed out, leaving her alone with Master Silverdew. The old elf shook his head as he circled her. "I don't know what to do with you, Ms. Fullmoon. You certainly exhibit potential, and yet the only results you can produce are unimpressive failures. At best. I still have nightmares about that incident with the portals. Therefore, I feel it best that I terminate your apprenticeship here and now, before you can get into any REAL trouble. Arcane burns the uninitiated, but it does even worse to those who really know how to get in trouble with it."

The night elf maiden panicked, kneeling down and grabbing at Harroth's robes. "No! Nononononono! I can do better, I know I can! I just need a chance!" The exasperated teacher looked down at her, sighing. "You've exhausted the patience of every tutor in Darnassus. But if you are truly, TRULY desperate... I may know someone who will take you in." He handed her a sealed scroll and wove his staff through the air, conjuring a shimmering portal. "Only pass through here if you are truly pre... Belyssa?"

He looked for his ex-apprentice, but it seemed she'd already gone through. "Well then."

-----

When the rest of the world came into view, Belyssa was surprised to find herself...

1133.content:
Rehnae Starwhisper, a young rogue who, due to her poverty, is forced to live off the harsh wilds to survive.

Or

Avean Grovewatcher, a battle-hardened Warrior returning from the war (Which one is up to you.), simply looking to unwind after many battles
1133.title: Something else!

choices: A glowing pendant
A batch of strange-looking Berries.
11331.content:
Rehnae was around 16 in human years, and was born into poverty. She lost her home after she lost her parents many years ago, and she was forced to survive on her own in the savage wilds.

She barely got by, living off of berries and leftover food in abandoned campsites. She was sickly thin, but still managed to survive, while keeping her Night Elf morals up.

One day, however, while she was off hunting for more food, Rehnae found something very odd...
11331.title: Rehnae

choices: Make a sale
Curiousity, well...
113311.content:
A strange glowing pendant lay in the clearing of the forest, giving off an almost unnatural glow. "Well, it doesn't look particularly edible..." the elf thought to herself, having not eaten much lately. She stooped down over the strange pendant, prodding it with a stick, "Sure looks odd... I wonder who might've dropped it. Some noble maybe?" She might get a reward if she finds who might've dropped the neck piece, but it does have strange look about it. The pendant looked at her almost hungrily, if she were to pin a word to it.

She kicked at the gemmed thing a bit with her sole less shoe, it felt warm to the touch on her skin. "Hmmmm..." She pondered her options, should she try finding out who it belongs to, get a bit of cash for it, buy some food maybe? Or maybe try it on, find out what it is?
113311.title: A glowing pendant

choices: Rehnae rips off the pendant, but not without putting on a few pounds.
Rehnae is unable to remove the pendant, and continues to grow.
1133112.content:
"I'll find out who owns it, later. Finders, keepers, anyway." Rehnae concluded, as she locked the Pendant around her neck.
The pendant began to glow brighter than before, and she felt a strange sensation in her stomach. But, she brushed it off as simple hunger, and continued to forage for food.

As she ventured deeper into the woods, the sensation in her stomach continued to be apparent. At this point, she couldn't say it was hunger anymore. She looked down, and saw that her belly was larger!
"What the...?" She wondered, as her belly grew bigger and bigger.
She wondered what could be causing her sudden weight gain, and came to the conclusion that it was the Pendant's work!
"Ugh, I need to get this off...!" Rehnae mumbled, trying to suck in her large gut. Her rear began to experience a bit of the gain, as well, causing her thin clothes to become stressed and tight on her body.
1133112.title: Curiousity, well...

choices: Maybe keep the necklace for now?
We simply HAVE to get rid of this thing!
11331121.content:
She tears the pendant off her neck with some effort, the clasps almost growing together. The pendant lay on the ground, still glowing, perhaps even brighter after having a host. Rehnae sat with her back to a tree stump, panting heavily. She looked down to access the damage, her purple face grew weary, she almost fainted! What used to be a curve inward was now a curve OUTWARD, and not a meager amount... She must've had a good 40 pounds added to her belly alone, let alone a plump pair of love handles framing it on either side. She pinched and prodded at the new form, extremely foreign to her normally sickly figure.

She sat up after almost hypnotically toying with her midsection, to see what happened to her lower half. She reached back and felt a new body part, an ass! She lifted it with both hands, noting that it's smooth to the touch and curved out generously, jiggling with every movement of her legs. She pinched at her chubby thighs with curiosity, there's more than bone there now... her clothes ripped at the seems, not making much different in the evening breeze, given how thin they were.

Even more strangely, it felt as though she had just eaten a large three course meal, her stomach felt full and content, for once in a long time...
11331121.title: Softer around the edges...

choices: In her dreams...
When she wakes up, something's off...
113311211.content:
Rehnae, despite hating this new body, decides to keep the Necklace. It did fend off her hunger, and in a survival scenario, that's possibly your main priority.

She headed towards her shelter with no food, it didn't make much difference since she felt like she'd eaten a whole Talbuk, despite her vegan ways. She'd probably be fine for the night. Rehnae began work on some new clothing, with whatever scraps she had found, as well as recycled from her old clothes.
It proved a bit more difficult, with her chubby fingers getting in the way. However, she managed to fix up her clothes. A bit bigger, this time.
Rehnae sat on a handmade stool she made herself, staring at the pendant in her hand. It glowed a deep evergreen, and had the aesthetic as if it were pointed, yet the sides were surprisingly smooth. The lace that held it all together, now torn due to her previous incident, was lost somewhere. Now it's only use was just to glow.
Rehnae decided that it would make a good illumination light, for night hunting. After all, it seemed to only work when it was tied around her neck.

As Rehnae went to bed, the Gem from the pendant glowed a bit brighter. Rehnae, at this point, was sick of the glowing, so she placed a leather cloth over it to not keep her up during the night. Afterwards, she went to bed, and much quicker then usual, despite her usual uncomfort from the hard ground.
113311211.title: Maybe keep the necklace for now?

choices: The ruins sound likely
Townsfolk could hold the answer
1133112112.content:
Something just didn't feel right... a slight buzzing in her head, a faint sound in her ears. She sits up only to hear the pendant clatter to the floor, it must've been laying on her chest! She sat up figure out if anything happened to her, patting everywhere along her body, nothing seemed to point to the same effect as yesterday. Rehnae gave a sigh of relief, "Oh by Elune, that could have been awful..." She was feeling rather stifled, as if she hadn't drank any water, she panted, pulling at her rough shirt for some air.

She looked down at her chest briefly, something was off, her eyes did a double take and pointed out strange runes colored a vibrant blue in contrast to her purple skin. They were somehow fixed onto her, be it magic or something else, they looked like tattoos but gave off a visual sheen, if in the right light. Rehnae gave her head a tilt, pulling at one of her ears in thought (A little quirk of hers when in deep concentration). This was clearly the work of that strange pendant, but what does it mean?

Whatever it was, she had to get to the bottom of it... She knew there were some ancient ruins in the forest nearby, perhaps they hold some answers? Or maybe go to town, see if anyone recognizes it?
1133112112.title: When she wakes up, something's off...

choices: She decides to go to bed, and worry about it tomorrow.
She uses leaves to cover up, then goes to town to find some proper clothes.
11331121121.content:
She decided to check the ruins first, as she didn't want to frighten off any of the nearby townspeople with her strange glowing. She also brought along the Pendant, in case she found the owner.
Her weight was still there from yesterday, and she found it a bit of a hassle getting around, but her persistence shown through, and allowed her to continue forward.

She walked for what seemed like hours, and finally came across the Ruins she'd seen so long ago. With similar runes surrounding the area. She then noticed the runes across her body began glowing brighter, as well as the Pendant. She walked closer, and they both glowed brighter and brighter, until her whole body was illuminated.
It was now, that she couldn't see through the brightness, leaving her blinded. She fell on her enlarged butt, and felt the sensation in her belly again from last night, before passing out.

When she awakens, the first thing she notices is that she's no longer by the Ruins. In fact, she doesn't know where she is, just somewhere in the woods.
The next thing she notices is that she's seemed to double in weight, which leaves her shocked and confused. But, she decided to deal with that when she finds out where she is, and if she can get back to her shelter in the woods.
She attempts to get up, which proves easier said than done. She's been left obese and nude in the middle of the woods, lucky there aren't any sticks or bark on the ground. Just soft, green grass.
When she finally does raise herself off the ground, she takes a look into the sky. The sun is nearly down, so Nighttime will fall soon. She gains her bearings, and sneaks through the woods, as best as her enlarged body will allow.

She eventually does make it home, and she promises herself that she'll be more careful not to gain any more weight, for any more might cause, the next time she goes poking around in old ruins, to be left immobile, in the middle of the woods, easy prey for some Bear to come around and devour her whole.

But, while at the moment she's not totally immobile, she wonders how she's going to get new clothes.
"Obviously, I can't just make new clothes out of the shreds of my old ones. Don't even know where they are... also, that was the last of my leather." Rehnae stated aloud.
She pondered her predicament...
11331121121.title: The ruins sound likely

choices: She's safe... for now
Captured by the humans!
113311211212.content:
She figured the best course of action was certainly to get new clothes, she'd be able to find out what happened... after yet another unknown once she's clothed. Now quite the plump elf, she held onto the scraps of her most recent patch-job, these won't do... "There's a human settlement nearby, I don't think they'll miss a bit of cloth, they'll hardly notice." She went outside to cover what she could with leaves, doing her best to blend in (Which honestly looked a bit embarrassing, given her size) she head out to the north, hopefully to find something to make new clothes with.

Night had finally fallen, with the human settlement just over the ridge, it was clear everyone was asleep. Being a rather adept rogue, and with her efficient eyes, it wasn't hard spotting what looked to be a storage tent. Despite her size, the elf was quick on her feet, blending into the shadows well. She slipped into the tent without an upset, but it certainly looked bigger on the inside...

Looking for a good 20 minutes, the rogue spotted a large batch of what looked to be Frostsilk... my my, that'll certainly be an upgrade from her usual fair. She grabbed an armful of frostsilk, and an equally large grab of wolf fur. This night wasn't looking so bad after all... As she was creeping out the tent, she heard a watchmen outside, holding a torch aloft...
113311211212.title: Trying to keep decent...

choices: The glowing pendant returns in her Knapsack.
Nothing seems off... Yet.
1133112112121.content:
She just barely passed by unnoticed, which was a big accomplishment with her in incredible girth.
Rehnae rushed as fast as her fat body allowed back home, to get to work on her new clothes. It proved even harder, due to her even more plump fingers, but she managed to create a suitable shirt and pants out of the materials she gathered from the humans.
"Good survivalists... *Yawn* Can do anything... Under any..." Rehnae attempts to finish her statement, but falls asleep, due to her being so tired.
Her shirt had barely managed to cover half her stomach, and her pants, were also very good at covering her buns.

When she awakens the next morning...
1133112112121.title: She's safe... for now

choices: Mages know of the arcane...
Elves know of the ancient...
11331121121211.content:
With a yawn, Rehnae surveyed herself, noting no physical changes. She gives a sigh of relief, "Better results than the last time I woke". There's certainly something odd scratching at the back of her, familiar to her, get more potent. She looked around her camp, finding nothing, till she see's a green glow from out the corner of her knapsack...

"By Elune, this fel-blasted thing won't give up!" Rehnae shouted to no one in particular, it's clear that whatever happened a few nights ago won't leave her alone yet. She clutched in her hands, "I have to do something... and I'd rather not be immobile in the woods, so that lowers it down to humans..." The rogue had two options left, go to the nearest human town and find a magister, or travel back to elven lands to find someone who might have some trace to it? She had to think quickly, as she still didn't have any food, and the pendant was still last resort for 'food'...
11331121121211.title: Oddly persistent

choices: When she reaches the Ruins...
On the way there...
113311211212111.content:
She headed to town, since she was closer by it.
Rehnae was given odd stares from the townsfolk, the clothing she wore leaving little to the imagination, her gut still visible.
She knocked on the door of the local Magus, who she knew as very powerful.

"Yes, yes, what is it... Yah!" The Old Mage was shocked at Rehnae's appearance.
"I apologize for the scare, Wise one. I am in seek of help." Rehnae begged him.
The Mage laughed, "Well, missy, I ain't got a spell for Weight Loss, so tough there!"
Rehnae got a bit mad, "This is serious!" She roared.
The Mage calmed himself, and allowed her into his home.

Rehnae showed the gem to the Mage, and what happened to her. Aside from the Cloth robbery, of course.
The Mage pondered for quite a while. "Hm, well. A gem that causes sudden weight gain to the user... It's a mystery, for sure. Ah! I know!"
The Mage handed her a rock, with the same pattern she bore when she investigated the ruins. "If you bring this with you to the old Ruins you talked about, you may become immune to its curse. Just don't let go!" The Mage explained.
Rehnae nodded and headed off, but not before another quip from the Mage, "Heh, assumin' you don't get stuck in the doorway! HAHA!" The Mage cackled as Rehnae stormed off, a bit ticked off from the rude Mage.
'So much for Wise and Powerful...' She thought.
113311211212111.title: Mages know of the arcane...

choices: A small room, with something unexpected inside...
A towering room, with something odd inside...
1133112112121111.content:
As fumed as she was, it was her best bet. It's not pure coincidence that the stone bore resemblance to the runes. She set off back to the ruins, clearly not in the best of spirits. Even after telling herself that it was going to work, she had some doubts. It wouldn't be absurd, given the previous events, that it turns for the worse.

As she comes in on the ruins, she clutched her stone tightly, "The better work.." with as large a step as she could muster, she had one step past the threshold that previously knocked her into a fattening sleep. With a deep breath, another step and yet another. Clearly the stone was working as intended.

Rehnea strode through the temple, making sure her grip was never loosened on the fist sized stone. All of the strange runes lead in one direction, an ancient tower with overgrown vines ensnaring it from all round. The doorway shone green, the same as the bothersome trinket none the less. An oddly shaped keyhole notched into the stone, approximately the same dimensions of the pendant.

Whatever she was intended to find had to be inside. She unfastened her knapsack and brought forth the anomaly, snapping right into place with a satisfying click. As the dust cleared from the hinges, the pendant popped back out into her hand. "Time to see what this is, hmm?"

Inside she found...
1133112112121111.title: When she reaches the Ruins...

choices: She awakens in the middle of the woods again, now immobile from the gain.
She breaks free at the last minute, and attempts to escape.
11331121121211111.content:
It was a room resembling that of a cell, used to keep Criminals from committing crimes, now used to house a box, laying upon a pedestal, illuminated by a crack in the ceiling.
"Huh... Wonder what this is." Rehnae wondered aloud, as she opened the box.
Within the withered old box, laid a simple note that read,
'You've found the stone and the key,
And put on some weight, as i can see.
The weight bears down on your once frail body,
But think before you act, is the deal that shoddy?
The pendant shall make you grow and grow,
Fatter faster than anyone knows,
Never to hunger, never to wait,
Simply stay in here and accept your fate."

Then, the door slammed behind her, and the stone began to glow brighter than ever before.
"No, no! What's going on...?" She screams, as she feels an all too familiar feeling in her belly.
"Please, don't... I can't survive more weight, I'll become immobile, I'll..."
11331121121211111.title: A small room, with something unexpected inside...

choices: Someone finds the immobile elf...
Some beasts lurk around her...
113311211212111111.content:
Her vision fades to black, only to reopen in similar surroundings, only tis time she's in different circumstances. "Fel blast it, I'm left with no answers and... and..." She trails off after discovering her new physique. Stifling a scream, the rogue finds her tattered clothes laying on the ground, pinned down by her own weight and immobile. She could still move her arms, using them to grab at what seemed to be an endless bounty of fat. She shook at her belly, feeling it ripple every which way, with a deep center fold leading to a pit of a navel. She didn't even have to guess what her lower half was like...

She sat on her wide, plush rump, surprisingly still smooth without stretchmarks nor cellulite, she wasn't uncomfortable sitting on it, that's certain. Her thighs were impossibly round, any trace of mobility gone some time ago. Her chest bouncing up and down with each breath, she could hardly see past them, managing to stay perky despite their obvious size and lack of support. Even her face felt off, framed with a generous layer of pudge, choppy cheeks and pouty lips.

One alteration beside the weight were her new tattoos. They now framed her entire body, intricately following the curves of her body. Her arms, legs, and belly were now gleaming in the moonlight, beautifully, really. Given you're not Rehnae, scared out of her mind...
113311211212111111.title: Fool me once...

choices: It worked, and she slowly regained mobility.
Nothing happened, and she's still nude and immobile
She begins to grow uncontrollably!
1133112112121111112.content:
She hears the sounds of a few Tigers sneaking up on her. Impossible for her to do much, she contemplates what her life would've been like if she'd just gotten rid of that stupid amule-
"Wait." She thought, as she found the Gem lodged between her two pillowy bosoms. "Maybe, just maybe, if I break this Amulet, I'll be free of this stupid curse!" She considered. It wasn't the best plan, but at the moment, she was running low on options. So it was better than nothing.
With what little strength she had left, fueled by the fear of her very near death, she hucks the Amulet to the ground with such force, It shatters into tiny pieces.
"Now, we see if that did anything..."

choices: Option 1
Option 2
11331121121211111121.content:
As the gem shattered, a wisp of green energy escapes and rushes to Rehnea, slipping through the corners of her lips. With a deep breath, the weight that piled on the last few days begun to shrink into her, quickly cutting away all her blubber to reveal a trim figure. She was in better shape than she was before, and without the rest lugging her down.

She looked down with a smile, "I should've done that ages ago.." as if forgetting her immediate danger, the elf is tossed back into reality to the sounds of tigers creeping in nearby underbrush. With a yelp, she sprints through the nearest opening...

Rehnea is left huffing and puffing, one arm propped against the wall to her humble shelter, she's never run that fast in here life! She slumped down onto the cold floor, noting just how frigid it is while unclothed. Her 'tattoos' certainly haven't died down, just as numerous and vibrant. "Does this mean it's over? It's awfully simple with just that..."

Option 1: Something about that wisp coming from the pendant wasn't right.... perhaps there's something (Or even someONE) inside...

113311211212111111212.content:
Rehnae notices a note when she finally regains her strength, and it's from the Mage.

"Dear Obese Elf Lady,
I've come into contact with some of my other Mage cohorts, and one told me some very important information, now this is very important, so I personally delivered this with my own Pidgeon. His name is Jeremy. Anyway, off topic. What is important is that you DO NOT break the Pendant, or lose it. As my friend states, the essence will retreat into your body, and we're not sure exactly WHAT happens, but we do know it'll probably keep you fat. Just thought you'd like to know before you do something crazy, anyway, toodles!
~ Zeke Mumberdale, Master Mage."

Rehnae began to worry, noting the shattered Pendant not far from her home. She rushed out into the woods to where she was, not without a trusty dagger, and searched for the shards.
However, they seemed to mystically disappear without a trace. She searched high and low, but nothing could be found.
"Damnit! Looks like this nightmare isn't over just yet..." Rehnae said, a bit depressed.

But, so far, nothing was happening, and Rehnae began to feel...

1133112112121111112122.content:
Rehnea slumped against a tall elven birch, defeated. "There's certainly nothing left here... hopefully those damnable tigers ate the cursed thing..." She stroked her left ear in contemplation, perhaps she should check with the mage again? I mean, it's not like there's anything left here... but then again, the old cook couldn't have a single useful shred of information, who even uses pigeons anymore?

The rogue's thought pattern quickly trailed after that, till her stomach growls with a savage ferociousness. "Ugghhh, I haven't had a bite to eat since that faux three course pendant meal..." She clutched at her stomach in pain, at least glad there's not a blob in place of it. "How am I supposed to hunt when there's tigers in the area, not the mention I'm glowing like a winterviel tree over here." It was impossible to cover their bright light.

She stooped over the wet grass, nibbling on her lower lip, "Maybe I could bum off the humans again, play the role of innocent forest dweller attacked by ravenous tigers? Not far from the truth, and ah!" She reached down to the shreds of cloth on the ground, draping them about her, "Perfect." She marched in the direction of the human town, writing up her lines and story as she went.

On the outskirts of town, she made ready for her ruse, screaming 'HELP!" as loud she could, running over the hill and down to the valley, "HELP HELP, TIGERS!" She yelled, clutching onto her shreds of clot. "They chased me from my home in the woods, please help!" The guards posted on their watch towers woke from their nap, running to the gates and slamming them closed as Rehnea got through.

"Ma'am, go down to the last building on the right, you'll find food and clothes." Clearly they were used to this sort of thing. Though an elf nearly covered in glowing tattoos running through the gates butt-naked was rather strange. With a shrug they 'returned to their posts'.

Rehnae ran into the last building on the right, panting and out of breath. She was the only one when she got in, aside from the Owner.
The Owner was a small Gnome, who wore a brown linen jacket over a sleeveless tee, and shorts that looked like pants on his small body.
"Ma'am, do you think you can just run into here in the buff an' be glowin' brighter than the freakin' sun an' expect service?" The Owner asks, a bit snidely.
"That's the plan, yeah." Rehnae responds.
"I like your style. Come have a seat, I'll go grab some clothes an' food for ya. You must be starvin', you poor thing!" He remarks, heading back behind the counter.

"So, got a name, missy? Or should I just call ya Brighty?" The Owner questioned.
"My name's Rehnae. I was just attacked by some tigers outside of town..." Rehnae explained.
"Huh, Tigers. Right." The Owner responded, a bit unconvinced. "My names Jilzwick. But most call me Wicky." Wicky introduced himself, as he handed Rehnae some new clothes.
Rehnae nods, "Nice to meet you, Wicky." She puts on the shirt and pants, and would worry about underwear later.
"So, why is it you're glowing so bright, anyhow? Or is that just something you Night Elves do?" Wicky wondered.
"Oh, I found some crazy amulet in the woods, and it caused me to gain weight, then I found this weird ruined castle or something with runes... it's a long story." Rehnae explained.

"Oh..." Wicky began...

"Oh... well I may not look it now, but I used to be quite the hotshot archeologist." He pulled up his trousers with a huff, "And that certainly sounds like something I..." He disappears under his short counter, retuning with a short pipe, giving the end a spark, "... or at least someone I know, could tell you about." Blowing a wide smoke ring in the direction of the elf. "The stew might take a bit, so give me all the details, if your glowiness could." Wicky heaved a fresh kettle stew over a fire and pulled up a seat across his patron.

"Now, try and believe what I'm saying here, as it might be a little odd, but I swear it's all true!" She hold up her hands, pledging to tell the truth, at least most of it (Maybe cut out the bit involving a certain robbery...). Wicky answers with a nod, ready and intent for the mostly true-truth. "And then I ran in here, faster than the speediest tiger." Rehnea slammed both hands down on the table. "You're now up to speed." By the time Rehnea finished her tale, Wicky had gone through quite a bit of his Tabaco, the girl was a bit TOO descriptive at time, and the whole bit about punching the tigers? Come on now. Wicky tells Rehnae, "Alright, so the Tower you went to was actually an ancient study room for a Mage that went by the name "Grand Magus Arthur". He wanted complete isolation, so he cursed his Tower with a Fattening Curse, that would cause anyone who entered without the Stone of Supremacy, the one that crazy Mage gave you, to gain weight rapidly until they grew immobile and could no longer invade.
Until one day, he lost the Stone of Supremacy, and could no longer re-enter his Tower. In his last breath before the Fat overwhelmed his body, he removed the large, evergreen jewel that was socketed on the handle of the door to his study, and cast it into the wilderness, in hopes that someone would find it and aid him.
No one knows exactly what happened to the body of Arthur, but some say his spirit still lives on in the Amulet. That you so foolishly destroyed." Wicky explained.
Rehnae gasped, "So... that means the power of the Amulet is..."
"Inside you, yes. And possibly Arthur's spirit." Wicky confirmed. "In fact, your stomach is glowing right now, and I'd suggest you do something about that before... well, you'd know, having the most experience." Wicky remarked, getting both a shocked expression, as well as a glare, from Rehnae.

"Yes, I would call THIS" Rehnea emphasizes her belly, framing either side with her hands in anger, " Qualifying as unnatural!" She gave it a shake for good measure, a burp escaping past her lips.

"Look, I had no choice, there were tigers, and I was," Rehnea blew out her cheeks and made a circular gesture around her, displaying that she was fat and immobile. "Ugh, you peons always come to Grand Wizard Falstun for all your answers, don't you?" The old cook stretched his old bones in preparation, "But I'll help, if only to see what happens. HEre's what needs to be done..."

Everywhere else the green had spread followed suit, growing at a lighting quick pace. Her loaned clothes bursting at the seams in seconds flat. Her chest ballooning to take up any sort of view she'd get looking down, she could likely hide a person in there, were there any around. Anyway, I'd better wrap up, for Jeremy is certainly tired of waiting for you to read this note. Ta-ta!
From,
The Grand Magus of New Rustival, Falstun."

1152.content: Dwarves are made for packing on the pounds (in fact, they often come pre-packed); but what sort of lass will these pounds be packed onto?
1152.title: Dwarf

choices: Bridgit is led to table covered with mountains of food.
The village shaman sizes her physique up, first.
11521.content:
"...Uggh... where am I...?"

Bridgit Broadbellows took stock of herself. All her pieces were still there, including her head, which she almost regretted, because it was pounding painfully. Her arms and legs were still there. She patted her hips.

Her swords were gone.

Dammit. She opened her eyes a crack and looked around. She was in a darkened room, with flecks of sunlight lancing in through the woven-branch walls. Her left leg felt heavy; after a moment she discovered that that was because it was attached to the floor with a heavy chain. There was no visible lock to pick.

Double dammit.

She tried to piece last night's events together. She remembered hitting the tavern in Booty Bay with her friends. She'd gotten drunk--scratch that, she'd gotten smashed. After guzzling down enough fruit wine to float a small ship, she'd climbed on her mechano-hog and roared off towards...home? If she hadn't been so drunk, she would have just waited for a portal. As it was, she dimly remembered getting turned around somewhere in the northern hills, finding herself in urgent need of a bathroom, and getting off the hog to relieve herself. Then... well, obviously something had happened.

The door swung open and a troll stepped through. She couldn't place the tribe; the markings weren't Bloodscalp or Skullsplitter. A minor tribe?

Shit. How far off course did I go? she wondered, as the troll sized her up in turn. He was muscular, with heavy teeth, but he held his spear clumsily; Bridgit thought she could take him. If she had her swords, anyway, and if she wasn't chained up.

"Helloh," the troll rasped in heavily accented Common. "Welcome to Stonetusk village, girl human."

Bridgit's hopes sank further. If they'd never seen her people before, she had to be really far from the beaten path. She was probably lucky her captor spoke common at all.

"Listen. If you let me go, I can get you gold. Jewels." She coughed. "Shiny rocks?"

The troll grinned. "It would be a waste. It is hard to find good meat here. And you are the fattest human we have ever caught."

"I'm a dwarf!" Bridgit said indignantly. Then the full meaning of his sentence registered. "And I taste terrible."

"Doesn't look that way," the troll said, sizing her up. "You are round and juicy. Too bad you are so short. Not everyone will get a piece."

Bridgit gulped. "L-listen. I'm really very skinny by dwarven standards. Look, my stomach is flat--well, almost--and my breasts are only single-Ds." She gestured to her leather-wrapped torso.

"Lots of good meat back here," the troll said, picking her up and giving her a slap on the butt. The hut rang with a meaty smack.

"Okay, g-granted," Bridgit said, "but still, I'm mostly very lean and stringy. I don't eat much, you see, I've got to keep trim for--for my job."

The troll pondered. "If we fed dwarf instead of eating her now, she would get bigger?"

"Yes!" Bridgit agreed. "Much, much bigger! Get a little food in me and I just blow up like nobody's business. Why, you'd be a fool to eat me now!"

If I can just stall for a day or so, she thought desperately, my friends will have time to find me. Please, please buy it...

The trolls prodded her in the stomach. "Fat dwarf girl really will get fatter?"

"Huge!" she agreed, nodding fervently. "You'll have leftovers for weeks!"

"Hmm," the troll said. "All right. Instead of us having feast, you will have feast."

He leaned down and snapped the chain with his bare hands. Bridgit gulped. If they were all this strong, it wouldn't be easy to get away.

The troll turned and looked at her sternly, before adding, "But dwarf girl better fatten up quick!"

"Hey, it's a promise," Bridgit said, raising her hand. A bead of sweat trickled down her cheek.
11521.title: A rogue, captured by trolls!

choices: Bridgit is forced to eat berries and fruit all week, locked in her hut.
The shaman casts a hex of hunger on Bridgit, to invigorate her feasting.
115212.content:
Bridgit’s troll escort led her out of the hut and into the morning light. The surrounding huts and shacks were all crude and weathered, but it was the other trolls that set her nerves on edge. They looked starving! It would take some real swaying to keep her head on her shoulders.

“Here we go, mon,” the troll tugged her chain and led her to the steps of the temple. It looked like it must have been built ages ago. The stone blocks were built into the mountain behind it.

I sure hope they take the bait… the young dwarf lass swallowed the lump in her throat and hobbled toward the oldest troll she had ever seen. The withered husk of a shaman peers at her through a pair of cloudy eyes. He gestures to the escort, who then shoves Bridgit toward the elder.

“All right, all right. No need to get pushy,” she scowls back at the escort before remembering her potential imminent demise. Right. As the elder staggers toward her, leaning heavy on his cane, he reaches a wrinkled, shaky hand toward her face.

“Wot chu bring me, mon?” the elder croaked, laying his three leathery fingers across the dwarf’s impish face.

“It be our captive,” the escort began, gripping Bridgit’s chain tightly. “You tink she be good for eatin’, elder?” The elder slid his hand down the dwarf’s neck and grasped a handful of one breast.

Cheeky bastard… she hissed. Realizing he was sizing her up for slaughter, the cunning dwarf immediately sucked in her stomach as much as she could as his hands slid beneath her bosom. Holding her breath, she saw a deep frown settle onto the elder’s face.

“Wot is dis, mon? She ain’t even got any meat on her bones!” the elder coughed and waved the escort off dismissively. “Ya might as well feed her to da raptors!”

Bridgit’s eyes widened in a panic, and she pulled at her chains. “Wait! Feed me!” she cried out. The elder paused and looked her up and down through that glassy stare.

“We ain’t got enough food for ourselves. Why we be feedin’ you, little one?” the shaman leaned on his cane, looming in close to the dwarf’s face.

The rogue pats her relatively flat stomach. “I’ll get fatter than the biggest boar you’ve ever laid eyes on!” she nods emphatically. The elder taps his chin in thought and nods his head to the side in consideration.

“We do got da berries and fruit. Ya eat those things, mon?” the elder’s eyes peered at Bridgit, and she forced a wide smile.

“You bet! I’ll eat just about anything. Give me food and you’ll have to roll me around the village in no time,” she laughed lightly, struggling to make it sound legit.

“Okie dokie,” the elder nodded and flicked his wrist, waving the Dwarf and her escort away. “Ya got a week ta put on twenty pounds,” the shaman added after she began to turn.

A soddin’ week?! Bridgit’s eyes widened with fear. “Y-You can count on me…” Even if she managed to put on that ridiculous amount of weight, she’d be severely handicapped in escaping the village. Dwarves carried their weight well, but every pound of fat was worth one-and-a-half of every human pound.

The elder, pleased to hear that, nodded sagely. “If ya hit that mark we’ll keep ya around to see how big ya get, mon,” the shaman gave her a devious grin, but Bridgit couldn’t argue.

“Aye, consider it done,” she spoke flatly, defeat swallowing her whole. Eating would be her only salvation until she could escape. I’m gonna be bigger than a damn zeppelin...
115212.title: Delayed Gratification

choices: Heart pounding, Bridgit is led to the weigh-in.
Bridgit tries to escape. This could be her last chance!
1152121.content:
Whump!

Bridgit groaned, eyeing the heaping bowl of fruit and berries. "Bloody hell. Already?" It had only been an hour since her last feeding, after all, and she could swear the bowls got bigger every time. She was so stuffed with fruit she felt like a pastry--a particularly fluffy pastry, at that, given how fat she was getting.

The meanest-looking of the guards prodded Bridgit in the chest with his spear. "Fill ya mouth with fruit, not words."

Bridgit struggled to a sitting position and dragged the bowl closer. She was going to have to force it down if she didn't want to be skewered right here. With one hand she shoveled a handful of berries into her mouth, while she hitched up her trousers with the other in a vain attempt to keep her backside from spilling over the rear of her waistband. She was just oozing out of her clothes lately--she couldn't even move without overflowing everywhere.

This has got to be at least twenty pounds, she judged, watching a stray berry fall and bounce off her paunch. She told herself that was something to be happy about, but ye gods, to watch her hard-won roguish figure being buried under drifts of fat...!

Somehow, she managed to finish off the every last piece of fruit, leaving the bowl empty save for a few stems and pits.

"There! And you'd better give me--urpp--more of a break this time!" she groused, flopping down on her side and trying to find a comfortable position. Her stomach was so distended she might actually burst if they tried to force more into her.

"No more until tonight," the guard agreed. Bridgit heaved a sigh of relief. Finally, a chance for her poor overloaded digestive system to catch up!

"Tonight, we weight joo in," the guard continued. "See if it's worth it to keep stuffin' ya. Don' wan ya bloated for that, do we? We wanna know how much meat ja added, afta all, not how much ja belly holds."

Bridgit felt cold. If that "meat" didn't equal at least twenty pounds, then--

But it must, she thought. Just look at me! I've packed on pounds to spare...haven't I?
1152121.title: Bridgit is forced to eat berries and fruit all ...

choices: Bridgit awakens at a shrine, surrounded by witch doctors and food.
Bridgit awakens in a different location, but must play by the trolls' rules.
11521211.content:
The sun crept along the sky, casting longer and longer shadows through the slits in the tent. Having settled into her cushioned, sedentary lifestyle here, Bridgit almost felt contentment in her situation. That is, aside from the nagging notion that her week of feasting and sleeping drew near its end. Ironically, the plump dwarf wished she had more food or drink to fill her belly before the weigh-in. Cannibalism at the hands of trolls was NOT how she planned to go out.

A gurgle churned through Bridgit, forcing a hand to her round stomach. By the Light, she felt enormous. Her fingers traced along the newly-formed crease across her side. Rolls. She had rolls. She couldn’t return to the Explorer’s League looking like this. And yet… she hoped she’d lived up to her boasting. The dwarf rolled onto her side and stroked the dome of her gut. Even after hours of digesting, those sweet fruits still left her bloated beyond belief.

Heavy footsteps approached, and a raptor’s screech roused Bridgit from her gluttonous stupor. Sitting up proved an effort, but with a grunt she made it upright. Her breasts heaved over her leather cups, all that remained after pounds of flesh tore it asunder. They damn well almost reached her softened chin.

“Oy, mon. She in ‘dere?” said a troll outside the tent. An affirmative grunt preceded the parting flap. A new troll she’d not met before entered and crouched in front of her. “Dis girlie lookin’ mighty fat!” he belted out a gravelly laugh and prodded her belly with one finger. She flushed as the flesh sunk in like bread dough. “I tink de eldar will be pleased.” Bridgit could have sworn he gave her a wink after that.

“You think so?” she asked, face still red. She clutched her belly and wobbled it for good measure. Her face burned with humiliation. She could feel the flab smothering her thick arms jiggle as she shook herself for the trolls.

The silent troll in the back licked his lips, eyeing her like a roast. The crouched troll nodded. “Ya, girlie. Ya be lookin’ mighty tasty now.”

“My name is Bridgit,” she spat, sticking a wet glob to his cheek. He smeared it off, but smudged some of his warpaint in the process.

“All righ’, Bridgit. Let’s see wot de eldar tinks of ya,” he growled and seized her by one, fleshy arm. He hoisted her to her feet, and she swayed, unaccustomed to her added weight. How in the world was she supposed to sneak anywhere like this? He bound her wrists and fastened a leash to the saddle of his raptor. Bridgit squeaked with surprise when he hefted her onto the raptor’s back. This brought a small smile to her face, as they left her barefoot to prevent escape.

“We wouldn’ want ya to waste any energy now, girlie,” he laughed again. The raptor lurched forward before settling into a trot as her smudged captor strolled beside it. Each bump sent Bridgit’s bosom quivering in her tattered top. Her trembling belly flesh peeked through numerous torn seams.

While passing through the village, she noticed the general slenderness of its inhabitants. They all looked hungry. Bridgit shuddered at the notion of being sized up for feasting. Thankfully, it didn’t take long to reach the elder’s hut. Soon her fears would be delayed or made a reality. The dwarf breathed slowly, but her heart raced in her chest. Her smudged chaperone sunk his fingers into her soft love handles before dismounting the dwarf from the saddle. She cringed as her toes sunk into the cold, muddy earth.

Before Bridgit stood the elder’s lodge, a tall, narrow tent. Blue smoke belched from the peak at the top of the fabric canopy, and wisps of fog curled out from the parted flaps. The raptor troll nudged the plump dwarf forward toward the lodge. Swallowing hard, she waddled into the foggy darkness. At first, she saw only a campfire at the center, but it burned with dreamy, blue flame. A thick, blue smoke filled the room with the smell of spiced, incense.

“A week, as agreed,” she heard the elder croak. He appeared from within the fog and stooped low, admiring the dwarf. She stumbled back and bumped into a wooden table. How did she miss that? The elder stretched forth a gnarled hand and began inspecting her body, this time beginning with the small beginnings of a double chin. He slid his hand down her neck and cupped a breast, raising his eyebrows. “Ohhh, ya feel fuller already… but are ya worthy?” he furrowed his brow and began sliding his hand lower.

In a reversal of last week, she muffled a grunt and stuck out her belly as far as she could, trying to appear heavier. The old shaman paused as he reached her stomach, his mouth falling agape. Slowly, with the utmost scrutiny, his fingers coursed over her plush dome of flesh, cheekily slipping one claw into her deep navel before continuing down. Bridgit quietly exhaled, and the elder gripped the doughy, dimpled meat of Bridgit’s backside in one hand. His chuckles and blind nods eased some of Bridgit’s tension. He leaned on his staff and let out a sharp whistle. The flaps parted and the smudged countenance of her captor appeared.

“Da spirits have spoken, brotha,” the elder spoke, gesturing toward the flabby rogue, “She be da one! After I give her da mojo, you take her to da shrine,” he explained. Wait, mojo? Shrine? Bridgit frowned, but her confusion only gave the elder an opportunity to grab a gourd flask from the table behind her. He popped the cork and plunged the bottle between her full lips. Bridgit floundered, but she was already seated and couldn’t gain the momentum to stand. The viscous, sour elixir hit her tongue and bubbled before sliding down her throat. Stars popped in Bridgit’s vision and her view swayed and spun before melting into darkness...
11521211.title: Scales of Fate

choices: Bridgit decides to indulge in some homestyle cooking and ask questions later.
Bridgit asks to use the washroom and tries to sneak away... despite her weight.
115212111.content:
Interactive Chapter

Bridgit yawned and rubbed her eyes. It immediately came to her attention that she was still mostly naked, save for the strained remnants of her tunic and her split pants. Sitting upright, she gazed across her plump form and saw strange, tribal patterns painted along her limbs and across her belly. She tried to wipe it off, but it didn’t smudge.

Looking beyond herself, Bridget realized she sat atop a raised, cushioned platform in the middle of a troll temple. The angular, stone snake columns were a dead giveaway. As an expert dungeoneer, Bridgit dated the temple in the thousands of years old.

In each cardinal direction she saw a troll robed in colorful, dyed garb. Each bore similar markings to her own. Each knelt in prayer, uttering some incantation in troll tongue. No chains held her in place, but even she recognized her increased girth and the difficulty of standing that accompanies it. Bridgit grabbed a handful of her doughy belly and scoffed. She regained alertness when the elder entered.

“Sezilak, da hungerer! We offa dis dwarf in exchange for a bountiful huntin’ season!” the elder cried out and sliced his hand on a dagger. When he reached out, Bridgit attempted to squirm away, but two burly guards seized her arms and legs. Again a gnarled hand reached toward the dwarf, this time dripping crimson. It smeared a crude symbol around her navel and another across her mouth and chin.

“Please! You don’t have to do this, just let me go!” Bridgit pleaded, to no avail. Her words went unheeded as the ritual continued. The elder joined the chanting, and the torches around the chamber dimmed before erupting into blue flame. The smoke billowed and swirled around the chamber, coalescing into the shape of a long serpent sporting a gaping mouth. Bridgit glanced about the chamber and noticed the smudged warrior. “Help me! Please help--” but her words cut off as the smoke serpent dove down her throat. Winding and coursing, it filled her belly, growing it inch by inch. The guards released her as the dwarf found herself pinned beneath her engorged gut. The smoke filled her body with an intense warmth.

A luxurious fog filled Bridgit’s mind. Her glazed eyes glanced down and beheld her form. She saw her body filled out, bloated like a bountiful wineskin. Deep churning reminded the dwarf of the smoky spirit that filled her stomach. Despite her groggy state, she guessed her belly jutted out another half-foot at least. Sneaking seemed less and less like a viable escape plan.

“You survived da ordeal and accepted da spirit. Dere’s a loa dwellin’ in ya belly, dwarf,” the elder croaked and once more leaned on his staff. Two of the colorful priests approached and mended his wounded hand. “Sezilak be a fickle loa. He always be hungry, but he rewards us wit’ plenty to eat ourselves.”

“What… what did you do to me?” Bridgit groaned and clapped a hand to her swollen stomach. She easily looked nine months with child, and another surge from within made her shiver with unease at that comparison. The elder pointed the head of his staff at the ring of paint around the fattened dwarf’s navel. The paint now glowed. A priest held up a mirror and Bridgit saw the ring around her mouth and chin glowed as well.

“You bear da loa of gluttony, girlie,” the elder chuckled before turning about to leave. The north, south, east, and west priestesses approached bearing wooden platters of various fruits and meats. Meat! She hadn’t had a good hock of meat in over a week. She could taste the beer-basted boar’s ribs back in Kharanos already. This looked to be local boar, but it would be a welcome change from the fruit stuffing she’d been gobbling up for days on end. Regardless, Bridgit glanced around for an exit. She noticed a long hallway beyond the platter-bearing priests and pondered her options. The tantalizing scent of roast pork, fresh bread, and baked beans whetted Bridgit’s appetite anew as her stomach rumbled in anticipation. She had to think fast before her painted belly made the decision.
