12422.content:
Belda Rosewhisper is one of the most regal and respected elves in Blood Elf society, and has the personality and apparel to show it off. Though over the years, she has grown very lazy, and turned to eating. She had a very high metabolism, and could eat vast amounts of food and not show off any weight change.
Though one day, her metabolism wore off, and she began to gain weight. When she first noticed this, her regular dresses were not fitting. So, she just bought bigger ones. At first, Belda thought it was just her body growing, but it was really just her belly.
At the moment, she weighs around 320 pounds, and she still refuses to believe she is fat. She still wears most of her old gowns and dresses, and she still eats as much as she normally ate before the gain.

She was, one day, laying down by her pool on 2 lawn chairs, getting a 'Tan', when...
12422.title: Overeating

choices: Fast Gaining
Slow Gaining
1243.content:
Sylvia Embersworn, young paladin in training. A bright and bubbly personality, eager to seek out justice and right the wrongs of the world. Despite the end result, she means well. Caring and nurturing. Though her extreme optimize leads to being a bit naïve. Prone to being taken advantage of in the wide open world.

Sylvia is quickly described as average build for her kind, weighing in at a petite 130, she's got a bit of tone on her 5'6" frame. Glowing green eyes, a staple of her people, and a mid length cut of black hair that's almost always tied back in a loose ponytail. The rest is to be established as you go!

Now to get a bit of story planning going... Fast or slow gaining! Then a selection of forced or intentional.
1243.title: An aspiring adventurer!

choices: Forced
Intentional/Accidental
12431.content:
Pounds will be added on quickly! Now for Forced VS Intentional/Accidental.

Forced will include, well force feedings and the like, as well as fattening against her will entirely
Intentional/Accidental will either be a secret love for gaining, or the consequences of over eating (Or accidentally cursing herself and the like)
12431.title: Fast Gaining

choices: Visit townhall for fact finding
Ret for the evening at the local inn
124311.content:
Sylvia Embersworn, trainee under the Blood Elf paladin order was just given one of her first quests; Find and destroy the unknown corruption recently rooted in a small Eversong village known as Brightwatch. Recent reports tell of something amiss in the surrounding forest. Livestock has gone missing and strange noises could be heard in the night hours leading up to the missing animals. Dragonhawk scouts were sent in to investigate via the local rangers, but none returned.

Sylvia's higher-ups deemed it the work of some stray undead that must've made it's way unnoticed for some time. Just to be sure, another trainee was sent to aid, the slightly higher ranking Lysa Dawnheart. The two were sent with anything they'll need, and some extra provisions, should they need it. Each outfitted in thick plate armor, sacred texts and wards written in thick parchment adorn the trim of the armor. Each student mounted upon red hawkstriders.

"We've been traveling for nearly two days, it's gotta be close." Sylvia complained, pulling up her crimson hood over her wet black hair. The weather's been muggy the last week in the western side of Eversong.

"Yeah, I have a good feeling it's riiiight under our noses..." Lysa pointed to the nearby fork in the road. "There, it should be right around the bend to the right." Their view of the rode past the turn was limited, the forest was dense here and the fallen leaves didn't aid the situation. The pair trotted on down the path until they were met with an open gate.

"Alright, we only brought enough food for a short stay, so let's pick exactly where we're going, Lysa.", Sylvia was eager to right the evil and get out of here, it was already giving her the creeps...
124311.title: First quest...

choices: The Strange Man, maybe talk with him. See what he knows.
By the bar, and have a drink.
1243112.content:
Sylvia and Lysa agree that it's been a long journey, and they deserve a rest.
They both head into the inn, and it's rather empty. With only the Innkeeper, and a strange, hooded man, sitting at an isolated table.

"I'll go book us a room, you can relax." Lysa assured Sylvia, as she went off to the innkeeper.
Sylvia, nodding, headed to sit down by...
1243112.title: Local inn.

choices: Sylvia got ready for bed and gets a good rest, eager to start the next day
Someone or something interupts her sleep, perhaps the forest anomaly?
12431121.content:
Sylvia elected to sit next to the hooded man... he could be a nice guy, right? She pulled up a seat across from the strange man. "So uh... I heard the town needed some help?" Sylvia smiled awkwardly, clearly a bit disgruntled by his appearance. But she was determined to move past her judgments. She tapped her fingers on the table to break the silence, "Lysa and I are here to see what's going on out here, and hopefully stop it... we're uh, paladins." She pulled at a written blessing hanging from her shoulder plate, "See?" The man clearly wasn't having any of this girl's conversation. "Do you have any information to pass on? We'd like to leave as quickly as we solve your woes." She waited for his answer, if he'd even give one.

The stranger grunted under his hood, she was getting on his nerves, "I don't know a thing, but I do know that it always strikes at night, deep in the forest. Maybe you should look there." he answered, if only to shut her up. He got up and moved to a table in the other corner. "Now if you'll leave me to my drink." She won't be getting anything else outta him. Sylvia slumped down with her chin on the wooden table.

'He only said that to get me to stop talking...' She thought. Sighing and getting up, she could see Lysa finish up their room order, waving the younger elf over.

"Alright, we've got the top floor, second to the right." Sylvia nodded, taking the key held out in front of her. Admittingly, they both really needed to rest after the ride in...
12431121.title: Not a whole lot of company to choose from...

choices: Lysa woke up, and saw the wound.
Sylvia covered the wound in a linen wrap, and went to sleep.
124311212.content:
While Sylvia rested, a noise awoke her in the middle of the night. It sounded like the howl of a of some sort of beast she couldn't make out.
Sylvia attempted to wake up Lysa, but was only received a brush off the shoulder from her companion, who was too sleepy to bother to get up.

Sylvia borrowed a lantern from the inn, but didn't bother to put on her armor and stay in her casual clothes, whatever it was, it couldn't be that bad, she deducted.
She took a few steps into the forest, to see if she could find what was making those noises. The Lantern did little to illuminate the darkness of the forest, but when Sylvia heard the sounds of bushes rustling, she went near a bush that stood out in the woods.
Then, a shadowed, 4-legged creature leapt from the bush, and attacked Sylvia. She tried to defend herself, but the beast was too swift. It took a bite from her side, leaving a very unique wound on her body, and then simply ran off into the dark forest.
Sylvia dared not go after it, not with this wound and little armor.

She crept back in her room, trying to keep the wound concealed, and went to the first aid box to heal it.
124311212.title: Noises from the forest.

choices: Wake up for a day of investigation (She may or may not tell Lysa what happened)
That mark sure was odd...
1243112122.content:
Sylvia scorned her course of action, "You shouldn't have gone out alone! Stupid, stupid." She rubbed at her temples in anger. In their setup, they had a small washroom that she crept in after she had pulled the medical kit out from her traveling knapsack. She knew some basic healing spells, but dressing and cleaning a wound before sealing it was the recommended course of action. She lit the candle next to the mirror after closing the door. She didn't want to worry Lysa at this hour. "It looks a bit odd though doesn't it..." she noted, now seeing it in the light. It was more of a strange pattern that barely broke skin, a marking almost. Sylvia washed the tiny bit of blood present and recalled what happened; Late at night, odd howling, and a strange 'bite'. It wasn't a wolf, that much she was sure, especially after feeling it bite down. It felt almost... soft, as if she were attacked by something made of jelly? Whatever it was, it wasn't in her beastiary from class.

She knew going out was wrong and that she should've waited till morning, or at least woke up her companion. The attack surprised her more than anything, she was expecting... something more deadly at least. She counted herself lucky however, it could've gone much-much worse. Sylvia patched her mark with a square of linen, she secured it with a few small pieces of 'Gadgetzan Sticky Strips'. "That should do then trick. Hopefully we can learn more in the morning..." She put out the candle and walked back to bed, slightly light-headed, but she figured it was from the sprint back into town. She slumped down on her featherbed, settling in to finish up her sleep...
1243112122.title: Wounded

choices: During breakfast...
After breakfast, when they patrol the forest...
12431121222.content:
Sylvia awoke, feeling something strange resonating from her wounded area.
She didn't see Lysa, who probably was outside waiting for her. But first, Sylvia needed to check on her wound...
She went into the bathroom, and when she looked in the mirror, she noticed that she was a bit chubbier. "Huh. That's odd, I don't recall eating THAT much since last night..." Sylvia remarked, poking small belly.

"Sylvia! What're you waiting for, get down here!" Lysa called up to Sylvia, who responded, "Just a minute! Let me get my armor on..."
Luckily, Sylvia's sudden gain hadn't had much effect on her armor... yet. Hopefully this wouldn't be too much of a problem...

"Sorry for the wait. Now, what's first on our schedule?" Sylvia wondered.
"Well, after breakfast, we're gonna head into the forest and patrol the pathway. See if there's anything we can find." Lysa explained.
Sylvia jumped at the sound of returning to the forest, but she kept a calm demeanor.
12431121222.title: That mark sure was odd...

choices: Order two basic meals; enough to keep both girls fed!
Order some extra food... for the road!
124311212221.content:
"Alright, well... Breakfast it is then; most important meal of the day, right?" Sylvia gave an awkward giggle, scratching the back of her head. Breakfast sounded good, especially as an alternative to searching the forest straight away, the paladin wasn't sure she was ready for that since the Incident' the night before. "Gives us time to prepare, yeah?" She reinforced the idea of a delayed departure into the woods, if only for herself. However, her stomach was more focused on the idea of the food she needed as it let loose a low growl, demanding it's emptiness be seen to. 'Huh... Not normally this hungry in the morning...' Sylvia pondered, trying in vane to sooth her upset midsection with some tender rubs.

"Yeah, sure thing. But it sounds like YOU need the meal more than anything." Lysa teased, pointing at Sylvia's seemingly angry stomach. "Got quite the appetite this morning; tell yah what..." Lysa started off, holding Sylvia by the shoulders, "You go order up some food and I'll get some hunting supplies? I should be back by the time it's done." Sylvia's fellow paladin laid it out in an almost quizzical voice.

Sylvia nodded her head in response, "Alright, sounds good to me. Just uh, having a tough morning." Sylvia rationalized, her voice clearly showing some sort of hesitation and anxiousness towards Lysa. "I'm getting enough for us both, but no guarantees yours will still be here when you come back!" The paladin's stomach growled on queue, emphasizing her jest enough to crack a giggle from Lysa.

"Oh, there'd better be something left for me," the other paladin turned to walk out the door, waving her hand behind her, leaving Sylvia on her own to order up some grub. The inn wasn't exactly bustling this morning with maybe one or two patrons up and about, plenty enough privacy for the elf in question to stay relaxed; as relaxed as possible considering her unusually high strung appetite at the moment...
124311212221.title: A hearty start to the day

choices: Sylvia orders another meal.
Sylvia gets the wound inspected by a Professional.
1243112122211.content:
Sylvia just ordered simple meals, nothing too fancy. When Lysa returned, she came back with Water, Bags and Notebooks to record sightings.
Sylvia, despite intentionally giving herself a larger meal, wasn't satisfied with what she had. She devoured her meal quickly, but wasn't sated. Lysa, on the other hand, was ready to go after her meal, so Sylvia didn't want to hold her up.

They went off into the forest on their Hawkstriders, making note of their surroundings. The forest was, as usual, very dark, despite it being late dawn. The sun shot in through a few patches, but it was only enough to see the wildlife grow, what little there was in the first place.
Sylvia tried to mask her stomach growlings as animals, but it was becoming more apparent to Lysa that Sylvia was hungry.
"Sylvia, I don't want you to feel ashamed of eating more than me if you have to. No point going out on patrol on an empty stomach!" Lysa offered politely.
Sylvia thanked Lysa, but refused. "I won't have my friend be caught alone, unguarded in these dangerous woods." Sylvia responded, she didn't want the same thing to happen to Lysa as what happened to her.
But Lysa was persistent, "We don't break for lunch in 6 hours! If those growls you claimed to be bears and wolves were your stomach, it is in pain. You need to get something in that belly of yours."
Sylvia sighs, giving in and heading back to the town.

As Sylvia returns, she orders a similarly sized meal, hoping it would be enough to sate her hunger for the day. However, when she looks at her wound, she see's it glow an ominous purple. She wonders if it has anything to do with her expanded appetite as of late, but there is no time to think about that when she gets her meal.
She begins eating, leaving nothing to waste. This time she's not eating hastily out of hunger, but to finish up to keep pace with Lysa. She didn't want to spend the next 6 hours eating, that'd make her seem lazy! Not to mention how much she'd gain...

Sylvia finishes her meal, taking many deep breaths. Her belly makes her armor tight, so she loosens it a bit to allow her belly to relax.
"Whoof... didn't know I needed THAT much..." Sylvia stated, looking upon the remains of her meal.
But just as Sylvia gets up to leave, her belly growls again.
"Oh, no, I can't still be hungry!" Sylvia complains, "There's got to be something about this... was it that wound I got last night?"
1243112122211.title: Order two basic meals; enough to keep both girl...

choices: "I've Never Seen That Before..."
"Huh, that's new."
12431121222112.content:
"Alright... this isn't natural, and not in any way that's good." Sylvia monologued, slowly standing from her seat, placing a shaky hand on the table for support. Despite how hungry she was, she was stuffed and it wasn't going to be easy getting around. "Can't sit around eating till I have to sleep it off, I need to check this out." She lifted her bandage once more, seeing it's glow slightly more intense since the last time she checked, eliciting a gulp of ever so slight panic. She knew there was a local magister in town, just down the street in fact! If she got it figured out soon, she'd be able to rejoin Lysa back in the field before none was the wiser, the idea of a glowing circular wound only a mere memory.

Off Sylvia went, cradling her overfed middle as she walked down the street, to the seemingly professional's home. The tower was much like any of Blood Elven architecture; spiraling stairs, wispy blue drapes, domed ceilings, all that. With a steady wrap of the wrist, Sylvia knocked on the magister's door, awaiting some sort of answer.

From inside, Sylvia heard all manner of cursing and babbling, "Yes yes, who is it?" She heard a voice from her side, a small lawn golem standing at attention with their voice carrying over via scratchy reception. Puzzled, the paladin leaned down in front of it.

"You're not the... local magister, are you?" She asked, looking at it in the eyes with perked eyebrows.
With a sigh, the owner of the house returned, "No, this is just the message golem, now who are you; what do you want?" The voice grew more impatient, the golem tapping it's foot in emphasis.
Standing back up to her normal posture, Sylvia answered, "I'm Paladin Sylvia, here on a contract to find the beast lurking in the forest!" She sounded off, valiantly giving a salute. "Which is why I'm here... I was struck by the beast and was given this..." The paladin lifted her bandage to reveal the glowing circles of light, "Got it last night, and my hunger's been uncontrollable since... hence this." She pointed to her curved tummy, packed tight with food. "Any way you can help me?" Sylvia asked with a shrug.
12431121222112.title: Enough is Enough

choices: Sylvia asks Lysa to help.
Sylvia decides to collect the DNA alone.
124311212221122.content:
"Hm, strange. Never seen it do this before..." The voice said, in a confused manner.
"So you've seen this marking before?" Sylvia asked.
The Golem shut down, and an Elf with long, white hair emerged from the door in front of her.
"I am Magister Dolvarr, come inside and I'll explain." He greeted finally, rushing Sylvia inside.

"You see, I used to be an adventurer, coming to this land in search of cleansing it of whatever problem it had. However, I noticed that the problem was that certain individuals were slowly starving themselves, until they just fell down dead." The Magister explained, pulling out papers of reports, and images of examples.
"So, what happened?" Sylvia asked.
"Well, I found out that the creature causing the starvation was a beast known as Taukivilks, a large, feral-like creature that often is mistaken for a Wolf, or a Dog. It only appears in shadows, and has no true physical form in the light. But when it bit a creature, it would cause that creature to be unable to eat any sort of food." Magister Dolvarr explained.
"So what does this have to do with my problem?" Sylvia asked again.
"I managed to catch a sample of the creature's DNA, and managed to reverse it. I gave this antidote to everyone in town, as it cancelled out the curse of Starvation with the Curse of Hunger. But, strange enough, it seems as if this Shadow Wolf has evolved into a different breed, one that makes people eternally hungry." Magister Dolvarr stated.
Sylvia panicked, "R-really? Well, can't you just reverse the DNA sample you have now and give it to me as a cure?"
"I'm afraid not. DNA can only be reversed once, and since the DNA I have has been reversed already, it will not work. However, if you could catch this Shadow Hound, you may be able to catch some of it's DNA, and it will allow me to create a cure." Magister Dolvarr stated.
"Well, alright. I'll just go out and..."
"No! No, you can't do it alone. If you're bitten again, it'll start corrupting your mind and make you think about nothing but eating, and you'll never be cured. You'll need... another." Magister Dolvarr mentioned.

Sylvia could get Lysa to help, but what if they failed to get the DNA? Then she would be stuck forever hungry like she was... she wanted to do this alone and not drag Lysa into this, but she did need another person...
124311212221122.title: Magister Dolvarr

choices: "You're gonna have to sit it out and wait for her, sorry."
"I've got something that might help you find her..."
1243112122211221.content:
Sylvia was at a crossroads; her recklessness the night before looked like it was going to be hard to remove. She couldn't do it alone, not with such high risks. A betting person wouldn't count on her odds alone. If anything had to be done, Lysa needed to be involved one way or another. As much as Sylvia didn't want to pressure her friend into a possible similar fate, she was at wits end. Losing her mind in some kind of hunger frenzy? No thanks, that just won't fly. It didn't take long until she came to the conclusion that she'd need to reach out to Lysa. She was out and about searching for the beast anyway, and there's no way her friend would simply leave it all to her. They came as a team, and they're gonna leave as one!

"Alright, alright, I need help..." Sylvia admitted, drooping her head down, "I know I can't do it myself, that'd be asking too much, and realistically, I'd just get bit again in my current state." Sylvia felt her full stomach rumble, asking for more already. "My partner arrived with me, and we're here to stop the beast anyway." With a huff, Sylvia sat down at a nearby chair, "But I'm not sure how I can get to her right now, seeing as she's out there searching right now..."

The magister simply nodded, "Well, that is quite the dilemma, isn't it?" He took a seat next to her, "But believe me, I'd help if I could, but I'm not as young as I used to be." He gave a chuckle, "Not quite the springstrider these days." He gave a fake cough, as if he was trying not to involve himself with the beast. It was a bit too dangerous for him to consider going out to face it, despite what the townsfolk might be running into down the road...
1243112122211221.title: Dragging Someone Else In...

choices: ...It was the Distress Signal!
...A message back from Lysa was waiting for them.
12431121222112212.content:
"However, I do have a little friend who is great at tracking Elves down..." The Magister said as he pulled out a small, crystal-like device.
"What is that?" Sylvia asked.
"This is a Tracking Prism, I've designed it myself. All we need do is send a message to her, and the Prism will search all throughout this area for her." The Magister explained.
"Ah, great! I'll just send her a message to come back, and the Prism can lead her back here, right?" Sylvia asked.
"Unfortunately, no." The Magister responded apologetically, "But she will be able to send a message back, assuming she's in a safe situation. If the Prism cannot find her, or she isn't able to send a message, it returns with a Distress Signal. But, it uses stealth magic, so it cannot be detected until it reaches it's destination, for safety precautions."
"Well, that's a kick in the pants." Sylvia growled, "But I suppose it'll be better than waiting."

Sylvia recorded the message, and when she finished, the Prism vanished in a flash of purple energy.
"And now, we wait for it to return." The Magister stated, smiling. He had high hopes this would work.
"So, what do you want to do while we wait?" Sylvia asked.
"Hmm... Hearthstone?" The Magister offered.
"Alright, just don't choose Warlock." Sylvia stated begrudgingly.

They waited for nearly 2 hours until the Prism returned...
12431121222112212.title: Tracking Prism

choices: You're on your own, kid.
Im coming with, let's go!
124311212221122121.content:
Sylvia's game with the magister continued for hours, ending in both victory and failure, but mostly the latter. "Guh, Docter Boom again?!" The paladin pulled on her hair, slightly outraged at her opponent's deck, who clearly spent more gold for cards. "It's all about the deck, huh?" She fumed, puffing hair from her face.

The magister was having just about the opposite experience, laughing and grinning the whole way through, "No no, it's all about skill, my dear." He slammed down another card, "Yeah, let's see what Big Game Hunter has to say about THAT!" He cheered, finishing off Sylvia once more. "Had enough yet?" He asked, clearly pleased with himself.

"I'm good, thanks." Sylvia dismissed the old man, no more of that. "Say, the priam should be back by now, right?" She asked, picking up her chin as she thumbed through her pitiful deck of cards.
"Hmm... Really should of heard SOMETHING by now..." He quarreled, stroking at his long beard, showing clear practice at the whole, 'wizened mystic' thing.

As if by... Well, magic; the prism poofed back in a plume of smoke, except this time it came with a deep shade of red, chiming a little alarm, "That doesn't sound good!" Sylvia stood from her seat, clutching her heart in panic, "What's that mean, is she okay?" Her voice quickened in pace.
"Well, its the distress beacon... Ready for a little road trip? It looks like it marked her position, at least. So there's a lead to follow." The magister kept his calm demeanor as he spoke.

"Alright... We've gotta go get her!" She cried, worried dearly for her friend's safety. Light, why'd she have to leave in the middle of the night?
124311212221122121.title: Distress!

choices: The Shadow Wolf!
Lysa, playfully tackling her.
A complete stranger, mistaking Sylvia for a Night Elf (Or an Ogre.)
1243112122211221211.content:
"I'm sorry, but I've got a meeting with, uhm... the Grand Magister Society in the morning. I must get some rest." the Magister snored, trying to give a convincing tired expression.
Sylvia rolled her eyes at the Old Elf's pitiful excuse, but she didn't have time to convince this old Elf to come along. He'd be a hindrance anyway.
"Alright, lazy. I guess I'll go after my friend alone, and possibly go Food Crazy." Sylvia stated, in an annoyed tone.
The Magister waved as she ran off into the forest to find her friend.

"LYSAAAA! LYYYYYSAA!" Sylvia called out into the wilderness, but it was of no use. Lysa wasn't responding, if she was out there at all.
Sylvia worried, wondering where Lysa could've gone. What if she got bitten by the Wolf, and is now stuck, eating food and getting fatter by the second? This filled Sylvia with pure fear and worry, and so she made her Hawkstrider ride faster.
The Hawkstrider, however, was getting tired of carrying around Sylvia's fat body, and was unable to go any faster.
"Hurry up, you stupid Bird! Lysa could be dead, don't you care?" Sylvia then slapped the Hawkstrider, which made the Hawkstrider so angry, it used all of it's might to push Sylvia off, and ran off back to town.
"No good, sunova... Where am I?" Sylvia's anger soon shifted into fear, as she realized she was lost in the woods.

Sylvia tried to follow the Hawkstrider's clawprints, but they were lost when the wind picked up, and blew the prints away.
Bushes rustled, owls hooted, and all throughout the forest the smallest sounds became life threatening.
"Just remember your training... there must be something from Paladin School I learned that had to do with Wilderness Survival!" Sylvia said, thinking back...

Flashback...

"Alright, Recruits. If you ever find yourself in a situation where you're trapped in the middle of the forest, without your partner, a map, Hearthstone or Mount, just remember... the last thing you want to do is sit there and reminisce about this Training School. You need to stay on the move, and always stay on guard, I SEE YOU THERE! GET MOVING! This flashback will help only for you to get eaten by that Wolf! THAT IS AN ORDER, RECRUIT!"

"Uhm... what?"

"Trust me, it'll make sense when you're trapped in this situation."


"...Well, I'll be damned, I guess he was right." Sylvia thought to herself.
But just then, something leaped out from behind the bushes. It was...
1243112122211221211.title: Going solo

choices: Lashing out and biting! The beast makes it's move!
The beast backs off when all seemed to be lost.
12431121222112212111.content:
Sylvia's flashback proved to be true, the bush rustling and seemingly growling at her. "G-Good beast of darkness, good..." She walked backwards slowly with arms razed. Slowly the beast crept into sight, blending in with the surrounding darkness. Without warning it leapt forward, right in front of Sylvia, her face flushing of all color and nearing fainting. "Good doggy..." She muttered, stepping back till her heels scrapped the the bark of a tree. There was nothing she feared more than what was right in front of her at this very moment.

It let loose a low growl, it's eyes glowing in sharp contrast to it's surroundings. It was almost taunting Sylvia, or maybe it was something else, but it didn't lash out immediately like before... it's canines on full display. "Now, don't do anything rash, a-alright?" She reasoned, her voice hitching several times, her heart felt like it was in her feet. She tried her best not to have a heart attack on the spot...
12431121222112212111.title: Foreshadowiiiing

choices: It was the Tracking Prism, a message from the Magister.
It was the prowling eyes of the Shadow Wolf, stalking it's prey.
124311212221122121111.content:
The Wolf leaps out for Sylvia, and she panics and flees. The Wolf calls for its friends, and they all chase after Sylvia.
It was hard for Sylvia to run on account of her weight, but the Wolves aren't that fast to begin with. She manages to keep some distance, but she's getting winded pretty fast.
She slows down, but notices the wolves are catching up. Sylvia gulps, preparing for the wolves to attack. She hoped the Wolves, like last night, would just bite her and leave her be. But then she'd go Food Crazy...

Sylvia, in a moment of epiphany, remembered something the Magister said, these Shadow Wolfs would disappear in the Light! She was a Paladin, she could use one of her spells to defend herself!
The Wolves leap out at Sylvia, but she casts Consecrate, making the wolves blast backward. The light shields Sylvia from the wolves, and they eventually give up and flee into the forest.
Sylvia smiled, thinking she outsmarted the Wolves. But then she realized, she'd have to keep casting Consecrate with each few steps. It'd be draining on her power, and she's already pretty tired, but she had to do it for any hope of survival.

Step, step, step, VWOOSH!... Step, step step, VWOOSH! This was what Sylvia had to listen to as she moved along the path, her belly also aiding her in the sounds. But luckily, no animal at night would go towards a bright light, animals in these parts focus more on the darkness.
Sylvia grows too tired to move, after about an hour of walking, and is forced to sit down. She thinks the wolves would've been scared off from her by now, so she felt safe.

Just then, she saw a faint glimmer in the distance... what could it be?
124311212221122121111.title: Vicious Beast!

choices: The wolves close in...
Someone/thing bursts out of the dark, her deus ex machina!
1243112122211221211112.content:
Sylvia panted on her seat; a particularly thick root that functioned great for a resting spot. Leaves blew all around her, sweeping up her hair in strong winds. She felt dead inside. Her breath was shot, her feet hurt... her mana was pretty much depleted... that stupid bird didn't even leave her with a drink of water... She wiped at her forehead, crisp in a layer of sweat. There's no way they would find her all this way, she didn't hear them snarling in quite a while, "Where, no more of those things. Dumb shadows..." She groaned. Her foodstuffed belly was still rather cumbersome, and she was getting a stich in her side. "All those years of training, for this." She pinched at her middle and winced. As she was distracted, a light grew in the distance...
a light that started to multiply into a few more pairs...
All the while, Sylvia was preoccupied with her whining.
Sylvia gave a deep sigh, standing from her little stoop, as ready as she'd ever be to start off again. But as she stretched, her eyes caught glimpse of a wavering group of shimmers. Sylvia's fear was reborn anew, they were all around her, in every direction. No matter where she'd be able to run, a beast was waiting. "W-Was this their plan...?" Her heart raced once more, her legs didn't feel so steady all of a sudden. The paladin collapsed back on the root, burying her face in her hands.
1243112122211221211112.title: Relentless in the Hunt

choices: Someone appeared in the distance.
She smelled something delicious.
12431121222112212111121.content:
The Wolves snarl, growling as they pace around the chubby elf. Sylvia was doomed, but she was willing to accept it now. She at least put up a fight.
But the Wolves want to toy with Sylvia, despite their hunter-like instincts telling them to go for the throat, they decide it'd be more fun to watch this one suffer.
They vanish into the shadows, making Sylvia think she's finally free.
"Thank goodness they've left... wait, this may be another trap." Sylvia stated, and she stayed put.
The wolves sneaked up behind Sylvia, and one of them held up their paw, as a way of indicating them time. 3 toes go up, then 2, then 1, and then they are roar loudly behind Sylvia, causing her to leap up in fear and fall on her back. The weight of her and her armor are too heavy for her to lift herself back up. She was trapped!
The Wolves circle Sylvia, and after they let out a howl to the Moon trapped behind mound of leaves, they all bite down on Sylvia's exposed stomach, and she faints due to the pain.

"Nnggh... huh... what?" Sylvia looks around her, she is in an unknown environment. It seems to be a bright clearing in a forest, but not the forest she knew. It was.. the Eversong Woods? The Trees had glowing, orange leaves, and were twisted beautifully. But her belly bore the marks of now five bites, but they were not glowing... yet. They were pure black, which meant Sylvia still had a few moments of Sanity before she went completely food crazy. But why was she in the Eversong Woods?

She spent a few moments pondering, until...
12431121222112212111121.title: The wolves close in...

choices: The light warns Sylvia of a trap
The light comes in close for a soft embrace
124311212221122121111211.content:
Sylvia felt really weird, to put it simply anyway. Everything felt both light and heavy at the same time, weighty overall. Her vision felt foggy... No, hazy. Everything had a warm haze about it, every tree's leaves almost giving off a glare. She felt warm, like a hot spring in the winter. Sshe waved her hand at her neck, it felt like she was sweating, even though she wasn't... "Whooaaa..." Was all she could manage. She almost felt tipsy, everything made her smile in the oddest way.

"Where am I?" She called to herself, her voice almost in a murmur. She tried to walk forward, but it just didn't... Feel right? Her mind was telling her to snap out of it, by everything else told her this was real. The ground felt like it was shaking, but it looked perfectly still. Up ahead was an especially warm blue light, calling out to her.

"Sylviaaa..." It sung, it's tone warm and resounding. The whole forest seemed to chime alive at the call, insects and animals working into a rhythm. The light started to become more defined the more Sylvia watched it, "Sylviaaa.." It called once more, in a far more familiar tone. It took a moment for the bewildered paladin to process it, that was Lysa!

"Lysa, is that you?" She asked, her voice came out louder than she expected, but it didn't sway the light. It grew into a define female figure, the one of Lysa. Looking just like a doppleganger, the blue light walked straight up to Sylvia, no other color but the ocean blue. "What're you doing here?"
124311212221122121111211.title: Who's that... over there...

choices: Sylvia finds a way across the large gap.
Sylvia is given aid from her Conscience.
1243112122211221211112111.content:
"Sylvia... You are trapped in your mind. You are currently passed out in the middle of the road, and are slowly expanding with fat. In order to escape this, you must find the Lands of Consciousness." The Blue Light explained, in a voice similar to Lysa.
"The Lands of... what?" Sylvia asked, "This is sounding very convoluted."
"You must trust me, for I am your Conscience. I take the form of the one you trust the most, to make you seem more calm." The Light comforted.
"Alright, I trust you. I'll go find this land, but how will I find it?" Sylvia asked.
The Light pointed towards a sign that read, "Lands of Consciousness", and then faded away without another word.
Sylvia knew she had to be swift, she didn't want to be trapped here forever, nor did she want to leave behind such a bloated corpse.

She traveled through many lands, her weight not slowing her down a bit. It took quite a long while, but she managed to find the Lands of Consciousness. But something was wrong, she was met with a dark, purple Voidwalker-like creature that was corrupting the lands.
She viewed what has happened from beyond a gap, connected by a bridge that was destroyed.
"How will I ever get across?" Sylvia asked herself.
1243112122211221211112111.title: The light warns Sylvia of a trap

choices: No effect! Gotta try something else!
It's faded some; hit it with everything!
12431121222112212111121112.content:
As Sylvia asked her question, the light from before warming emanated next to her, slowly coming into view. The friendly face of Lysa was there once more, giving a reassuring look. "Well done getting this far; you're at the very end of your journey, and there's only one task left for you; slay the corrupting beast and be free of it's taint!" She stated heroically, pointing in the direction of the voidwalker. "It's what binds you here and decimates your tether to the world. If you fail, you'll be cursed to eternal limbo as your body hungrily searches for food on it's own." Her conscience warned, waving a finger. "I'll aid you across, but the battle is up to you; persevere with the light inside you and all will be well." The blue spirit gave it's blessings, enveloping Sylvia in it's light.

Across the ravine she was transported, crashing to the ground with enough force to lift dirt off the ground. "The light inside huh? Worth a shot, I guess..." Sylvia shrugged, readying her arms for casting, priming up a holy shock at the beast. "Hey, over here!" She called, hurling the ball of light in it's direction. The beast recoiled in smoke for a moment, reappearing in it's original position. If she didn't have it's attention before, she did now.
12431121222112212111121112.title: The Conscience Guardian

choices: Someone comes to rescue Sylvia.
As it turns out, Lysa is trapped in the same place!
124311212221122121111211122.content:
The Beast began to slowly fade, but not much. It was now angry, and began spitting shadowbolts at Sylvia.
Sylvia didn't let up, though. She began blasting the beast with rays of pure light, causing it to fade faster.
The fight lasts for quite a while, Sylvia throwing some punches, and even the Shadow Beast getting a few hits in, but in the end Sylvia came out victorious.

She noticed the Shadow Beast was protecting a large, gaping Hole, with a sign that reads "Wake Up" sprawled in messy red paint. It was too bright to be blood. There were iron gates protecting the hole from being entered.
Her conscience returned, and stated that, "The only way to wake up is to cleanse these lands for good. Due to how extreme this infection is, it may take days, or weeks to cleanse these lands, but it must be done."
"But in that time, I might grow so fat I'll never move again!" Sylvia roared, "Isn't there a faster way?"
"Unfortunately, no. I cannot help, for I am only a mental manifestation of your psyche. Sorry." The Conscience apologized.
"Everyone has an excuse these days..." Sylvia groaned, and she began to start the cleansing of her consciousness.

Meanwhile, back in the Real World...

"Omph, Nomph, MORE!" Sylvia's Shadow-corrupted Body growled, as she ate the food the Wolves gave her. Meat, Berries, even some Bread they managed to snag, Sylvia was eating like a wild animal, and due to the extremity of the bite, she was also passively gaining weight as well, so she was becoming fatter by the minute. The wolves laughed wildly like Hyenas, watching the obese blob grow even fatter.
124311212221122121111211122.title: Slightly effective.

choices: Slowly pick off each wolf... taking more time, but safe
Go all in! Faster, but far more risky
1243112122211221211112111221.content:
While Sylvia had her own personal cleansing to do on the inside (Brainwashing... If you will) her body was on autopilot. The corruption seeding deep enough to function without her present. It hungry called for more, demanding it be fed! The wolves watched on in amusement as the previously well trained Paladin made a pig of herself. She grew far chubbier, with a new soft belly and chunky thighs that contended for space. Her rear widened below, two round cheeks padding her backside.

From a distance, Lysa watched, planning her move... The wolves left in groups of two in intervals, that's where she'd strike. Take them out two at a time without alerting the rest. "I wish I could help you sooner, Sylvia... But you need to hold on a bit longer." She winced, seeing her friend devour a whole load of bread. She stalked down to her ambush point, poised to strike!
1243112122211221211112111221.title: With Suprise Guest!

choices: The Creature makes Sylvia gain at a rapid rate, threatening to crush Lysa.
The Creature summoned a Skeletal Hand to grasp onto Lysa.
12431121222112212111121112212.content:
"For Silvermoon!" Lysa roared, blasting all the beasts with a ray of Blinding Light.
The Shadow Wolves fled at the sight of this, and Sylvia's corrupted body hissed in pain.
"Don't worry, Sylvia, I'll get you out of here." Lysa told her "Friend".
"Escape? Ohoho, there will be no escape." 'Sylvia' smiled, and bound Lysa down with shadowy hands.
The beast corrupting Sylvia slowed down the passive weight gain, and lifted her obese body to stand. It would've been impressive if one could carry that much weight while standing, but this was a supernatural being we were talking about.
The Wolves came back, and 'Sylvia' laughed, "You escaped our grasp once, little Elf, but soon you shall befall a similar fate..."
"Not today..." Lysa muttered, and she grabbed a light-infused Lantern she was using as protection, and used it to break the Shadowy hand's grip, and, unwillingly, damaged Sylvia's body.
The being corrupting Sylvia bolted backwards, but Lysa grabbed hold of her, and kept her within a Divine Shield, to keep her from escaping.
"This isn't the end, I still have full control over this one's body!" 'Sylvia' roared.
"We'll get you out of my friends body, and besides, you're trapped now. What're you gonna do?" Lysa mocked.

'Sylvia's' eyes glowed a dark purple, her fat began rippling violently.
"Wh-what's going on?" Lysa said, noticing Sylvia's body shaking.
12431121222112212111121112212.title: Fury of the Light

choices: Sylvia charged up aome sort of energy, aimingnit at Lysa's mouth!
Before hse had the chance, the real Sylvia stopped her!
124311212221122121111211122122.content:
Sylvia bellowed Ina deep laugh, "Let's see your light break this!" She extended her hand, the ground beneath Lysa trembled and groaned.
"Uh, that can't be good," Lysa moaned, skeletal fingers rising from all sides, "Raagh!" She screeched, a full hand listing her off the ground and tightly grasping her with it's bony fingers. The shield around Sylvia faded, the light growing dim, "Humph, you wont get away with this, you... You fiend!" She hissed, wriggling back and forth in the skeletal hand.

"Oh, sure I won't. Now, I you excuuuse me..." Sylvia trailed, turning to leave, but something inside her told her to turn around and face the bound Lysa, "You know what... I'm not done with you, and nor will I be called a fiend!" Her voice growing loud and aggressive.
124311212221122121111211122122.title: Trapped me? No. Trapped you!

choices: Stick with Lysa, as she figures out a plan of escape.
Return to Sylvia's Mind, as she's cleansing her Consciousness.
1243112122211221211112111221221.content:
"It'd be letting you off too easy to leave you like this, why not make things more fun?" Sylvia smiled menacingly, and shot a long wave of dark energy into Lysa, causing her to bloat up rapidly.
"Mrrrpphhh!" Lysa screamed, as the Skeletal Hand lowered, and her armor began popping off.
Sylvia smiled, waiting for the perfect moment to stop channeling.
Lysa grew so fat, she needed to sit down on her now immense rump, she grabbed her belly and shook it fearfully.
Sylvia stopped channeling then, just as Lysa realized she was immobile!
"Hah, I'd like to see your light try to save you now, you fat pig." Sylvia poked fun at Lysa.
"You're fat too, you know!" Lysa spat back.
"Oh, but I don't plan on keeping this body. I'm only going to use it until I'm done with it. Until then, farewell..." Sylvia, as well as the Shadow Wolves under her control, then disappeared into the breaking of dawn.

Lysa was now immobile and without help, she had to think of something.
Her Bra held up two large Breasts, leaving very little to the imagination due to how tight her underwear was. Her belly was, as well, flabby and fat, much larger than Sylvia's current one. But how large does this... thing, controlling Sylvia plan on making her? Lysa didn't want to find out.
1243112122211221211112111221221.title: Immobile and helpless

choices: She sees the beast... a green jelly beast of some sort?
The strange man from the bar...
124311212222.content:
The walked down stairs, Lysa had already ordered for the both of them, it was hot and ready on their table. Lysa sat down and played with her hair more than she ate, going through several casual hair styles; a bun, a ponytail, a braid? "Slyvia, how about this one? I'm feeling this one." She turned her head around, a tight crimson bun.

"Oh! Mmph, looks great Lysa," Sylvia quickly spoke between bites, barely even taking the time to look. She was cleaning her plate, not something normal for her. She licked her plate of anything left and took a large drink from her juice, "I think that's the one. But uh... you gonna finish that?" Sylvia pointed at the red-head's plate with a gauntleted finger.

"Man, you're hungry this morning, I know you're growing girl, but you better watch out with an apatite like that," The older girl teased, pushing the plate towards Syliva. "Just hurry up, we gotta split here soon." Lysa leaned over the table and watched the elf quickly finish what was left on the plate.

"Ahhh, mmkay, I'm ready to go." Sylvia sat up slowly, she was surprised she stuffed herself like that, it's so uncommon for her to do anything of the sort. In fact, the last time it happened, she was a little girl who had one too many Eversong Sweetbuns. She pulled up her sanguine hood as they went out the door, a fresh rain pouring overhead.

"Okie dokie, the locals said they sent their dragonhawks down that way, and down there." She pointed in two different directions leading outside of town, both thick with trees, it was hard to see too far out. "It might be best we follow in their footsteps, one of us our bound to find the beast. Just yell really loud for help if you need it, and remember your protection spells, if you have to use them with your hearthstone, do it." She gave a weak punch to Sylvia's shoulder and walked in the opposite direction, "See yah soon."

Sylvia knew exactly where she was going... she still remembered where she found the beast last night and recount her steps. Strange sounds being heard further in as she went, this had to be the way. Not too far from where she was 'attacked', what looked to be an overfed pig was stuck on the ground, unable to get up. It was massive, and by massive: Fat. It clearly couldn't get up. "Awww... poor pig..." This must've been the fate of whatever went missing in the wilds. A small trail of green goo was found around the pig and on the ground around it... "That beast must've done it..." Sylvia stood up and followed the trail, swallowing harshly. She was a bit scared going forward. After about 5 minutes of following the trail...
124311212222.title: Returning to the forest

choices: ...A butterfly... (She's more of a wimp than she leads on)
A pack of Feral Lynx's!
1243112122222.content:
She saw the same strange hooded man from the bar, who seemed to be baiting some form of trap.
Sylvia was just about to greet him, and ask what he was doing out there, when he noticed something strange. This wasn't a man... it was the creature that attacked her!

She could just barely see it for a moment, before ducking behind some bushes to hide. It was was eerie, the beast turned out to be imitating a Person during the day, and hunted during the night!
But before she could do anything, she heard a deep breathing coming from above her head. She looked up slowly, only to see the Being, it's jelly-like face peering down at her.

"Well, hello, little lady. Seem a bit lost..." He chuckled lightly, and Sylvia shuddered in fear.
"P-p-please don't hurt me... you've caused enough damage to me!" Sylvia responded violently, to the Creature's shock.
"Hurt? Oh, that. Yeah, not into Blood Elf. Sorry if you were desperate to be eaten, but last night was purely an accident. Allow me to introduce myself... I am Expendegel. I was born inside a lab, funded by a Cook to make more succulent and juicy meats, but I escaped. Now, I go around the world causing animals to fatten up to the point of immobility, and just go to town. Ohohh... my mouth just waters thinking of the meals... it's just to die for..." Expendegel stated, getting probably a bit too emotional about it.

"Y-yeah, that's great and... wait, did you say 'Fatten up to the point of Immobility'? How?" Sylvia asks.
"Well, how do you think? I bite them in the stomach, then they slowly fatten up over time. It's so subtle, that they tend to never notice it until it's far too late." Expendegel explained.
"Wait, but you bit me! That means..."
"Yes, you're going to be gaining a LOT of weight. Unfortunately, there is no cure. I devoured the only man who could've concocted it, and ironically, it was at that moment I decided that I shouldn't eat other races, simply the animals they share this planet with. Anyway, toodles!"
Expendegel then melted into a puddle, and slithered away.
"WAIT! Get back here, you gelatinous Shape-shifting Fattening BI--" But Sylvia was cut off by Lysa calling for help. So, she had to deal with that first.

She makes it to Lysa, to see she's being attacked by...
1243112122222.title: The strange man from the bar...

choices: Let's look for the beast together...
You head back to town Sylvia, you're not looking great. I got this one.
12431121222221.content:
"I'm coming Lysa!" Sylvia sprinted in the direction of her companion's screams. This better be a good reason, she lost the beast that left her with more questions than answers! She tore around the corner into a lush clearing with Lysa in the middle, fending off a 'savage butterfly' "You're kidding me Lysa. I ran all the way out here, FOR THIS!" She shouted, the normally docile elf wasn't happy, cupping the insect in her hands and releasing it several paces away. "I lost the beast because of you!"

Lysa looked down, flustered and clearly embarrassed. "I felt something weird on my neck, and thought I was going to be eaten... but you said you found th beast?" She sat down on a nearby fallen log, straightening out her hair and wiping a bead of sweat from her forehead. Sylvia took a seat next to her in a huff.

"Yes. Turns out it's the guy from the inn last night and he's a shape-shifting goo monster." Sylvia looked at Lysa with a dead-pan expression, "And just as he starts running off, you scream for help from a butterfly attack."

"Look, I'm sorry. But I do believe you, I found some really fat animals out there with goo all around them. Not that I know what that means." Lysa inspected Sylvia, she looked worn out, her face was a bit pale, whatever she saw must've got her good. "You're not hurt are you? I can heal you if you are." She didn't see any dings on her armor or anything of the sort.

"No, I'm fine... Just a bit shaken." Slyvia kicked at some twigs on the ground, trying to change the subject, "But we can still find the guy, I got a good look at where he was going." She rubbed at her side, where she was bit, antsy after hearing the news about what might happen to her. She left out the being bit part on purpose, she didn't want to worry her companion.

"Alright, Sylvia, sounds like a plan..."
12431121222221.title: ...A butterfly...

choices: Ignore, her stomach aching the rest of the day.
Give in, and have seconds (And possibly thirds!)
124311212222212.content:
"But, Sylvia? I think you should sit this one out, I'll handle it from here. You go have a rest." Lysa calmly stated.
"What? But I-" Sylvia was cut off,
"I know, Sylvia, but you just aren't looking... well for combat right now." Lysa tried to explain, but the words just couldn't come out.
Sylvia sighs, "Alright, if you really think I should, I will. I'm starving anyway..."
"Really? You had such a large meal this morning..." Lysa wondered.
"Don't you have a Goo monster to catch?" Sylvia asked sarcastically.
Lysa groans and heads into the woods to search for the Monster.

When Sylvia returns, she treats herself to a large brunch. As she's eating, the mark the Expendegel gave her glowed brightly, and her stomach grew larger.
"Ooof, this Armor is getting a bit tight... better change into something more comfortable." Sylvia admitted, and she went upstairs for a quick change into her normal clothes.
"Ah, yeah..." Sylvia said, letter her large belly flow outwards. She seemed completely oblivious to it as of now, only thinking about her delicious meal downstairs.

She continued eating, her belly growing at a much faster rate than normal, her clothing beginning to stretch and tear.
Only when she finishes, and pats her large belly does she realize how much she's gained.
"WHAAAA?" She screams, shocked at how much she gained. "I... I didn't really eat that much, did I?" Sylvia wondered, but her stomach still craved for more.
"Oh, do I satisfy my hunger, but possibly cause a much larger weight gain, or attempt to ignore it?"
124311212222212.title: Heading back to the inn.

choices: Thirds it is!
In comes Lysa
1243112122222122.content:
Slyvia's though process was derailed by a savage growling in her gut. "Ooof, I can't handle waiting..." within the turn of a few moments, the elf completely forgot her problem, how could she deny herself if she's still hungrily. The mark clearly set a fog over her mind. She got up from her seat, walking with a lot more added sway over to the counter of the bar, "I'll have some lunch, if you could." She rubbed her jiggling gut, lunch was always after brunch, so it was alright to eat now. "And if I could have a larger side, that'd be swell." If she looked closely, she'd note the barkeep looked awfully familiar... but she didn't pay any mind.

While her seconds were served up, she dug in like she was possessed, picking meat clean off the bone and devouring anything that came her way. As she ate, her growing gut growled and grew, making it's own wide hole in her clothes. Her newfound feature was spilling into her lap, soft as Silvermoon silk and inhumanly smooth and creamy. Her belly button had grown quite deep, a very prominent feature on her now. The sides of her tunic were barely holding on, her breast-meat quickly splitting seams and growing a perky display of cleavage. Her rump was popping off seams of it's own, growing underneath her and spilling over her seat. "These chairs feel much more comfortable than I remember..." She couldn't help herself, she had to keep eating. Obliviously, her mind is telling her she's just as thin as when she came to town.

"Mphmmm *gulp* Your meat is to DIE for barkeep, you outta go to Silvermoon and be a chef!" She patted at her tubby belly happily.

"Is that so? I've still got more..." The barkeep offered.
1243112122222122.title: I don't have a problem.

choices: After Sylvia gets new clothes...
While Sylvia and Lysa are resting...
12431121222221222.content:
"Stop, beast!" Lysa comes bursting in before Sylvia can order thirds.
"What th--" Sylvia breaks out of her trance, and realizes the Barkeeper is Expendegel!
He cackles, and Lysa charges at it. But the Beast dematerializes and slides out through the cracks in the walls before she can catch up.
Lysa wipes sweat from her brow, and realizes how large Sylvia grew, "Woah! How much did you eat while I was gone?" Lysa wondered, shocked.
"I'm not sure, I just went into a trance and... lost track of how much I ate." Sylvia sighed, grabbing the fat in her belly. "Actually, I think I need to tell you something I should've told you a while back..."

"...And now, I'm probably doomed to gain weight all my life. Unless, of course, we can beat a cure out of Expendegel!" Sylvia concludes after she explained the entire story of her scar.
Lysa looks dumbfounded, "So... the beast bit you, and now you not only are slowly gaining weight, but have a higher appetite?" Lysa recapped.
Sylvia nodded, her double chin swaying.
"Well, all the more reason to do this quickly. Think you can still fight?" Lysa wondered.
"Well, so long as I don't gain more weight, I think I'll be good." Sylvia responded, slightly confident.

"Right. Well, it's still a bit early. Maybe we could go shop for some new clothes for you before hitting the hay." Lysa said cheerily.
They both walked off, Sylvia surprisingly not being as limited with her movement as one would expect, to the Armorsmith.
12431121222221222.title: Saving the Day!

choices: Can't stop herself, she goes in for 'dinner'
Lysa's point of view, maybe she found something?
124311212222212221.content:
The smith's store had a surprisingly large selection. From leather gear to mail and plate. He was quite talented at what he did. "So, here's your options Sylvia: A rather ornate looking set of plate armor, a mail set trimmed with leather, and a leather chestpiece with some matching pants. It's up to you, we've been given enough gold to buy whichever you prefer. Light bless the academy." Lysa flipped her hair back, chatting with the smith as she waited.

"Hmmmm... all good selections..." She was used to plate armor, she felt safe in it and she moved well in it. The mail looked a good fit too, but a bit warm... the leather was light-weight and comfy looking, but the least protective of the three... "Ugh, why'd you have to ruin my old set, I loved it to death!" The poor straps gave out after her first binge. She pinched at her pudge with a sad expression. "I suppose the plate will be a nice replacement Lysa."

"Sold! To the little elf in the front!" Lysa teased, but she felt sorry for the poor girl, the best she could do is stay cheery. She paid for the set of armor and handed it to Sylvia, "We'll return to the inn after you've changed. I'll go pick out some more casual clothes for you as you get dressed." Sylvia gave a nod. IF she was going to be cursed with extra weight for a while, she may as well get comfy. Hopefully she'll be fit in trim soon, after this mess blows over. As she got dressed, her mind wandered... food and eating. It's like she grew up a greedy glutton her whole life!

She came out the dressing room feeling good about herself, she still looked good in plate. She looked at how she was from the side, the plate helped conceal a bit of her stomach weight, which made her smile. "Thanks again for the help." She thanked the smith and bowed her head eagerly waiting outside the inn for Lysa to return with her comfortable clothes. From inside she could smell food being cooked, and she couldn't help but rub her stomach hungrily, "Hurry up Lysa..." She tapped her foot impatiently.
124311212222212221.title: Much needed clothes

"That's it, I can't wait any longer!" Sylvia roared, and she bolted off to to the dining area of the Inn.
She tried to stay small, but she couldn't bear it and ordered almost everything off the menu! She ate and ate, with more and more of her belly being exposed from the armor.
She ordered seconds, then thirds, then fourths, and with the mark her hunger only grew, along with her weight. She just couldn't help herself.

Eventually, her Armor became too tight, and she had to take it off, so she was there, in her underwear, still chowing down on food, gaining more and more as she did.

When Lysa finally entered, she saw what used to be her traveling companion, now a greedy blob of Fat, stuffing herself silly.
"Alright, Sylvia! This is the last straw, if you have such a problem with your eating, then just... GO!" Lysa blasted out at Sylvia, who finally stopped eating to show some dismay. Her trance was ended, and she got up, trying to defend herself, but it was all but too late. Lysa had made her decision, and Sylvia began packing what little she had that she could still use.

"It was my first mission, it was supposed to be great, I was supposed to help people!" She was on the brink of tears, she waddled down the road, jelly belly shaking every which way. She moved well on such a massive frame though, giving her whole body quite the jiggle. She couldn't help the swaying of her large rear end and thick thighs. She could still wear her hood and cloak to keep out the rain. She just really hoped Lysa could figure this out... maybe there'd be a way to fix this...

Her jiggly body, he skin-tight clothes... Despite Expendegel not having any gender, something attracted this part of the lifeform. Which, in his opinion, was insanity."

Sylvia was still making her way down to Silvermoon, her mysterious follower about to make his move... she smelled something in the nearby forest, something she hasn't had the chance to indulge in the last few hours... the mark on her hip lead her off the road, something she wouldn't do otherwise. Her legs moved on their own happily following the aroma. In an open clearing there sat what looked to be a picnic, "Ohhh, how I love picnics" Sylvia cried, eager to see what sort of treats would be in store. Her belly growled loudly, crying out to be sated.

Sylvia plopped down on the ground, her plump ass giving her more than amble cushioning. She licked her lips before opening the basket at the center, "Eversong chocolate cake, my my. I'll just have a slice, I can't get off my training diet completely..." The magic in the mark working once more, fooling the poor elf into thinking she's rail thin still. She grabs a slice and gets a whiff of it's heavenly fresh out the oven smell. She takes the bait, devouring the whole slice as quickly as she smells it. The taste was divine, she could hardly keep herself in reality, which she'd notice her skin tight pants tearing down the sides if she was...

Within a few minutes, the effects of the cake were obvious, this was a master creation by the Expendegel; her clothes tore in every direction, oozing out the crevices. Her belly growing massive under it's spell. it grew wide and heavy, she gave a happy sigh as the belt she wore tore off, "Ooof, much better." She patted her belly, sending it shaking everywhere.

By the time Sylvia was finished, she was licking her fingers clean, her chubby cheeks and lips now nice and round. Her skin tight clothes were nothing but over glorified underwear, barely covering more than that.

124311212222212221112111212.content:
"Get your hands off her, you monster!" A voice calls out.
Sylvia breaks from her trance, and is met with reality, her large, protruding gut. But there wasn't much time to feel shocked, for Lysa tackled the fake Lysa, which caused Expendegel to drop it's illusion.

"Lysa! I knew you'd come eventually!" Sylvia exclaimed.
"Yeah, Sylvia. At first, I thought you were just making that stuff up, just trying to get away with eating more than usual. I was just lying to comfort you, but now I see you're telling the truth!" Lysa explained.
Sylvia watched as Expendegel was forcefully contained within a glass jar, Expendegel returning to it's liquid state.
"Gotcha! Well, I suppose now it's time to turn this into the Mayor, and tell him that their livestock troubles are no more!" Lysa spoke confidently.
Sylvia attempted to get up, but she was rooted to the ground due to her weight. "Um... little help, please?"
Lysa sighed, and went off to grab a wheelbarrow.

Sylvia and Lysa went off back to town, wondering what their reward would be. Maybe gold, maybe new armor, who knows.
But Sylvia knew one thing, right after this mission was over, she was gonna go on a long diet.
124311212222212221112111212.title: The real Lysa swoops in!

Option 2

As the two head back to town, they had plenty of time to talk... and apologize. Lysa felt awful about what she said to Sylvia, especially after figuring out that it wasn't her fault. She did her best to make up for it, which Sylvia understood and forgave her for. The road was rather long, and it was bound to take a few hours, but they made do, in fact they managed to chit chat the whole way back, it barely felt like it took half the amount of time. Once the pair got to the edge of town, night had already fallen so they did their best to keep quiet.

"I for one hope we get a good reward, getting so fat for this and it better be worth it." Sylvia emphasized by shaking her belly, which wobbled every which way. "And that damn thing better be destroyed." As she said that, the being inside the jar swirled around angrily.

"Mhmm, but the mayor will have to be in charge of that." The two walked up the elaborate stairs to the mayors opulent house. "Sylvia, you stay down here, I'm going to go claim the reward." Sylvia nodded, she knew that it'd be a struggle getting through the narrow blood elven door. Lysa gave the door a firm knock with her gauntleted hand. Clattering could be heard from inside as the mayor came running down stairs...

Option 1: The paladins receive a healthy monetary reward, and perhaps even an aid to loosing weight for Sylvia...
Option 2: The mayor deceives Lysa, OR Expendegal breaks free from the jar and attempts to fatten her.

"Think you can get up?" Lysa asked Sylvia when they reached the bridge to Silvermoon.

Lysa plopped down at a wooden barstool, the inn was quite busy that night with patrons filling much of the tables. She couldn't help but join in some conversation with a few of the others sitting around her. They were a lively bunch, trading stories and the like. Once Lysa was asked why she was around here, she started retelling her tale (with added embellishment, of course) and it gave them all a good laugh. She thought, "Well, it is a bit funny in hindsight, but I assure you it's entirely true. My companion is upstairs getting some rest. Something I should be getting ready to do..." As she was just about to get up and say goodbye, a fellow two stools down ordered a round for everyone, on him...

What became one drink became 3. Lysa wasn't one to turn down free drinks, especially not her favorite brew. She was a bit buzzed, but it wasn't a bother. She was never one for potent drinks anyway. She made sure to get two glasses of water before going to bed. "Alright, I really must be getting some sleep, thanks again for all the free drinks!" She walked up to her room and found a still awake Sylvia trying her best to shed some pounds. "Have you been doing this the whole time?"

"Mhmm, my diet and exercise starts now, I can't go back to Silvermoon like this." She looked exhausted, and answered in panting breaths. Lysa handed her a water glass and sat on her bed. As Sylvia was about to drink, she felt something moving up her body, but figured it was just sweat that made her feel wet. And just as she started drinking, the sliver of Expendegal slipped in through the corner of her mouth...

Option 1: Purely physical change. Expendegal uses whatever power he has left to fatten Sylvia up
Option 2: Purely mental change. Expendegal permanently alters Sylvia's mind the small sliver, influencing and controlling her. She'll have the same mental fog she had when she was under his influence at all times, but not as quickly fattening her.

She searched as best she could, casting cleansing spells and the like to the best of her ability. There was no way to tell weather they'd work or not, but it was worth a shot. It had to involve her mind and those glowing eyes. She focused on cleansing those the most, hoping it'd do the trick. She wouldn't be able to tell until she awoke again however, so Lysa decided it was best to...

Lysa ran off, in search of some way to aid Sylvia.
It was nearly morning when Sylvia passed out, so Lysa felt tired and weak, but she had to move forward, and find some way to help her fattened friend.
She tried a group of priests, but they said they couldn't help.
She consulted many books and scrolls, but as she expected, no trace of anything like Expendegel.

After searching many sleepless hours searching, and researching, she found...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112.title: Get some help

Out a ways...
12431121222221222111211121212221211121.content: Lysa rubbed her tired eyes, but continued to drowsily read through an alchemical memoir. "If this isn't it... I'm done." She read as best her weary eyes could, likened back to her log days of scripture readings. "Hunger abominations and fattening spirits..." she read aloud, her energy picking up quickly. It looks like there's been similar instances in the past, not quite the same thing, but similar oddities have happened. She read about races all over Azeroth being possessed or forced into fatness. Lysa read of a young night elf being possessed by a fattening world consuming entity within recent years even. She found that an alchemist that studied them all, and managed to cure a few of the subjects, or at least slow it down. It was her best bet, and they lived...
12431121222221222111211121212221211121.title: Research pays off

choices: Follow Sylvia, drowning her sorrows in food.
Follow Lysa, still searching for the Alchemist.
124311212222212221112111212122212111212.content:
According to the sign, it was deep within the forest, far from town.
"It's too far, even on my Hawkstrider, it'd still take an hour!" Lysa dismayed.
She then had a disturbing vision of a world covered in flab, that even the strongest armies of Azeroth could not stop. It was, of course, Sylvia, who was using Expendegels magic to grow fatter and fatter, soon encompassing the whole of Azeroth!
"No! I will not allow that future to come to pass, I must find this Alchemist!" Lysa boldly convinced herself, and rode as fast as she could upon her feathered steed into the dark woods.

Back at the Inn, Sylvia was just awakening from her slumber, and when she saw Lysa was gone, she went into a panic.
"Lysa! Lysa, where are you?" She called out. Expendegel wasn't active in her mind, as it needed a few minutes to charge up power.
So this was Sylvia rushing around the inn, searching for any trace of Lysa.
Of course, being so large and nearing to the point of immobility, it was difficult for her to get around places. Luckily, this town wasn't so large, and thus could be navigated a bit easier for the more hefty lady.

After a long while of searching the town, an old hermit walked up to Sylvia and told her, "Miss, I don't know who you're yappin' about, but I can tells ya I saw but one person rush out in a hurry out of this town."
"What did she look like?" Sylvia asked.
"Eeeh, hard to tell in such dark, but I can say that she was wearin' some heavy red-an'-gold armor, and ridin' on a white Hawkstrider." The hermit recollected.
Sylvia sighed, "That would be her..." And she slowly dragged her massive belly back to her room at the inn.
124311212222212221112111212122212111212.title: Out a ways...

choices: Option 1
Option 2
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa rode as fast as her hawkstrider could take her, rushing under tree branches and down a cobble path, she has to be close. She rode around the corner leading to the alchemists home, she doesn't even know if it's a man or a woman! As she ripped down the road, she almost slammed into heavy iron gate, with a mansion just past. The gate looked unlocked, so she made her way inside. It looked rather ominous from the outside, clearly a forsaken home here, complete with a dark color scheme and somewhat dilapidated look to it. Large bubbling green tubes coming out the sides and leading back in from room to room. Strange colored gasses billowed up above, leaving a strange waist high fog...

Option 1: Lysa finds the alchemist, but at a price. Something happens to her on the way.
Option 2: Something entirely different happens
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: With haste!

choices: Lysa figured out a way to break free from this machine.
There was no way, and Lysa consumed all of the Fattening Cream.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
As Lysa makes her way to the front door, a strange creature latches onto her stomach, causing her belly to grow larger.
"Aaach! Get... This... Off!" She shouted, hoping someone would hear.

Luckily, someone did, and that someone was the Forsaken living there, "Oh, my sincere apologies, Madame. That was the wrong creature."
This forsaken was obviously male, as he lacked any signifying female traits. He wore dark robes, with shoulder pads lined with, what looked like, feathers.
His hood covered his face in a veil of shadows, the only visible thing to see is his glowing yellow eyes.
As the Alchemist removed the Bug-like thing from Lysa's stomach, she saw the damage. She probably gained an extra 200 pounds from that Creature, she could only imagine what kind of monstrosity he would've used do.

"Ah, here we are!" The Alchemist says, pulling out a long-necked creature with a horn-like nose. He sprays the creatures vile gas at Lysa, who passes out moments later.


Lysa awakens in a dark and eerie room, bound to a chair. "Mmph!" She cries, realizing a strap of leather blocking her mouth.
"Ah, so you've finally awakened." A voice called out, and from the shadows, into the light of a dimly lit lantern, appeared the Alchemist.
"Allow me to introduce myself, I am Edward Vilebone, and I am an Alchemist. I create living beings to infect other races into becoming obese, immobile blobs!" Edward explains.
"I've heard your friend got ahold of one of my experiments, Expendegel. Well, let me tell you that's only a fraction of the power I contain within this Manor. For example..." Edward then pulls out a giant tank of some strange cream-like substance.
"This is Expendecream. As it enters your body, it causes immediate and rapid weight gain. By the time you finish this entire tank, I'll no longer need worry about you attempting to ruin my plans! Say your farewells to your sleek and slender body, and hello to immobility." Edward cackled as he placed a tube inside Lysa's mouth, and turned the machine on to half-power. He wanted to savor the moment.
Lysa began growing fatter, soon breaking out of her bounds, but she could not reach the Tube. As well, she was immobile and was forced to sit and devour all the Cream.
Edward nodded, and decided to leave Lysa to her gain. He knew there was no way Lysa could escape... Or was there?

"Oh, how will I get out of this...?" Lysa pondered.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Option 1

choices: Read carefully and find a 'proper' potion
That noise doesn't sound good... a quick rash decision
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa tried her best to think under pressure, with her body swelling and spreading her armor plates. The once svelte blood elf was now facing a growing tide of fat popping off her armor. 'Uhmmmm, divine shield!' She conjured it around her, stopping the flow for a few seconds before going straight back in. 'How about... judgement?' Lysa focused on the pipe, a light infused hammer smashing into it, but to no effect. 'Damn... I know, hand of freedom!' A ring of orange light surrounded her and the pipe snapped off, spilling the cream onto the floor. She accessed her situation; it looks like Vilebone left (She heard the front door slam shut) she's underground, in a lab with a lot of vials, and a locked door.

"Alright... I have a few options here, but I should look around first..." She said to herself, slowly making her way to a table of vials. She was having a lot of trouble getting around, her new center of balance was more than off putting. Lysa wasn't used to having a jiggling body either, which speaking of was very well filled out. Her belly was wide and round, with a very pillowy look to it. Her rear was in one word: FAT, with a matching pair of thick thighs and heavset hips. Her chest was the least effected, giving her a prominent pear shape.

Lysa managed to get in front of the desk of what looked like experiments and tried her best to decipher his notes...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Stuck and paying for it!

choices: The potion is slightly helpful.
The potion made her situation worse.

Lysa, as she was searching for some sort of potion that may help her, heard the doors locks from upstairs being unlocked, and a voice calling her name.
"Oh, Eeeelf! I hope you aren't trying to escaaaaape! If you are, your punishment shall be even worse than this one!" Vilebone called down.
Lysa panicked, and grabbed the nearest potion and drank from it, in hopes it may do something to help.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Noises from the door.
