Try and find another solution for both of them?
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
She sipped back the bubbling blue potion, chugging the entire bottle. She burped under her breath and hoped for the best. Lysa felt... different. Better, but different. She tried getting to her feet, and found that she was rather light, in comparison to a minute ago, at least. She could maneuver herself around fairly well, getting atop the table with a bit of effort. *Creeeeak* the table just about smashed under her weight, but it held. The window up above might just be enough for her to squeeze through... she lifted herself up and tried pulling herself though, but her loose plate got caught in the frame! "Ugh, stupid... things!" Lysa unbuckled them all and let them clatter to the floor, squeezing herself through, just barely. Now only clad in skin tight, ripped clothes.

Lysa ran as far as her chunky legs could take her, belly and rear swaying every which way. She reached the gate and hopped onto her hawkstrider (who didn't seem to happy.) Lysa decided her best course of action was to...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Slightly helpful

choices: Follow Sylvia's binging
Back with Lysa, Vilebone had finally left his Manor.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"This is my only chance at finding a cure..." Lysa mumbled under her breath, "I need to wait for this guy to leave so I can get a better look around."
So she hid in some bushes near the front gates, awaiting the departure of Vilebone. He couldn't stay in there forever...

Meanwhile, back with Sylvia, she was busy crying tears into her pillow. "Damn this Expendegel, he ruined my figure, drove away my only friend, and now I'm stuck like this for... I don't even know how long!" Sylvia despaired, feeling the situation hopeless.
Just then, Expendegel had regained his strength, and began to take control of her mind once more.
As Sylvia got rolled onto her back and poked her belly, a surge of positive energy flowed through her body, as if she.. liked it.
"Hm... maybe it's not all bad..." Sylvia got up, and admired herself in a mirror. Jiggling her breasts, smacking her rear...
She smiled, and decided it was time to find some good food.
"Time to see how much this belly can truly handle..." She put on some (tight) clothing and headed to the bar to grab a large meal.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Wait him out, and sneak in when he isn't ho...

choices: A complete mess, he wasn't happy about her escaping...
A chance to actually read his notes and vials...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Sylvia walked down the stairs with a confident grin on her face, "Innkeeper, give me everything you've got." Her strange magical imbuement working like a charm. With a rush of wind, they disappeared into the larder to grab (newly stocked) food. "Thank you!" She genuinely thanked the innkeep and plopped her large rear on a stool, fat spilling over every side. She... enjoyed this feeling? Something about it actually felt good! She pinched and prodded at her belly, a newfound thrill from doing so.

With mounds of food piled up in front of the over-fed elf, she spared no second digging in. Her previous self would've held back, but now she decided to enjoy it! So what if Lysa was gone? She'd enjoy all this food herself. Her belly groaned and grew as she piled it away, pressing against the bar in front of her. The stool below her giving a loud groan at her weight. Sylvia reached over and grabbed another seat, adjusting herself to have one cheek per stool.

As she ate with legitimate enjoyment, indulging herself with every meal the innkeeper brought out; Lysa was busy staking out the alchemist. It was nearly nighttime, she watched with excitement as he waked through the gate and locked it behind him. Now was her chance, she bolted down to the window she climbed out through, shimmying her way into his lab. Inside, Lysa finds...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Here we go again...

choices: She finds Vilebone's Bedroom with no trouble.
She hears Vilebone coming through the front door! Time to hide...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
She heads inside to the Lab, a space all too familiar to her. But now, in the candlelit room, she could actually get some research on the rotted Madman.

She found on notebook in particular that interested her, and she flipped to a page labeled, "Grave Error". She noted that all of the titles of each entry in this book was an Forsaken Pun, which slightly irritated her. But nonetheless, she read on..

"It appears as if I have created a monster. But this is... abnormal. Supernatural, if you would. The specimen known as Expendegel has gained some form of sentience, and did not enjoy being trapped within a small glass container, and thus escaped. I'm not certain what plans this strange entity has, but I have decided that, from now on, my creations shall be strictly mutations. I will no longer being giving life to non-living entities."


"Well, that explains one thing..." Lysa thought to herself. She reads on, hoping to find something of value...

"I have, however, concocted a potion that can reverse the effects of weight gain. Fortunately, since I created the recipe while I was out drinking with the lads (I wasn't aware us Forsaken could get drunk), I cannot recall the recipe. I say it a good thing, simply because I would never want it to be left in the wrong hands. I've decided to keep the only Weight Loss Potion locked away in my Box of Dangerous Oddities, that I keep hidden underneath my Bed. Right next to the Eye that can let you see others naked... Oh, don't give me that look! You know you want one. Jealous."


Lysa smiled, and rushed upstairs, leaving the book behind. She was now on a hunt for Vilebone's Bedroom.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Reading one of his notebooks

choices: The potion, clean and in tact (Though maybe a trap)
Not the potion (Perhaps something dangerous!)
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa creaked open the previously locked basement door, confident she knew where his bedroom was. She followed her instinct, trying her best not to alert who knows what. That creature from when she first opened the door... she shuttered at the thought. This guy clearly skipped no expense, his manor was lavishly decorated, despite the rotting building itself. She found her way to what she believed was the front of the house, ominous staircase leading to the second floor. Lysa peaked into each door, but no master bedroom yet...

Lysa swore she could hear some kind of growling in a few rooms, and wailing from somewhere. It certainly wasn't a welcoming abode. She reached the end of the hallway, a heavy door with iron bat handles. "This has to be it." She took a deep breath, inching the door open and peaking inside; candle-lit and without any visual threat. The plumped up elf tried her best to follow his directions, "Under the bed... Naked sight eye-OOoo! Tempting but no... Ah! Here we are." Lysa pulled out the box and blew off the dust. "Here it is."

As she opened the creaked hinge, Lysa was met with...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Just what she was looking for

choices: "...The one who's taken the liberty of becoming the host for Expendegel!"
"...Fattening Cream! Now twice as effective, and the pipe won't break anymore!"
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Finally found it!" Lysa exclaimed silently, as to not draw attention to herself.
It read in perfect vision, "Weight Loss Potion". She bolted off, ignoring all the creepy doors and eerie abode, only wanting to leave with the potion.
But, when she reached the front door, she was greeted by a rotting abomination.
"Sh... Shtop... N-No... Furthur..." It spoke in a very grotesque voice. It made Lysa sick to her stomach.
Lysa knew the only way to get past would be to fight this monstrosity, so she got into a battle stance, readied her blade...

When Vilebone burst in through the door, causing the behemoth to fall over, spill some blood over the floor and pass out.
"Oh." Lysa said, feeling a bit underwhealmed. But there was no time for that, since Vilebone had just entered!
"Ah, my little Escapee. Well, if you really wanted to stay here so bad, why didn't you just ask...?" He asked rhetorically, as he prepared a Shadowbolt directly towards Lysa, in an attempt to knock her out.

But Lysa was prepared, and used a Holy Wrath to deflect the Shadowbolt.
"Oh, there you go again! Ruining my plans! Well, fortunately, I come prepared with backup!" Vilebone cackled as he summoned a Voidwalker to grab Lysa.
Lysa struggled, but it was of no use. She was captured, the Voidwalker could not be overpowered in Lysa's fattened state.
"Ugh, I knew I should've used this potion earlier..." Lysa groans, but after realizing she said something that she shouldn't've, the Weight Loss potion fell on the ground.
"Oh... it appears as if we have a little thief on our hands, Xer'valze. Well... mostly yours." Vilebone snickered.
"And what does it say here... 'Weight Loss Potion'? Oh, and I bet you found this in my 'Secret Chest'... you didn't take the X-Ray Eye, did you?" Vilebone asked defensively.
Lysa rolled her eyes, "No, I didn't take your perverted eye."
"Good. Because if you did, I'd probably just feed your soul to Xer'valze here." Vileclaw gestured towards her captor Voidwalker, "Anyway, this Potion is nothing more than flavored Spring Water. It gives me a good laugh now and again, giving it to my victims... it's what keeps me alive."

Lysa was once again tied up, and this time was not getting away, according to Vilebone.
"I have prepared all the necessary precautions. I've got my friend from Ratchet coming to install some warning system, so I won't have any more jailbreaks. Until then, I've put you under the guard of my Eye of Kilrogg. So don't think of escaping, for I will know. Oh... and I've also got a little suprise for you! It's you're old friend..."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Captured once again

choices: Catch up with Sylvia as she wraps up her binge
Lysa finally has her plan as the cream runs dry
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"N-No, NO!" Lysa shrieked, she wasn't about to be made fatter, not after the last time. She wriggled in her seat, but her bonds didn't budge. All she managed was to set her body jiggling every which way. "Why? Why are you doing this? You owe me that much." She was terrified beyond words now, doomed to a fate possible worse than Sylvia's.

"Eh, it's fun more than anything, besides, no one else is doing it. I like to stay original." He shrugged. His motives were... less than annoying. "But ta-ta, I'll be watching via the eye, so don't get any ideas!" He turned around waving as he walked out the door.

"You bastard, as soon as I'm free, I'll-MMPH!" Lysa tried yelling back, only for the pipe to lower itself right into her open mouth, cream instantly cutting her off. It was far thicker this time, se could feel it heavily pumping into her mouth. She tried her best to fight it, but it came so fast that she could only swallow. Eventually coming to terms and realizing she can't fight it like this, she had to make a plan... clearing her mind, Lysa mustered up all her willpower to pay no mind to the cream.

Within half an hour, Lysa was looking pretty plump, and drained a good portion of the tank. Her restraints popping off long ago as the tube continued chugging along. She was looking about as fat as Sylvia was last seen, but without magic to aid her. Lysa's once slim face now framed with chubby cheeks and a matching double chin. If she were standing, her belly would be down by her knees, but in her current state, it was kept extremely round and smooth. Her body looking about as creamy as the stuff coming out the device.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Not looking good for Lysa

choices: "...We're out of food. You ate it all."
"...We're closing for the night."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Sylvia let loose an enormous belch, one loud enough to be heard all throughout the town.
"Aahhh..." She breathed, barely having any time to do it between bites.
Sylvia had certainly had her fill, her distended belly now covering the frontal area of the bar table, before she laid back and rubbed it in pleasure. Resting upon her mammoth belly was her still perky breasts, only covered by a linen shirt, which was now grasping onto her body for dear life. The only thing that competed with her belly was her gigantic rump, which was causing both chairs Sylvia was sitting upon to creak, bend and threaten destruction of themselves if she were just a few pounds larger.

"You have quite an appetite." The innkeeper mentions, looking at her belly in awe and confusion.
"Yep, and this belly can still hold more! Keep it comin'!" Sylvia announced.
"While I'd... love... to, I can't because..."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Finishing up her "Meal"

choices: Follow Sylvia as she polishes off what's left of the larder
Check in with Lysa...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Sylvia pouted in response, "I'm still hungry... are you sure I can' have more?" Her eyes flickered for just a moment, the barkeep shaking her head

"Well... I guess you can have some more. But only for you! I've never seen someone so enthusiastic for more of my food, so I owe you that much." The barkeep smiled, turning back to the larder and unlocking the door. "Go all the way downstairs for the res of the food. I used up al my cooking ingredients, but there should be a good amount of ready to eat food down there. Including he dessert." They gave a wink and made their way over to the staff rooms. "Just be sure to lock it up when you're done."

"Goodness, thank you! I really wanted to get a good meal in tonight." Sylvia smiled, she'd have as much food as she'd need down there. As soon as it was all clear, she heaved herself off the chairs and made her way down stairs... easier said then done at her bulk. It was instantly worth it though, as she got downstairs. There wasn't much left, but all the desserts were very much in tact. Sylvia licked her lips greedily, "Mmmm, perfect."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: "...We're closing for the night."

It was an adventurer, sent on a quest to investigate Vilebone Manor.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa chokes down the last of the cream, and surveys the damage. Her Bra, surprisingly, had managed to stay on, but less could be said for her underwear, which had ripped straight off.
Her belly nearly tripled in size, it now being large enough to stuff a live Elf inside. It was spilling out all over her lap, it's state acting like a Liquid than a solid. Made sense, since she was just stuffed with Cream.

"How'll I get out, now...?" Lysa wondered, shaking her large belly. She took a look at the Eye of Kilrogg, glaring into it.
She then hears the sounds of the upstairs door rattling, and expecting Vilebone's return, she braced herself...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Check in with Lysa...

choices: He helps escort her back to town right away...
Brings her around with him while he finishes his quest...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa braced for the worst, certain the tank would be topped back off and she'd never be able to leave. But as she kept listening, it sounded more like the door was forcibly pushed open upstairs, with the cry of a dying abomination soon after. Whoever was here, it wasn't Vilebone. 'Could it be Sylvia? Did she find a way o fix it somehow?' Her eyes lit up, she had hope for the first time since coming here. The sound of fighting came closer and closer, and before she knew it, they were right outside the door. With a large blast, the door fell off it's hinges, a frostbolt dispatching the Eye of Kilrogg before it had the chance to turn around.

When all the dust was settled, her savior made themselves known. Robes... staff... long blonde hair... a male blood elf mage, by the looks of it. He didn't... look all to special though, must've been an adventurer. It wasn't Lysa's best outcome, but a hero is a hero. She did her best to call to him through the hose, only coming out as muffled cries. But it looked like he saw her, judging by his face...

"Uhhh, this wasn't part of the quest..." He looked down to his quest log, "No, not a mention of fat elves needing saving... Ahhh! I might be able to bring her back to town for a reward, right right." He seemed to be talking to himself, adventurers were strange folk it seemed. He walked toward Lysa and unhooked her bindings so that she could speak...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Side quest

choices: ...Vilebone experimenting various plagues on Rats.
...Skeletal Knights patrolling the Plague Barrel supply.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
The Mage uses a Levitation spell on Lysa, as to bring her around with ease.
"So, what're you looking for, anyway?" Lysa asked the Mage.
"Uh, ten barrels of Plague, as well as the Head of Vilebone." The Mage answered.
Lysa's eyes brightened, "The... head of Vilebone?" She asked, making sure her ears didn't deceive.
"Yep, it's got a requirement of 3 other people, but I thought I'd give it a shot alone." The mage boasted. "Say, I don't think I got your name. I'd want to be able to identify you when I turn you in for a reward."
"Lysa Dawnheart, and you?" Lysa responded. While Lysa didn't want to be known as "Just another Escort Mission", she played along just to get out.
"I'm ArkaneMajik. I just started adventuring a few weeks ago, I used to quest with my friends, but... we had a falling out." Arkane mentioned.
Lysa found the name very odd, but again, it's best not to judge the only guy trying to save you, "Yeah, I can relate. My friend Sylvia and I used to be the best of friends, but this... this stupid little Gel monster just goes and ruins everything!" Lysa roars in anger.

Lysa was hushed up by Arkane, who heard strange sounds coming from the other side of a door. Arkane slowly opened it up, to reveal...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Traveling Companion

choices: Vilbone is too powerful... flee!
Defeated Vilebone... for now at least
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"There's the plague." He said in a hushed voice, pointing to a pile of barrels guarded by skeletons. "Those shouldn't be a problem..." He motioned his hands in a circle as frost built up around them, a ring of pure ice rising to surround them, "Annnd, see yah!" Frostbolt rained from above them, smashing each foe to pieces. "Skeletons really aren't the best choice for guarding your stuff." He walked up ahead, grabbing each barrel before stuffing them in some sort of magic bag. Adventurers really are weird...

Lysa made her way next to the mage, "So uh, just Vilebone now, yes?" She was slightly impatient at this point, wanting to find a cure as quickly as possible.

"Yes yes, we'll get em." He looted the skeletons and continued onward. "He shouldn't be far from here, and I don't see any other goons..." The pair walked through a good plenty of rooms, yet he's nowhere to be found. "Alright, one last room to check, downstairs on the right wing. Let's go get him, shall we?"
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Gathering first

choices: Lysa is stopped on the way back to town.
Lysa makes it back to town without trouble, and finds Sylvia.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
They headed downstairs, and Lysa opted to hide in the corner so that she won't be noticed. She couldn't fight, even if she tried.

Downstairs, the Mage and Vilebone fought for quite a while. Vilebone was repeating threatening lines of dialogue such as, "The end is close!", "Feel the wrath of my Vials of Vile Volatile Venom!" and "Rise, minions! Fight for your master!"
But then, unfortunately, the sounds of Forsaken Cackling could be heard, and after the lengthy battle, the Mage was defeated.
"Another one bites the dust... and don't think I'm not onto you, either, my plump Blood Elf! I'll find you, wherever you are! A fat elf like her couldn't get around fast... not without assistance." Vilebone roared within the halls, to a nonspecific area.
Lysa knew she had to take this opportunity to escape, so, with the rest of her levitation, she opens and leaps from a window, the fall being smooth and featherlike, as the Levitation spell slowed her fall.

She managed to fall right outside of the Vilebone Manor gates, and she decided that it was not longer an option to return to Vilebone Manor, not until she and Sylvia were both fit and able.
"Ah! Sylvia! I totally forgot about her... oh, no, I hope she's not mad..." Lysa realized, and she ran as fast as her obese body would allow.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Vilebone is too powerful... flee!

choices: Sylvia wasn't happy with Lysa
Sylvia was happy she returned
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa had to leave her hawkstrider behind for now, she didn't want to kill her... the journey won't be easy, and it'll be more than double her original travel time on foot. The effects of the potion kept her from losing her breath completely as she ran, but not enough to make her run fast. Just getting used to the added, well, movement was a challenge of itself. Her fattened rear was shaking to no end, and her 'bra' only barely kept her from getting a black eye.

By the time she arrived to the edge of town, Lysa's potion had just about run out, leaving her panting. "Ughh, that felt like ages..." She slowly walked toward Sylvia's latest location; the warm inn. Despite it being well past closing time, the door was unlocked. The bar was a bit of a mess, that's gotta be her work. Lysa followed her path, seeing the door to the larder cracked open with a large belch sounding out. "Oh no... she's gotta be huge now..."

Lysa made her way to the very last step, bracing herself for the outcome...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Without a hitch

choices: Follow Sylvia, and her struggles to fight Expendegel.
Follow Lysa, returning to Silvermoon, lacking her partner.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Sylvia had awoken from her passing out, after eating all the food left in the basement of the Inn, and noticed Lysa.
"Well, look who it is! The Elf who ran off without me, my 'Best Friend', who would stay with me to the end!" Sylvia shouted at Lysa.
"Sylvia listen..." Lysa tried to explain, but Sylvia cut her off,
"No, you listen! Whenever I'm down, and need your help, you just run off to do... Gods know what, in the woods somewhere! Oh, and it looks like you got your 'Just Desserts'. Pretty ironic, huh?" Sylvia roared angrily.

They both argued for quite the while, before Lysa, who was just about done with Sylvia, roared, "You know what, if you don't need me, I'll just GO! Solve this problem with Expendegel by yourself, I'm going back to Silvermoon, you fat, corrupted PIG!"
"FINE! As with you, betrayer!" Sylvia retorted, biting into a half-eaten Croissant from her previous Binge.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Miscommunication

choices: Lysa's road back
Sylvia's best attempt at breaking control
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"I don't need you *mmph* anyway!" Sylvia yelled, entirely done with Lysa abandoning her time after time. "Have fun trying to burn all that off!" She watched Lysa go back upstairs in a huff, "I'll prove to you that I can handle this!" It was the last she got to fire off at Lysa before she was out of the inn. She had reached for the last of the food in the larder, eagerly eating it. Now she was faced with what she had just said. Clearly she was just being hotheaded, but is it true? Could she really do this alone? Sylvia had to make a quick life decision as she felt Expendegel trying to corrupt her further.

Sylvia barred her willpower as best she could muster, telling herself over and over that she was in control here. She tried some of her paladin magic, cleansing her mind to the best of her ability. He hasn't fled her yet, as some of her previous feelings were still there. She... somehow liked the added bulk she's gained, but she didn't want Expendegel making choices for her. She had to break his control, and see where it goes from there...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: The fight continues

choices: Vilebone!
The Mayor of the previous town!
A member of her Paladin Order, sent to check up on the two.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa, unlike Sylvia, handled the break-up a bit more calmly. All she was worried about was how she was going to explain it to everyone else.
Back at home, in Silvermoon, Sylvia and Lysa were the best of friends. It seemed nothing could break them apart, as if they were both made of Saronite. However, like Saronite, it does take the Corruption of a powerful being to destroy the most pure of lifeforms, and that is possibly enough to break up a Friendship that lasted since the Scourge invasion upon Quel'thalas.

As Lysa was coming up with good excuses as to why Sylvia wasn't with her, she bumped into someone...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Lysa's road back

choices: Brighthelm notices her right away...
Brighthelm doesn't recognise Lysa, meeting Sylvia back in town
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Walking on the desolate road to Silvermoon was easier now that weather cleared up, the previous almost monsoon conditions were unbearable, the bright sun bringing a much better tone. Lysa was trying her best to recollect on the situation, how is she going to break this to the order? Along the way she hasn't met many people, despite being out there for a good full day. That is until a trotting was heard down the path, "A horse? Ohhhh no..." Lysa knew what that meant, someone from the order was coming this way, no one else in the Horde rides horses besides the undead, and this steed sounded far too heavy to be a skeletal construct.

Down the road, a golden winged helmet topped off the rider. That was clearly Sister Brighthelm, someone Lysa really wasn't fond of... She was the top dog of her class, pushing around the less successful students. There's no way to evade her now, maybe she won't notice?
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Sister BrightHelm

choices: The Barkeep denies seeing either of them.
The Barkeep tells her everything that's happened.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Brighthelm ignored Lysa, obviously not recognizing her due to her new physique.
"Well, I guess this weight isn't all bad, hehe." Lysa snickers, as she continues back down the path for Silvermoon.

As the golden steed slowed to a pause, Brighthelm investigated her surroundings. This town was rather small, but she concluded that, since it's the only one in a hundred miles that's actually close to their primary objective, the duo would set up a base camp here.
She first checked the Inn. Her heavy, official armor alerted the Barkeep of her presence, and he welcomed Brighthelm warmly.
"Greetings, Knight of Silvermoon. What brings you around to my humble inn?"
Brighthelm pulls out a crude drawing of two elves, "About a week ago, two trainees for the OSP, otherwise known as the Order of Silvermoon Paladins, came down here on a simple mission, and haven't reported back since. Have you seen these two ladies anywhere, possibly living here? Their names are Sylvia Embersworn and Lysa Dawnheart."
The Barkeep glances towards the basement, as to where the Elf whom looked very similar to one of the elves in the photo, and then back at Brighthelm, "Aah..."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Rushing past.

choices: Brighthelm checks the larder
Brighthelm doesn't bother, maybe the pair moved on...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
The barkeep got a bit nervous at her inquiry, she certainly knew of Sylvia in the basement larder, but this lady sounds like hot stuff, and wouldn't be too happy if she found it. She might even displace the blame! "Uh, can't say I've seen em lately. They rented out a room yes, but I haven't seen either in quite some time. Neither have been here since their second night." The barkeep tried to keep her cool under the gaze of someone so intimidating. Brighthelm quirked an eyebrow at this.

"I'm inclined to believe you, but that doesn't sound entirely right. Where's there room?" The barkeep led her up stairs and unlocked the door, though Sylvia's bed still looked freshly slept in. "Hmmm..." Bright helm didn't say anything more, she was onto the barkeep. "Well, if you don't mind me checking the rest of the inn? I assume that won't be an issue." She flashed her sword out a bit from her sheath, she meant business.

*Gulp* "Sure thing, here's the master key..." Well, the barkeep wasn't going to have a happy paladin on her hands when she decides to check downstairs...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Paladins? No... none here...

choices: Stopped by Brighthelm!
They reach their destination without much trouble.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"...You know what, keep it. I'm certain those two doofuses got themselves stuck in some obvious trap. Thank you for your time." Brighthelm said, trying to keep a serious composure.
"Anytime, ma'am." The Barkeep bowed as the Paladin headed back outside.

The Barkeep headed down to the Larder, where Sylvia was still asleep. The Barkeep awoken her, and told her that it wasn't safe to stay here anymore. He told her about the Guard that came looking for her, and that he'd do what he could to get her somewhere safe.
"Thank you, Brighthelm'd kill me if she saw me like this." Sylvia said, attempting to get up on her feet.
"Don't try to get up, even if you did, the force of your stomach would cause your feet to break. I'll carry you up to my wheelbarrow, and disguise you underneath a tarp. It'll be a flawless plan!" The Barkeep explained.
Sylvia nodded, and allowed the Barkeep, as hard as it was, to carry Sylvia to the Wheelbarrow. As weak as he seemed, he actually was pretty strong.

After the trouble with carrying Sylvia out to the Cart, he equipped it with his Hawkstrider, and rode off.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Maybe they moved on.

choices: Sylvia's attempt to rationlize herself
Something else...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Sylvia wasn't making the whole stealth thing easier, what with the wheelbarrow creaking under her weight. "Hey, keep quiet down there." The barkeep whispered harshly, "We're almost there." He had led them both to a dark side street in town, across from an abandoned house, "Alright, this should do." He forced the back gate open and parked Sylvia in the back. "She shouldn't find you here..."

Sylvia looked around, "Well it's not the best accommodations, but I suppose it works." The barkeep unloaded the massive elf and brought out the large tarp.
"It'll have to do, now don't make any sound, or she might hear you," He opened it up and threw it over top Sylvia... who now looked as though she was trying to disguise herself as a pile of pillows. He shrugged, what more can he do? He brushed his hands off and started back pedaling out the gate, "Remember, no sounds!" he said before turning around to get back to work. But as soon as he finished his statement, he was met with a full suit of armor, with a judging look on her face.

"Now, what was that barkeep? Talking to yourself in the middle of an abandoned house's backyard?" She leaned down and looked him in the eye, "You've seen those paladins lately, haven't you?" She walked past him, scanning the yard, "A pile of pillows. You're an odd man..." Brighthelm called out, "Lysa... Sylvia, I'm here to help you and finish this mission, I don't know why you're hiding, but I want you to come out." She tried to sound as sincere as possible, but it wasn't getting her anywhere. "Okay barkeep, what's with the pillows..." Brighthelm lifted the edge of the tarp and pulled it back
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Intercepted...

choices: Stick with Sylvia, getting used to her new surroundings.
Follow Lysa, meeting up with the Order in Silvermoon.
Follow the Barkeep, who must explain himself to Brighthelm.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"A-ah, you see, Ms. Brighthelm, these pillows are... Unsafe, yeah. Problem in the workshop, I was just out in these dark woods to dispose of them. Wouldn't want bad pillows, would I?" The barkeep lied, rather poorly.
Brighthelm glared once more, "Likely story..." Brighthelm looked around, then back at the cart, then back at the Barkeep, "You're coming with me to town and you're going to answer some questions."
The Barkeep nodded, and they both left, leaving the Cart of "Pillows" behind.

Sylvia did her best to get out of the cart, and into the old house, a place she'd have to get used to staying in for some time.
Within, there was a surplus of food, as well as a note telling her that the Barkeep would return every week to check up on her, and refill her food supply if need be.
She'd stay there, until she cleanses herself of Expendegel.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Getting away with it.

choices: "We believe you, but where's Sylvia?"
"Your show of gluttony has disgraced the order!"
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa walked up to the golden gates of her home city, "I miss this place..." She sighed, even though she missed her home Lysa stuck out like a very-very sore thumb. The bulked up elf wasn't like any other of her people now, likely weighing in for 4 to five of any other elf. Her skin-tight clothing left nothing to hide. As soon as she saw another sin'dorei, she was getting more than a few stares. Lysa bowed her head in embarrassment, this was going to be tough...

She knew right were she was going: to report at headquarters. As she traveled down the street, Lysa formed her story, "I'm going to tell the truth, they have to believe me!" She kept her sisterhood badge with her, as she doubted the gatemen would recognize her at this point. "I must speak with the commanders at once." The pair of guards just about laughed, till she showed her identification and realized she outranked them.
"R-Right this way, my lady." The man on the left said, unlocking the door and leading the way. Lysa was immediately brought to their champers, where they had conveniently already been gathered. Lysa took a deep breath, this won't be fun...

Every elf in the room cocked an eyebrow at the fattened paladin, "Lysa... is that you?!" One asked, uncertain what she saw was real. "You look... well... what happened to you?"

"Well... you see..." Lysa did her best to recollect on her story, not skipping on the important details. When she had finished, Lysa watched on nervously for their response...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Facing her peers

choices: When Lysa returns home...
Check up on how Sylvia is doing on her own.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"That's quite a story, lady Dawnheart, however we do need to know the location of your colleague, the one whom you were meant to swear your life to on this mission." One of the commanders questioned.
"Yes, well... Sylvia Embersworn has, sadly, fallen to the corruption of the one we've called Expendegel, I last saw her devouring whatever was left of the Inn's food supply, much too large for my to carry alone. I tried everything, but... she was far gone." Lysa responded, holding back whatever emotions she felt.
"Understood. We did send out Lady Brighthelm to scout out for the two of you, I'll be sure to send her a message letting her know you're safe and sound, but Sylvia is still out there." The head Commander stated, "As for now, you are dismissed. I hope your 'little' weight problem is solved soon. But if you can't, I'm certain we could always find a use for you. Maybe as a Training Dummy for the new recruits..."
The Commanders all collectively shared a laugh at Lysa's expense, who, despite her slight annoyance, nodded and walked back outside to her Home.

"Ugh, those stupid Commander's always push me down... especially Ms. 'High-and-Mighty' Brighthelm... I wish I could give them a piece of my mind, show them I'm not such a wimp..." Lysa grumbled on her way back to her home.
Just then, she felt her belly growl, as if to signify her slight disadvantage, "Well, first I'll need to get rid of this Anchor of a belly..."
Her belly groaned again, obviously begging for food.

"I'll be sure to feed you something SMALL when I get home. I'm not going to be able to binge for a long while..."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: The location of Sylvia

choices: A fully stocked kitchen
The undead alchemist in waiting
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa walked down the nostalgic path back to her house, she remembered coming back home after long days training her form and mind. The long days of study and frustration, the joy and love she felt here at the order. She still loved it here, the same fragrance of blossoming flowers seemed to stay in the air year long. Her peers looked at her with judgmental daggers for eyes, but she did her best to turn a blind eye. It was hard trying not to notice how everyone was looking at her, and trying not to notice how much of her jiggled when she moved. This was the first time returning home didn't feel entirely right to her, but she knew it was still the best place she had. She arrived to her doorstep, a cozy little house, quite close to her neighbors, but it's to be expected while she's still inside the order's walls.

She didn't bring her key with her, moments like these are why Lysa hides a key under her flowerpot. "Hmmm, that's odd..." The key wasn't in it's normal position, as she remembered exactly how she last left it. She shrugged it off, no one would need to get inside her house anyway. She slotted in the key and turned it open to find...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Back home again

choices: She kept to her promise, and only ate one.
She couldn't control herself, and began devouring the food in her house.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa entered her home, to find her kitchen fully stocked with all types of goodies. Elekk steak, Westfall Chicken,Triple-chocolate Cookies, and plenty of other delicious foods.
Lysa drooled at the assortment, but tried to ground herself to reality, "No! I must resist the temptation... gosh, that cream probably did something to my head, I just have this insatiable desire to eat! But I must control myself... don't want this blubber ball to get any bigger!"

Lysa settled on making burgers from the Elekk meat, only a few though.
"Just one now, and save the rest for later." Lysa convinced herself, and took the first bite out of her burger...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: A fully stocked kitchen

choices: Speak of the devil, someone was coming...
Soemthing else happens
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa cooked up her first burger no problem, she kept telling herself, "This is it!" but as it was cooking, her hands slipped into the cookie jar. Every minute or so, she'd grab a full handful of cookies and eat them all before returning back to her cooking. Before she knew it, the cookie jar was empty. "Oh, well..." Lysa didn't pay much mind to her eating the whole jar, "It's just a snack!" As her first elekk steak burger finished, she ate it in record speed, the more she ate, the quicker she wanted to keep eating. As she polished off her Westfall chicken, the time seemed to slip past her...

And before she knew it, Lysa woke up on her couch with a stuffed stomach, "Ughhh... *burp*" Lysa sat up groggily, a task that was harder then she'd like to admit. Her large rear took up half the seat, even though it was made for 4 people to fit comfortably. Her stomach was quite round with food, her hands instinctively rubbing around it to ease it's burden. Speaking off, her stomach was noticeably bigger from her meal, burning through all the food she had at home. "I didn't... know I had so much food here..." She spoke slowly, still recovering from her 'snack'. "I really hope no one sees me like this..."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: A 'small' snack

choices: It was Vilebone!
It was one of Lysa's friends.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Well, it seems someone enjoyed their homecoming present..." A voice could be heard, just behind Lysa's head.
Lysa, recognizing the voice, quickly bolting up in surprise despite her size, to get a better look at the owner of the voice...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: The return

choices: Diana's working for Vilebone...
Diana's doing her best to mend their friendship a bit
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"By the light, is that you Diana?" Lysa looked over at her friend, it was a bit dark, but it certainly looked like her.
The other elf tilted her head and smiled, walking into the light, "Mhmm! I also set up this welcome home gift!" She was as perky as ever, it seemed. The two f them go back pretty far, she's known Diana as long as she's known Sylvia, but she started to give a breath of jealousy towards Lysa as she peeked higher in the ranks quicker than she did. "It's good to see that you're back, and I figured you could use a bit of a nice welcome home meal!" Her bright eyes shining. She was either very legitimate, or she was up to something. Or, she could possibly want something from Lysa.

"Well, you scared me half to death, you're too quiet for your own good," Lysa tried laughing it off, she felt a bit flustered, considering Diana could have been there the entire time and not even known. Lysa barely noticed her borderline nudity, until the other woman looked down and giggled.
"You definitely enjoyed it!" Diana gave Lysa a hug, "I'm glad you loved it, I worked hard for it!" Something's up with her...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: A 'friendly' welcoming

choices: Stay with Lysa, as Diana stuffs her silly.
Check up on Sylvia, still hiding in the old house the Barkeep led her to.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Little did Lysa know, Diana actually went out before Brighthelm in search of the duo. Being as she was one of her best friends, Diana didn't want either to get hurt, lost or worse.
But Diana was caught by Vilebone, yet instead of torturing her with obesity, he found out that she knew the elf whom had escaped his grasp. So instead, he sent out Diana to do some outside work, and go fatten up Lysa.

The food Diana gave to Lysa was actually a fattening and mind manipulation formula, which caused Lysa to gain more weight with less resistance, a slave to the secret ingredients that alter her mind. As well, Lysa would never distrust one of her most loyal friends.

"Can I make you some breakfast?" Diana offered, already turning on the stove.
Lysa pondered the idea, and her answer was confirmed by her growling stomach.
How could I be hungry after last nights binge?... Ah, well. The stomach knows what it wants!, Lysa thought for only a second, before sitting her humungous body on a weak chair, that somehow managed to stay up, regardless of the large weight pressed upon it.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Mind Control

choices: The barkeep runs in, panting and out of breath
Brighthelm arrives 'to the rescue'
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Sylvia sat in 'her' house, parking her massive rear on a pile of plush pillows for some sort of comfort. It was a bit chilly in the abandoned home, but the barkeep was nice enough to supply her with the extra sheets and pillows from the inn, telling her to do her best to not make them dirty. With her previous clothes in such dire straights, Sylvia used the blankets to conserve her modesty. She summoned all her willpower to not devour everything the barkeep sent to her, but it was hard with Expendegel's influence still in the back of her mind.

Speaking of which, Sylvia had managed to suppress his direct control, only feeling minor pull when Sylvia's around food, but at least she wasn't entirely powerless now. She learned to work around her new body, trying to make the best of her situation. Over her time since staying here, she actually hasn't managed to gain any weight, yet not lose any either. She did her best to fast and meditate, hopefully to push out Expendegel completely. It was working so far, she felt better about the situation and was doing well for herself. A commotion was happening outside, until a crash was heard just outside the door, the door slamming open in a cloud of dust...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Status report on Sylvia

choices: Vilebone.
Brighthelm.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
The Barkeep ran in as fast he could, shutting the door quickly behind him.
"What's wrong?" Sylvia asks the clearly out-of-breath Barkeep.
The Barkeep gathers his thoughts and breath, and states, "There was... a crazy Forsaken who came in after I dealt with Brighthelm... He was looking for you, I lied but... I think he followed me here!"
Sylvia had no idea what this guy was talking about, but this individual seemed a bit dangerous.

Then, there came a knocking at the door. It was a slow, ominous and steady knock, that reverberated throughout the house.
After much silence, the Barkeep asked, "Who's there?"
The source of the knocking spoke calmly, "You know who I am, and why I am here. Now release her to me, and I shall possibly spare you the consequences.

The Barkeep pondered, and looked over at Sylvia, seeing if she had any advice.
Sylvia shook her head 'No', and the Barkeep responded to the voice,
"I don't know what you're talking about, Th-this is my house!" The Barkeep fibbed, hoping it would be enough for the person at the other side.
But it was not, and the voice responded more violently, "I'm not going to make this more difficult than it needs to be, just open the door, and give the Elf to me, and I'll let you off the hook. I have no time to negotiate."

The Barkeep sighed, knowing he couldn't face what was in the future if he were to keep it shut.
Through the haze of the early morning rays, the figure revealed itself as...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: The barkeep runs in, panting and out of breath

choices: Sylvia awakens in Vilebone's lair
Follow Lysa as she's charmed by Diana
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
The forsaken stepped into the light dramatically, "Now, was that so hard?" He grinned. flashing what teeth he had left. "You're free to go, I'm not interested in your type." He signaled for the elf to flee out the door and leave him to Sylvia. "Go go, before I change my mind"
"I'm sorry.. I hope you understand..." He muttered under his breath to Sylvia, "I'll get your fellow paladin to help." His voice wasn't loud enough for the undead to pick up on what he was saying. "Alright alright, I'm going..."
"And remember, you didn't hear any of this!" Vielbone shouted back behind him as the elf ran away. "Now my dear, you must be Sylvia?" He extended his hand to the plump elf, his same sad excuse for a grin plastered on his face.
"Alright, who are you and what do you want with me?" She questioned, her eyes squinting to analyze the man.
"My my, I didn't introduce myself! And here I thought your friend Lysa would've mentioned me, tisk tisk." He waved his finger, "Oh well, she'll get what's coming to her." Vilebone slipped a gas mask over her face and sprayed Sylvia with the same gas he used to incapacitate Lysa. Before her eyes started to fade to black, Vilebone cackled, "And I've got many great things to show you, while you're still around!" her vision fading entirely.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Vilebone.

choices: Lysa uses whatever strength she can muster, and goes on a walk.
Lysa waits for Diana to come back to talk with her about the gain.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Mpphh, oph, sho good..." Lysa moaned as she stuffed more food into her massive gullet.
Lysa had been eating nonstop since Diana started cooking breakfast, and she had already managed to break her chair, and gain twice as much as she did earlier.
Thanks to the charm, as well, Lysa was completely unaware of her gain, and was content to eating and eating, with no visible end in sight.

That is, until Diana realized she was nearly out of food to feed her with.

He turned to face Sylvia, rubbing his hands together, "And I want a return investment! You're to be the new host, dear. Soon enough, Brighthelm's golden plate armor was clattering to the ground piece by piece as she sat hopelessly on her expanding rear, hands glued to her rounding spare tire.
As the gel flows ever onward, a voice was heard in the back of her head...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Well that's new

choices: The plan goes as expected.
Someone catches on, and the plan is foiled.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
As Brighthelm bursted out of her armor, leaving her in the tunic and leather pants underneath, she heard a voice in the back of her head, that sounded like Sylvia's.
"Brighthelm... I have a plan, but it's going to require your cooperation. I'm only going to feed you enough for Vilebone to be satisfied, but not totally immobile. Once Vilebone leaves, I'll open up the window and let you go and summon the Council before it's too late. I won't have the power to remove your fat, so hopefully it won't be too much of a burden on you..."
Sylvia's voice died down, and Brighthelm knew exactly what to do, entrusting it truly was Sylvia.

Brighthelm, of course, was right to trust the mysterious disembodied voice of Sylvia, as she was only barely on the brink of Immobility before Vilebone ceased the gaining.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: A familiar voice

choices: Brighthelm makes it back to The Order, they have to listen to her!
Something happens along the way
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Alright, stop there. I don't want you over stressing on your first trial." Vilebone held up his hand to signal Sylvia to stop. "Very good, you'll pick up on that in the next few hours, in the mean time, you two have catching up to do!" The alchemist cackled, giving Brighthelm's stomach a hard smack, her eyes grew angry and her expression turned fuming. As Vilebone could conclude, the layer of fat around her face still didn't make her look any less intimidating when provoked. "Oh don't give me that look, it's not like you can do anything about it." Vilebone turned to walk back to his studies and experiments. Once out of sight, Sylvia managed to garner enough control to crack the window open enough for Brighthelm to escape.

With a large huff, Brighthelm clamored to her feet in a huff, 'This is hardy than I thought...' She slowly made her way to the window, round gut wobbling too and fro as she moved. She looked down to inspect the fall... it wasn't too big, but it might hurt if she hits those bushes. Before making her leap of faith, Brighthelm narrowed her eyes at the blob of fat behind her, "I'll stop this, Sylvia," she hopped out the window, landing on her softened ass. Her painted on leather pants tore at the seams on the side, but otherwise she's in tact...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: According to plan

choices: The council believes her, and sends with her a few soldiers.
The council doesn't believe such nonsense.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
She bursts into the councilroom, and tries her best to explain while out of breath and panicking at the same time.
"Slow down, Brighthelm. Collect your thoughts, then tell us." A councilmember stated.
Brighthelm repeated herself, a bit more coherently this time.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Brighthelm makes it back to The Order, they hav...

choices: March back to stop Vilebone right away!
Stay a little while and brief the troops, maybe check on Lysa...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Brighthelm told the council everything she gathered, explained her condition and that of Sylvia. She never did see Lysa, but the council informed her of what happened to her too. The council decided to convene after Brighthelm's story, quickly running everything down and deciding whether or not to support her findings. The council recognized her standing and felt it was best to believe what they've been told. "Brighthelm, we believe you. And as such, we'll need to quell the beast that caused all of this, and hopefully reverse what's happened to our fellow sisters. We'll be sending a group of soldiers to accompany you, Light give you strength Brighthelm." The speaker of the council turned and pulled the curtain down, the council didn't think it was much of a threat so a small group was enough in their mind.

Brighthelm gritted her teeth, this was serious! /she walked outside the chamber in wait for her compatriots, who evidently were all female (Because, plot!). The group of 5 blood elves bowed before their superior, none of which actually knew their assignment yet.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Permission Granted

choices: They all manage to fight through the armies of ghouls, and make it to Vilebone.
Vilebone sets up a trap for them, capturing all but Brighthelm.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
They all march towards the Manor of Vilebone, armed and ready to fight.
They trudge deep into the forests of Ghostlands, one of the soldiers asks what this is all about.
Brighthelm has a difficult time explaining, however, as all of them just have confused faces throughout the entire tale, but they all end up just accepting it, and hoping that she isn't lying.

When they reach Vilebone Manor, Brighthelm warns them that, "This place is filled with ghouls, monstrosities and other such terror's that are like nothing you've seen before. Harden your spirits, and expect a good fight."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: March back to stop Vilebone right away!

choices: Sneak in to save them before they're too fat to move!
Try and sabatoge Vilebone, they can make it!
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content: Brighthelm signaled for her troops to move forward, they looked nervous, and they should be. Up ahead, just below the small overhang were undead minions of all rank and file waiting to spring out on the attack. The paladins up front rose their shields and looked around with a worried expression, something wasn't right. Brighthelm held back, there's not much fighting to do in her condition, afterall. As the elf in front reached the edge, she was pulled down and drug off, the rest of the undead springing up to attack. The paladins weren't highly trained and it showed, one by one the group of women were picked up and drug away into the forest kicking and screaming. Brighthelm gulped and slipped back out of sight from the undead horde, panting heavily. "I-I can't fight like this..." She angrily pulled at her belly fat and ass. She had to get them back...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: It's a trap!

choices: She finds something in her bags.
She finds something on the ground.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"I can't leave them behind, they're my only line of defense!" Brighthelm says, heading towards the location of the screaming elves.
The forest is dark, but she uses a spell to illuminate her path so she may see more visibly.

She reaches the location of where her soldiers are being held, and as it turns out another servant of Vilebone was working at a Campsite.
"Ah, it must be my birthday! 6 female elves, all prepared to have their beautiful thinness sucked dry, and replaced with thick, lardy fat bodies." The Undead laughed maniacally.
"I need to distract him, but how...?" Brighthelm wonders, looking around for any ideas.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Sneak in to save them before they're too fa...

choices: ... A hearth stone!
A bottle of... something.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content: Brighthelm frantically dug through her bad, searching for anything to use against the undead. "Ugh, I knew I should of packed more holywater..." she grumbled, dumping her bag's contents on the ground. "Alright... let's see..." She sifted through her belongings, which honestly needs to be cleaned up, "Do I even need this?" She picks up a pair of leather boots, "Hmm, no..." Behind the tree she was using as cover, the elves shrieked, soon muffled by the sounds of food being chewed. "I need to hurry!"
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: She finds something in her bags.

choices: Drink the potion.
Throw it at the Undead.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
As she searched through her bags, she came across a red potion, one she had forgotten about long ago.
"What's in this, even?" Brighthelm pondered, swirling the half-empty vial of mystery juice.
Brighthelm, having no other options, considered what she could do with the potion. She could either drink it, and hope it would aid her in any way possible, or take the risk on it potentially being lethal, and throw it on the Kidnapper Undead. Choices...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: A bottle of... something.

choices: Liquid strength! Enough to get her fighting
Not quite a strength potion...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content: She thought it over, the muffled cries of elves being stuffed up quickened her thought process, Brighthelm reasoned she wouldn't be carrying poison with her, but she'd often pack elixirs to add to her skills in combat. "Light give me strength," The paladin breathed out heavily, pulling her head back and quickly draining the whole elixir, guzzling down it's contents. She blinked twice, "That was bigger than *Urp* Normal..." She rubbed her stomach, that felt like a bigger drink than she's used to and there was an odd after taste. "This better not be some sort of off brand..." The draught was taking effect...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Bottoms up!

choices: After a while, the elves were done being fed, and Brighthelm had her chance.
Check out how Lysa is holding up.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
She managed to grab a good potion, and not only had the strength to lift her obese frame, but to wield her weapon, as well.
However, she didn't expect it to last too long, so she had to make the most of it while she could. She ducked into the bushes and waited for her opportunity to strike...

"You're all getting so nice and plump..." The Forsaken cackled, rubbing the bellies of the very fat elves. Their bellies were at least the size of the Forsaken, and were only getting fatter.
"Soon, you'll be large enough for your fat to be siphoned into my brothers latest creation..." The Forsaken mentioned ominously.
Is this guy Vilebone's brother? ...and what's this 'Invention' he's talking about, could it be Sylvia? Brighthelm pondered.
She continued watching Vilebones Brother fatten the elves more, she was unsure of how long this would take...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Liquid strength! Enough to get her fighting

choices: I've gotta get you just a smidge fatter!
We need to get you over there!
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa's home was still barely big enough to contain it's owner's massive bulk. The silence was broken by a slight giggle. Lysa still unable to move and with nothing to do was still toying with her curves. With nothing else to occupy her time, the paladin was left with few options and now that she had the chance she figured it was worth trying to get used to her new form. She giggled once more, pressing her hands as deep into her belly as possible and kneading at her plush fat. "Huh, I never would have guessed it was this... interesting?" She didn't know quite how to describe it, but it felt strange. Her giggling was cut off by a loud growl, her captor's magic food didn't ware off quite yet and the woman was left rather hungry still.

"Ohhh, you're still home, Lysa!" A familiar voice called out, the sound of the front door closing behind it. "I guess you've come to enjoy it a bit, huh? Well, that's good!" The elf smiled, patting the fattened elf, "Because I've got more plans for you, but first...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Back to Lysa

choices: Back with Brighthelm...
Stick with the two elves gaining.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"We need to get you over to the Manor, where we can show you my Master's newest invention!" Diana smiled, and pulled out a Scroll of Teleportation, and began reciting the spell.

Lysa and Diana were then teleported to the Backyard Testing Grounds of Doctor Vilebone, where Lysa could once again see Sylvia, but now much larger.
Lysa was a bit afraid of what was in store for her...
"Well, if it isn't the second member of the triad of fatties!" Vilebone called down, laughing maniacally.
"Vilebone!" Lysa responded, angrily, "What's your game?"
"Oh, very simple, actually. You see, I have a group of elves just waiting to become as large as your friend here. Once they're all fat enough, I shall combine all their weights together, and if my calculations are correct, it shall cover Azeroth in a wave of Obese Elf Flesh! Then finally, I shall have the whole world to myself, and my Obese Elf Eater, and soon take over the galaxy with their fat!" Vilebone explained.
"That's madness!" Lysa exclaimed.
"You won't be thinking that way much longer..." Vilebone spoke, commanding Sylvia to feed Lysa her fattening gel.
Lysa, instead of struggling, actually began to not care, and just suck up more and more fat gel, as per one of the side effects.
"Yes... eat! Get fatter, and soon your weights shall combine to become one super-fat elf!" Vilebone cheered.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: We need to get you over there!

choices: Brighthelm plans her next move
Follow Lysa/Sylvia
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Brighthelm stood over the body of Vilebone's brother huffing and puffing with stained sword in hand. "Sisters... you're safe." She looked up and found each of her paladin escorts fattened up quite a bit, as big as she was even.
They laid groaning, soft bellies and rears busting through their platemail. "Ughhh, Brighthelm... I don't know if we can help anymore..." One spoke, hiccupping after every other word. The elves looked beyond drained.
"I'm sorry I couldn't make it in time to save you..." She paused looking back up to their bloated stomachs. "I'll have to finish this alone." Brighthelm spoke proudly, her ego peaking it's head. "I'll free us of this burden."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Brighthelm, the last hope!

choices: Follow Vilebone, Lysa and Sylvia.
Stick with Brighthelm and her plan.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Alright, I already drank all of this potion, but I think I have a way to get you all back..." Brighthelm smiles, looking down at Vilebone's brothers corpse.
She dug through her pockets, and found a Teleportation Scroll in his bags. She knew where it led, but she had to confront Vilebone one last time, even if it did end in her going out in a blaze of glory.

She use the Scroll, and was teleported instantly to the front of Vilebone Manor.
"Well, now what? Wait for him to come out and fatten us up more?" One of the Elves asked Brighthelm.
"Not exactly..." Brighthelm smiled, looking over at a large, empty wagon.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Brighthelm plans her next move

choices: Late arrival
And just then...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Lysa still felt the green goo pouring down her throat, it was a sickly sweet sort of taste, and she could feel herself growing fatter, rather than simply full. It wasn't entirely uncomfortable, it was... interesting, If nothing else. She didn't fight it, she knew it was not worth the breath, all she could do was hope something came to stop this.

Sylvia wasn't in control, she couldn't muster enough strength to break free yet. She watched on as she fattened her already impossibly bloated friend. She wanted revenge on Vilebone and his allies, and Brighthelm was the only hope she had left, 'She has to be coming soon...'
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: The main event

choices: They succeed, but Vilebone has one last trick up his sleeve.
They fail, but Brighthelm has one last-ditch effort to stop him.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Vilebone! It's time you face your maker!" A familiar voice yelled out.
"Could it be... Well, it appears that my last members forcefully brought themselves to me..." Vilebone cackled madly.
Brighthelm, who was now much thinner and strong, as well as her cohorts, began to explain.
"We hid in a large wagon, and was brought directly to your lab. There, we fought off the guards and found the Weight Loss potion. Just enough for us to bash in here and kick your rotting ass!" Brighthelm roared.

"Well, you came this far, I suppose you deserve a fair fight. Well, then... Come at me!" Vilebone taunted, before all six elves charged valiantly into the Forsaken.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Late arrival

choices: He was casting one last spell!
He pressed a button in his coat pocket!
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
The elves charged Vilebone with a battle cry, throwing holy magic as they ran. The alchemist shrugged off most of their attacks, but Brighthelm was still powerful enough to do some damage. He flinched, feeling her holy magic sear his skin. "Heh, you think that'll stop me so easily?" Vilebone pulled open his coat to reveal flasks of green liquid, each hand pulling out a concoction and tossing at the approaching elves. The glass shattered on impact, one elf was hit, the liquid spilling all over her. The paladin kept running, slowly winding down in speed as fat ballooned on her thin frame once more.
"Huff, huff, make him pay Brighthelm..." She called, pinned by her weight. The rest of the elves continued their charge, nearing Vilebone and dodging his cocktails.
"Almost there, be ready!" Their commander yelled, readying her sword. As soon as they reached him, two more elves fell to his elixirs. Leaving only a handful left, they all piled on him, swinging and casting over and over, he fell to the floor chuckling loudly. Before he finally breathed his last, Brighthelm notices something...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Victory?

choices: It worked, all of Sylvia's weight was restored to normal!
Something malfunctioned, and Sylvia was expanding nonstop!
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Any last words, you sick monster?" Brighthelm spoke.
"Me...? A monster...? No..." Vilebone sputtered a laugh, as he pressed a button that appeared from the sleeve of his coat.
The sound of a gate opening, followed by the most hideous growl you could conceive of, could be heard coming from the side of Brighthelm, as she slowly turned to view the horrid abomination that slowly crept toward her.
"...But he is..." Vilebone cracked one last time, before his life faded away.

The Abomination took a look down at Brighthelm, and roared viciously, splattering bile and ooze from his mouth.
"Well, I'm not gonna be beaten down by some rotting, bloated corpse! Have at you!" Brighthelm cried, as she lunged towards the monster courageously.


She managed to beat down the monster, without getting a bit dirty, of course. Out of breath and tired, she dragged herself over to Sylvia, who was still a large blob.
"Hey, Sylvia! You know how to reverse this?" Brighthelm asked, when she was finished climbing to the top of Sylvia's humungous, flabby body.
"Oh, yeah." Sylvia responded, now broken from her mind control, "There's a control panel up in that room, I dunno the controls, but I bet you could figure it out!"
Brighthelm maneuvered her way through the corridors to reach the control room, and found a confusing mess of buttons and switches, that she played with for a few minutes before finally figuring out how to work it.
"Alright, now I'm going to pull the switch! 3... 2..."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: He pressed a button in his coat pocket!

choices: Swap over to Diana's point of view
Follow the paladins in their search
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
A massive machine whirred around behind Sylvia, a beam of... something spreading all over her body. "Whew, is it getting hot out here, or?" Sylvia felt a bit stifled, her face getting a bit red. Heat built up and up, and the weight seemed to slowly be burnt off! It almost looked like steam coming off her massive frame, but slowly she was shrinking down. It took a while, but everyone surrounding the massive blob of an elf watched on in awe. When it was all said and done, Sylvia was down to about 230 pounds, which was still on the chubby side, but more than manageable. The paladin looked down in a huff, a smile on her face. "It feels good to be back!" Brighthelm couldn't help but laugh under her breath, looks like it's about resolved.

The elves all gathered to celebrate their victory over the alchemist, which... went surprisingly well! Up until Sylvia asked were her companion was, "Say, where's Lysa?" The small crowd's celebrating soon lowered to a murmur, "Did you not find her? And what of Diana?" Sylvia tilted her head, this wasn't over...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: And the weight just melts away!

choices: Diana reaches Lysa first.
Brighthelm and Sylvia reach Lysa first, but her weight caught them off-guard.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Vilebone, your death shall not be in vain," Diana said, riding Vilebone's Skeletal Horse to where Lysa was, "I'll make sure your vision is brought to life!"
Diana rushed through the dense forests of Ghostlands, she had fled from the scene as soon as Vilebone released the Abomination. With Brighthelm distracted, it gave her just enough time to mount upon Vilebone's steed and rush off to find Lysa.

However, Sylvia and Brighthelm had managed to catch up with Diana, by using the holy magic left in Brighthelm to speed up their mount.
"Diana! Stop what your doing, this is foolish!" Brighthelm called out.
"I will not let my master's death be in vain!" Diana responded angrily.
"Diana, if you stop now, we can work something out, I'm sure. We know you aren't entirely to blame here, you just need to..."
But Brighthelm was interrupted, by Diana throwing a vial of Volatile Elements at Brighthelm, causing her mount to slightly lose balance, but regain it shortly after.
"Alright, fine, if you want to play dirty, let's play dirty!" Brighthelm roared, as she pulled out her Sword.

Brighthelm and Diana fought for quite a while, until they hit a fork in the road, and they both took opposite routes.
"Damn it all! Now we'll never catch up..." Brighthelm growled.
"Don't give up hope! There's still a chance we can catch up with her." Sylvia comforted.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Vilebone's Successor

choices: Follow Brighthelm and Sylvia
Follow Diana and Lysa
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Diana forced her mount to it's limit, plus her route was far quicker. "Those two won't get there in time, not a chance with that road." Diana snickered, snapping her reigns back hard. She left Lysa in a large barn off the road, confident they wouldn't find her there. The path went on for quite some time, after a hard right and through a brook. Diana saw the barn at the edge of her sight. "We'll be out of here before they even know it."

Diana pulled up the wooden latch on the front of the barn, creaking the old wooden door open. She rushed herself inside, almost falling losing her footing as she bumped into the massive Lysa, "Ooof, did you get bigger piggy?" Diana called, slapping Lysa's impossibly soft middle, "We need to get out of here, and I do apologize for the quick relocation.."
It was clear Lysa was sleeping when Diana barged in, her mind still in a cloud, "Relocation, huh? What's.. *urp* going on?" Lysa grumbled, sweeping crumbs off her impossibly deep cleavage. She was huge at this point, fatter than she was at her house, the barn was even becoming a tight fit for the elf.
"Pfft, don't worry about it, all that matters is we'll be away from your loathsome order." Diana readied her teleportation spell, Lysa's added bulk extending it's prep time. Diana's keen ears heard horses trotting full speed outside and getting closer, she cursed under her breath, trying to quicken it as best she could.

The doors slammed open, the partially dressed Brighthelm and Sylvia rushed to stop Diana, "Hehe, you're too late!" And with a huge flash, Lysa and Diana were gone, a flurry of hay slowly falling to the ground.
"Ugh, dammit! One step forward two back!" Brighthelm yelled, kicking the wall angrily. "We need to trace them, there's no way this isn't a part of some scheme Sylvia!"

Diana huffed, wiping sweat from her brow and leaning on the wall behind her. "That was close piggy, you almost got us caught."
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Diana reaches Lysa first

choices: Meanwhile, with Brighthelm and Sylvia...
Eventually, Diana falls asleep, and Lysa is given a break from the feeding.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Diana and Lysa found themselves in a large, open field, surrounded by mountains.
It was rather obvious they were near Arathi, but in a very secluded area.
"Ah, brilliant! They'll never find us here, and when they do, your fat will reach the mountaintops!" Diana cackled.
Lysa sighed, and was no longer scared. She had no way to fight against it, so she may as well sit back and just accept this FATe.

Diana began stuffing Lysa full of magically conjured food, that cause massive weight gain as per norm.
Lysa felt her already obese body shaking with the gain, and part of her actually enjoyed it.
"Vilebone had such a complicated plan, when it would be so much easier to simply fatten up one elf, instead of multiple at once. As well, it's easier to keep track of." Diana told herself.
Diana simply rested on Lysa's growing belly, keeping the flow of food going as she watched the cloud roll by.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Follow Diana and Lysa

choices: Diana's away from Lysa, off doing something...
Diana's still feeding Lysa
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Nothing, nothing at all. There's no way of telling where they went, it's a lost cause." Brighthelm sighed, "We need to tell the council, and they better spare their resources this time, or so help me..." She clenched a fist, shaking at nothing in particular.
"Settle down Brighthelm, we'll find them soon." Sylvia did her best to comfort Brighthelm, but it wasn't working. She placed a hand on her shoulder only to get it shrugged off. "They'll believe us, I promise."
"Suuure they will Sylvia, easy for you to believe after I saved you from being a blob." Brighthelm walked outside the barn with her hands on her head, "Either way, if we don't find them, I don't think it'll be good. Who knows what that nutcase is up to, see I never liked her." She narrowed her eyes and looked at Sylvia "I never knew why you two were friends with her, she's just so... annoying." She jumped back up on her mount with a grumble, "It's best we get going now before dark, let's move." The two paladins made their way back onto the path and trotting back to Silvermoon.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Meanwhile, with Brighthelm and Sylvia...

choices: With a Void Feeder to keep Lysa steadily fattened.
and give her a break, let her rest before Diana gets back.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Diana was still fattening Lysa, who was now a quarter of the size of the giant hole-like area, it being nearly twice the size of Sunstrider Isle.
Diana began fattening Lysa with more weight-increasing foods and spells, causing her gain to be both rapid, yet smooth at the same time.
"You're so soft, Lysa... I'm really doing Silvermoon a favor, flattening them all beneath this soft, cushiony mass of fat." Diana mentioned.
Lysa was thinking of how she could possibly get out of this situation, it seemed hopeless at this point. Even if Brighthelm and Sylvia make it, she'd already be too fat for them to do anything about.

Diana decided, after a while, that she'd want to check up on the two blundering elves. So, she decided to leave Lysa...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Diana's still feeding Lysa

choices: Diana's Errands
Lysa's Break
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
"Alright, break time starts now, piggy." The thin elf chimed, standing up on top the mountainous paladin. "I've got more errands, now dont go sneaking off now..." She leaned over and waved a taunting finger at Lysa.

"Ughh..." Lysa's groan of a response was all she could muster at the moment, stuffed beyond belief and fighting to stay conscious. Her eyes opened and closed as her head nodded, awake, asleep, awake, asleep...

Diana grinned, happy with her work, "Tootles!" With a flick of the wrist she casted her teleportation spell...
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.title: Left to her own devices

choices: Disguise herself, and give them false information on where to go.
Trick/Force the two into fattening up.
1243112122222122211121112121222121112122.content:
Dianna was off to see how the two "Rescuers" were doing, despite her knowing there'd be no way they'd manage to find Lysa in time, she still wanted to mess around with them.

"Ugh, where would she take Lysa...?" Brighthelm pondered.
