Sylvia sat down on a stump with a sigh, "We'll never find her like this, we need help somehow or it won't happen..." She trailed, leaning over and propping her head between both hands. "Something's gotta go our way..." She groaned.
"Hmmm, I don't see any miracle happening out here, just look where we are." Brighthelm kicked at a rock and watched it tumble down the path. " We might need to consider giving up..." The pair sat in thought, waiting for something to come to them, or a miracle to help...

"Wait, did you hear that just now?" Sylvia perked an eyebrow, pointing down the road, "Sounded like a Hawkstrider." She stood from her stoop.
"Are you suggesting-" Sylvia held a finger to Brighthelm's lips, telling her to be silent.
"Hello?! IS anyone down there?" Sylvia called, hiding behind a pine-tree.

"Y-Yes?" The female voice called out. She sounded harmless enough, and from what they could tell: alone. The two paladin looked at each other and shrugged, walking out from behind cover.
"Don't be alarmed, we're not gonna rob you or anything," Brighthelm held up her hands in a show of good faith.
"We're looking for a friend of ours, blood elf, really...well..." Sylvia puffed out her cheeks and emphasized a sphere around her midsection.

"Well... I can't say I've seen who you're talking about..." The woman answered, pulling at her cowl, "But I have something you could try that might help?" She clears her throat before continuing, "It enhances your senses for a time, perhaps that could help."
Sylvia quickly opened her palm, while Brighthelm hesitated but eventually did the same. The woman dropped a single capsule in both their waiting hands, one orange and one green. "They both help with different senses, so it's best if both of you take a different one." She pair nodded their heads in response, Sylvia taking the green while Brighthelm took the orange. "Alright, I hope you find... whoever that is..." The stranger walked past both elves without another word.

"Can we really trust a poultice someone like THAT just gave us?" Brighthelm questioned, "She's beyond strange."
Sylvia grunted, "Well we don't have much of a choice, do we? Especially if we don't find Lysa, we're in deep!"

Brighthelm thought about it for a good long while, "You know what, you're right..." She popped in it her mouth and swallowed, Sylvia doing the same.

Brighthelm considered it, and the more she thought about it, the more appealing the idea became.
"Yeah... if she were immobile, she'd be unable to do anything to stop us!" Brighthelm said.
"Well, what're you waiting for? Go get that powder!"

Brighthelm snuck upstairs, wearing her lightest clothing to sneak upstairs without anybody knowing.
She reached Anya's door, and noticed it was open. She creaked the door open, and spotted the Powder right next to Anya.

The mismatched pair of elves had walked for quite some time, long enough for the sun to start it's descent and the beginnings of an evening windchill. "Ugh... Its getting a bit nippy." Brighthelm whined, rubbing up her bare forearms for some warmth.

"Yeah... You're telling me, little miss feeder..." Sylvia shivered, the lack of fitted clothes were starting to bother her as the sun stretched further down. The 230 pound elf was starting to shiver, maybe skin tight clothes weren't the best option after all. "And -just- when I could finally fit in my old clothes again." Sylvia hissed under her breath, hoping her traveling companion would hear her.

"Look, I already said I was sorry..." Brighthelm said with a low tone, doing her best to empathize, "It was the pill!" She did her best to salvage the situation, but it didn't look like Sylvia was having it. "If it makes you feel any better, I'll take full responsibility." She offered, walking ahead of Sylvia, turning to talk to her.

Sylvia simply nodded, giving Brighthelm an eye roll, "Suuure, I've seen how you've been eyeballing me." Sylvia gave a huff, picking up her pace to brush past the still lithe elf.

Brighthelm gave a pouting face, "Fine. Have it your way." She begrudgingly followed Sylvia in silence. There was still no sign of any towns nearby, the road signs few and far between. Chances are, they were stuck out pretty far from any nameable towns, let alone a village. As they kept walking, Brighthelm eventually peeped up, "We might need to find shelter out here for the night," she gave a loathing sigh, "There ought to be a cave or some such out here somewhere close by."

"Hmm,you mean like that one?" Sylvia pointed out to a wide mouthed cave just a hundred feet or so to their right, outpost inside the crags and cracks of a rocky wall of stone.

Brighthelm narrowed her eyes, "Ermm, yes. It looks good enough." The higher ranking elf jogged ahead, "Let me check it out first!" She called at Sylvia as she passed. It wasn't a far run, and looked somewhat covered by vines. Brighthelm cast a holy spell of illumination, lighting her palm with a golden glow. She stepped in with sword drawn, walking in slowly. It was a fairly open space, and it looked like outside was the only entrance, the floor was pure stone, as were the walls. "Odd." She remarked, sliding the weapon back in it's sheath. The paladin walked through the mouth, calling down to her companion, "All clear, come on up." The elf in question making her ascent up the hill.

Accidental/Intentional, Sylvia has a secret love for gaining... or at least she doesn't know it yet. That or she'll accidentally be fattened. Curses, strange devices, all that sort of stuff.
12432.title: Slow Gaining

choices: Intentional
Unintentional
124322.content:
Our first option here; Sylvia wants to gain, or at least figures out at some point that she does. Its up to you!

Second is pretty open ended, Sylvia is fattened against or will or on accident. Not to be confused with force fed, as that's another option!

Whichever you choose, the paladin will gain so its a guaranteed win!
124322.title: Intentional/Unintentional

choices: Waking up to a hearty travelers breakfast
Sylvia wakes up a bit late...
1243222.content:
Setting up this story: Sylvia has finished all of her trials for becoming a full fledged paladin, save for the last. Her final task was to defeat the demon leading attacks on a local village. The attacks were small, but troublesome none the less for the unarmed villagers. The mission was a bit different than most that her fellow paladins partook in, as this time the information was foggy. Not a lot was known about the demon. Regardless, the trial was pass or fail; either become a certified paladin or get stuck back in training doing grunt duty. Sylvia was hopeful for the most part, but had a feeling it wouldn't go as planned or that it'd flop last minute...

Sylvia Embersworn sat cross-legged on her bunk, folding and packing a spare change of clothes for her journey. She sat with her traveling bag between her legs, already stuffed to the brim with gear. The elf pulled the straps tight and buckled them closed, content with what she was bringing. 'Finally done... I can barely stand waiting any longer...' She mused, laying back down on her bed, drumming either side of the bag with her feet. 'Not only for my sake, but there's as well... I can't afford to fail this.' Sylvia reasoned, further encouraging herself in preparation for the morning.

As Sylvia huffed out a sigh and closed her eyes, the bunkmate below her chimed up, "SOoo, final trial eh?" The feminine voice was enough to make Sylvia frown. Of all the people she didn't want to talk to tonight, Brighthelm was certainly on the top of the list. She was practically a prodigy and everyone knew it; especially her. She flew through each of her trials, and the council wants her in a leading roll, preening her for council succession. She was pampered and privileged. The only thing holding her back was her attitude, a superiority complex and a chip on her shoulder, Brighthelm often gave joked on Sylvia's behalf. The prodigy had her moments, oddly standing up for Sylvia given the chance.

"Mhmm... Hopefully the only time I need to do it." Sylvia answered with a hint of annoyance rolling over in bed.

"Heh, its alright, not everyone can pass first time. What's another year of training, huh?" Brighthelm nudged the bottom of Sylvia's bunk, laughing under her breath.

"Yeah... Real encouraging..." Sylvia groaned, burying her face in her pillow. Not another peep out of Brighthelm, she must've gotten the message...
1243222.title: Unintentional

choices: Sylvia eats too long, leading to a late start...
Sylvia eats enough and leaves on time...
12432221.content:
Sylvia's eyes freaked open slowly, her limbs stretching under the red bed sheets. "Mmmm..." She cooed, feeling refreshed and rejuvenated from n exceptionally good rest. Her previous stress nearly melted away, especially when she caught a whiff of fresh breakfast. Once she was fully awake, the young paladin hopped off her bunk gracefully. She scratched her he's and walked in the direction of the barrack's kitchen, her feet still bare on the cold wood flooring.

As Sylvia reached the epicenter of smell, she plopped down in her chair at the table. "Good morning, Lysa." Sylvia gestured over to the elf spicing and preparing the final parts of what looks to be a rather large meal. "Looks like you're out here early," she poured a glass of juice before continuing, "Aiming to flex your culinary muscles?"

"Heh, that's about right," Lysa was starting to pull the meat she had prepared off the spit, "I'm making sure little-miss-soon-to-be-paladin gets a proper send off." She said, turning from her work to flash Sylvia a smile.

Lysa and Sylvia were both good friends, they both joined at the same time and clicked right off the bat. The fast friends were both ecstatic about joining and becoming paladins. However, as training went on, the two were forced to do simple work at the barracks from time to time, and their overall positions changed. Lysa was assigned to cooking for a few weeks, and in that time she discovered her love for cooking. Lysa requested to take over as barrack chef, which ended up being quite popular with everyone after she'd proven how good it all tasted. The career path did stunt her drive to become a paladin however, swapping training time for cooking practice.

With all the cooking she'd been doing, Lysa wasn't quite the thinnest elf... She got in the habit of taste testing everything she made, slowly but surely adding to her frame. She stuck out among her people, chubby by most standards; sporting a pudgy potbelly and a round backside, only matched by thick thighs. Not to say she wasn't very pretty, as she was. Her hair a crimson red, a soft and welcoming face.

"Looks like you're making a rather big send-off, huh?" Sylvia smiled at her friend and sipped on her drink. Lysa washed her hands clean and loaded Sylvia's plate high, untying her apron before walking over and setting it down in front of her.

"A traveler needs to eat, and as they say! Its the most important meal of the day." She pointed up at the air and nodded her head resolutely.

"True, true... But this might only tempt me to stay," Sylvia eyed the food, taking in its divine scent, "Dont be offended if I dont finish it all." Sylvia looked back up at the chubby elf.

"Nonsense, I wont be offended... Just slightly sad." Lysa joked, chuckling at Sylvia's show of concern. "But eat up, dont want you to be late." She walked back over to the food, getting another plate prepared.

"Mhmm, orders received." Sylvia threw a salute, getting her hands on her utensils as Lysa came walked back with a loaded plate...
12432221.title: The Most Important Meal of the Day

choices: Riding till night, stopping at a local Tavern for rest.
Side tracked along the way.
124322211.content:
By the time Lysa sat down, Sylvia had already started eating; slowly taking bites from her stack of pancakes. "This is a good batch, Lysa," Sylvia noted, pouring more Eversong syrup on top, "Nice and fluffy."

"When are they not?" Lysa gave a short chuckle, picking up her own fork and knife. "So this task of yours, what's the details? I dont recall you mentioning." The cook asked, taking a large bite of meal before her friend started the briefing. Sylvia didn't have much information herself, but she managed to tell Lysa all the details she knew. As the two elves chatted, their breakfasts steadily disappeared. Sylvia unconsciously ate without realizing just how much she was packing away. The overloaded plate she was served started withering away, and so too was her morning...


"Ughh... How do you eat this much so easily, Lysa..." Sylvia trailed off, leaning back in her chair cradling an overfed ball of a middle. She managed to eat all of her friend's meal without realizing it until it was too late. Now she was left groaning, the bottom of her shirt riding up. Lysa still sat across from her, plate cleaned long before with a smile. Sylvia could see that Lysa was slightly bloated under her shirt, but nearly as much as she was.

"Heh, you're just a wimpy light weight," she teased, seemingly unaffected by the amount of food she ate, "I can handle a good meal is all." The two exchanged laughs, while Lysa collected plates for washing.

Sylvia felt like she was going to pop, her stomach wasn't used to such large capacity. "Yeah, I think all of Silvermoon could predict that ability." Sylvia joked, slowly getting to her feet with aid from her chair. Once she was upright, Sylvia looked almost cartoonish; round stuffed belly stuck on a small thin frame.

"Whoa, you better get goin fatty," a familiar voice came from behind, "you're already late." Brighthelm pointed behind with her thumb as Sylvia turned. She had a smug grin, aiming her eyes on Sylvia's ball of a stomach, "A butterball won't make I into the order you know."

"Ugh, not in the mood..." Sylvia slowly pushed past her peer in the direction of her bunk, popping open her footlocker. "But you're right, I need to hurry..." She admitted, pulling her clothes and armor out.

"Mhmmm, maybe if you didn't stuff your face for 2 hours..." Brighthelm sat on her bunk with a sigh, "You need to be more responsible Syl."

"Yeah yeah, and stop calling me that." Sylvia quickly slipped off her night clothes and pulled on her shirt and pants. She started getting her armor on, at least the pieces she could do herself. She made sure each belt was on tight, making sure no piece were to fall off. The lower body was no problem... That I until she got to the belt. Her usual length was far too uncomfortable, she needed to bring it up quite a few extra notches and even then it was partly painful. Her chestplate was going to be an issue, it wasn't something she could do alone; each strap ws either on her side or on her back. "Brighthelm... Give me a hand, please."

Brighthelm perked her long ear, "My help?" Sylvia nodded, "Alright, sure." She got up from her sitting position to behind Sylvia, each hand holding a side belt. She tightened the straps harshly, pinching Sylvia's sensitive midsection.

"Owww... Careful..." The elf winced, her belly tightly packed inside her plate gear. "Easy on the back ones, please." Which Brighthelm surprisingly obeyed.

"Oh, you're no fun Syl." The superior ranked paladin chuckled, "Go on now, don't fail!"

Without another word, Sylvia walked to the stables with her bag hoisted over her shoulder. 'I'm only a little late, no big deal.' She reassured herself, mounting her paladin steed. 'But this is going to be a hard ride...' She gulped, patting her belly in concern for how comfortable her journey would be.
124322211.title: A little late...

A spoiled rich girl who sets her sights on a trade prince!
An adventurer who runs afoul of a sticky situation!

125.title: Goblin

choices: A fight breaks out!
Before things can get too out of hand, Trade Prince Bustlevug appears.
One of the girls suffers a bikini malfunction (oh, that goblin engineering...)
1252.content:
Trimsibelle Snockle tossed her lustrous hair over her shoulders, shades of deep jade and aquamarine shining from the gently curling locks. She'd just got a new bikini - a red-and-white striped number - and she didn't want even one extra square inch of her skin covered while she sunbathed. It wasn't that she was worried about tanning unevenly. In fact, given the clouds of pollution hanging above Kezan, there was little chance of tanning at all. Tanning wasn't why she was here on the beach.

She was... well, you might call it fishing. But she wasn't after the poison-soaked fish bobbing belly up in the oily ocean waters. She had much juicier prey in mind.

"Ooh, there's a nice one," her sister Jillitrice said, nudging Trimsy and pointing down the beach. "Just look at those muscles!"

Trimsy snorted in the direction of the burly goblin man. "Muscles like that come from doing work."

"So?"

"I'm after a man of means. The only muscles I want to see are the ones in his counting fingers."

Jilli took another lick of her Kajaberry ice cream. "Why? Daddy gives us scads of money. Wouldn't you rather have those big strong arms wrapped around you?"

Trimsy pulled her sunglassed down her delicately pointed nose and looked over them, making no attempt to hide the way she was sizing up her sister's figure. "The way you're stuffing down those ice creams, you'll need a man with strong arms."

Jilli blushed and pulled her knees up to her chest, letting her dark hair fall over her face. "It's only my second cone."

"Since when, the start of this conversation?" Trimsy laughed. "Oh, don't get upset! I'm only joking around. You know I love you no matter how fat you are. Now keep your eyes open, would you? I heard a rumor that a trade prince was going to be on the beach today, and I need to know when you spot him."

"Can't you look?"

Trimsy settled back in the sand, eyes closed. "I don't want him to think I'm here waiting for him or anything."

Suddenly, a commotion erupted at the far end of the beach. Excited voices rang out, along with the flashes, snaps, and occasional small explosions of numerous goblin cameras. Jilli pointed out to sea. "Look, Trimsy!"

Trimsy sat up. An enormous yacht was plowing through the gummy surf, dislodging oil drums and old, deactivated mines. In contrast to the general dinginess of the beach (which was, after all, public--yech) the ship gleamed with a fresh coat of paint and wax and was bedecked with so much polished chrome and copper it was a miracle it wasn't sinking.

"I know that ship!" Trimsy said with excitement in her voice. "That's Wix Bustlevug!"

"The candy guy?" Jilli asked, blinking. "Is he rich?"

"The top confectionary distributor worldwide," Trimsy corrected. "And with girls like you around, of course he's rich!"

"W-well--who knows, maybe he'd like a girl like me better than someone who doesn't appreciate his life's work," Jilli smiled.

Trimsy smirked and stood up, arcing her back and inhaling until her bikini top strained against her chest. "I guess we'll find out, won't we?"

Jilli stood up next to her and struck the same pose, pulling in her gut and sucking air into her lungs until she almost squeaked. Trimsy goggled. Suddenly her sister's unfashionable blue one-piece was loose around the middle and tight to the point of bursting around her chest.

"You--you--I saw him first, you tramp!" she snapped. "So don't even think about it!"

"Neither of us has seen him," Jilli pointed out.

"Well-well--shut up!"

Jili!

12523.title: Time for snap!

choices: Jill heads to buy more ice cream to deal with her bikini malfunction.
Jill makes up her mind and heads to port side to see Bustlewug!
125232.content:
Jillitrice held her breath to competiting with her sister's figure, she took one long breath in trying to make her chest larger and catch Bustlewugs attention from his yach and she heard groaning. Her one-piece swimsuit groans and snapped behind her neck. "Ach!" Jili yelps as her rubbery swimwear's garment flips down showing off her green breasts and darker shaded nipples, losing her focus her belly also returns back to its own round shape while she blushes. Trimmsy looks over her sister starting to laugh. "Hah ha! Give up sis don't try to compete with REEALL goblin bombshell gal."

On the yach some bruiser goblins aboard blinks looking at the beach and its two goblin sisters and commotion surrounding it. "Oi boss look over there." Bruiser points at Jill and Trim. Wix slowly turns his attention to beach lowering his sunglasses looking over Trimmsy and then Jillitrice who now has started to hide her breasts with her hands. "Brass bombs! Look at that gal." Wix blinks and keeps his sights over Jill. "I know boss the gal in bikini looks ready to blow." Bruiser looks over Trimmsy.
"Shut ya mouth boy. I have my sights on the other gal." Wix sneers and places his glasses back on. "Lets head to port! I've got candy shop to promote." Wix snickering.

Back on beachside Jillitrice sighs as she finally got her greenies covered, Trimmsy exhales air. "No offence sis I'm certain he got my eyes on me. I saw him looking at us." Trimmsy pats her sisters back. "We should head to port Yach is anchoring there." Trimmsy offers small smile to her sister and packs her stuff walking towards the port. Jillitrice looks down at her belly sighing. "Perhaps sister is right. Not rich guy like Wix Bustlewug would even lay his eyes on gal like me over my sister."
Jill looks over ice cream booth and then towards the port. "Hmmh..more ice cream would do well now."
125232.title: Jili!

choices: Ride southwest to Razorfen and seek the Amulet of Amalgamir.
Send a letter to Mikkel Duskworm and offer to replace the missing herbs.
Something else?
1253.content:
It was another cool evening at the harbor. Lexli once again found herself in a tavern spending money she didn't earn. She loved Ratchet. Major seaports meant lots of pockets from all over the world. Who knew what she might find in some poor shlub's coinpurse. She did have to give Gazlowe some credit though. His bruisers most certainly did lift. "They must be juicing on demon blood or something, I swear," Lexli murmured before hailing a bar wench. "Can I get a south island iced tea over here?" she snapped her fingers and held up one green finger. The buxom, gold-green goblin wench nodded and tucked a strand of her purple hair behind her curled ears. Lexli surveyed the tavern, ever eager for her next mark. But before she even got her drink, a human man in a hooded, dusty brown cloak sat down opposite her at the shipswheel-shaped table.

"Good evenin', Lex," he said in a warm, sandy voice. With a flourish of his cloak he produced a sealed scroll and laid it on the table. The peridot pilferer shifted in her seat. Lexli let out a nervous laugh and slid from the wooden seat. A leather-gloved hand seized her slim arm and held fast. He shook his head and guided her back to her seat. "No, I'm afraid you're not leavin' just yet, girl."

"Bastian, old buddy old pal, how have you been?" Lexli beamed a sharp, toothy grin at the man. He had a beard now. The mercenary always had a certain, rugged charm to him, but Lexli shunted such thoughts for the moment. "You know, I think I still owe you that drink from before--"

"You owe more than that, Lex," Bastian began and the goblin followed his gaze over the various, unusual characters to pass through Ratchet, "and I reckon you owe a good deal more since you sank your teeth into this town," he scoffed and released her arm. No one seemed to hear their argument, but Lexli's ears drooped some all the same. Bastian pointed at the scroll on the table. "I offered to play courier and track down your green ass," he said, "because I knew the terms if you failed. Mikkel is out for blood, Lex. You ripped off the wrong alchemist."

"Please," she smirked, "it wasn't the first time I've ripped off the dead." Lexli leaned over the table and scooped up the scroll. She confirmed the wax seal to belong to Mikkel Duskworm of the Royal Apothecary Society.

"He's not too dead to send out legbreakers," Bastian replied with no sign of a smile. "I still worry about you sometimes, and I don't want to hear you end swimiming with the makrura," he added. Six months ago Lexli learned about a shipment of rare herbs flying out of Stranglethorn on a zeppelin. She slipped into the cargo hold the night before the departure and swapped the herbs out with ordinary peacebloom. Boy was Mikkel pissed. Finally relenting, Lexli nodded and cracked open the scroll before hastily scanning the script.

"What's the Amulet of Amalgamir?" she raised a pierced eyebrow and continued reading. The letter mentioned the necklace possessed odd magic, something about transmutations, but Lexli was most pleased reading about wiping away her debt in one stroke. She found a crude map scrawled at the bottom of the parchment, but little else about the prized treasure itself. Bastian sat with his arms folded and shrugged when the little goblin looked up. "Let me guess, you're just the delivery boy?" her brows fell unamused. He nodded with the utmost neutrality. "Thank you so much, Sebastian," the pint-size rogue slid down from her chair and tucked the letter and enclosed map into her adventuring backpack. "So I'm supposed to sneak into Razorfen and steal some fancy necklace?" she asked only to receive another silent shrug. "This will be enough to clear my debt?"

"Is that what the letter says?" Bastian tilted his head, offering the goblin no insight.

"And why didn't they just send a bird to deliver this? It wouldn't be any less helpful than you, you old lug," Lexli bared her teeth in a mischievous grin. Bastian mockingly shook a fist. At last the busty golden goblin returned with the south island iced tea, placing it down in front of Lexli. "About time." She flashed an innocent smile at the waitress.

"That'll be ten silver," the wench held out a hand, and Lexli looked to Bastian.

"Oh-- well my drinking buddy here said he'd buy me a round for old time's sake," Lexli spouted, offering the courier a barrage of batting blue eyes. He frowned, rolled his eyes, and nodded to the wench.

"Open a tab for me, would you, doll? I'll have a bourbon," Bastian winked and the golden goblin walked off. "Only one, now, I'm working," he offered Lexli a stony, reserved expression. She held up the scroll and shook it in protest.

"You just punched out for the day," back into the pack it went, and the thief leaned over the table, pressing her hands under her modest bust, "unless I'm not enough goblin for you," she stuck her tongue between her pillowy, black lips and winked. She bobbed her head toward the waitress now beyond ear shot. "I could never do what I do with those things." This earned another eyeroll from Bastian.

"Don't get ahead of yourself, kid," he mused. After several hard drinks, many laughs, and a lengthy, fevered debate over the better faction Brewfest, Lexli and Bastian decided to hold their own drinking competition. Five pints of ale down, and they started to draw a crowd. Many of the tavernfolk gathered around in astonishment at the gluttonous goblin. By now the lithe and nimble goblin gal sported a significant potbelly. The hem of her leather jerkin rode up over a crescent moon of taut, green flesh. Lexli winced and rubbed a hand over her bloated tummy. It gurgled in protest of the foolish game.

After the seventh pint she wiped her foamy lips on the back of her hand and erupted into another thunderous belch. A holler of applause and laughter filled the thick, tavern air. Eight down, nine down, and then Lexli's head dropped to the table. The forty-five pound goblin held her own against the unfairly larger man, and after some more laughs and sighs the crowd dispersed. By now the candles grew low and many of the patrons left for their rooms or their homes.

"Why don't you go get some shut eye," Bastian said with a slur as he shook the swollen goblin, "the amulet isn't going anywhere tonight." Lexli expelled a sickly, wet belch and sloshed out of her chair on unsteady feet. With a hiccup she fell back onto her rump, sending the dome of her leatherbound belly wobbling. Lexli groaned and shuffled off to her room. Tomorrow she'd have some hard choices to make. And one of them would be some exercise to work off all the booze...
1253.title: Lexli the Thorn

At the morning Lexli woke up groaning out softly with yawn, rubbing her eyes she is greeted with her softened potbelly. With soft sigh Lexli got up putting on her gear and preparing for trip to Razorfen to retrieve Amulet of Amalgamir.

Outside the inn awaits Lexli's trike hopping on and turning on the engine and roaring across the barrens. Wind blowing through her hair Lexli realized that she did not ate breakfast. Crossroads is on the way of her ride to Razorfen and her belly begun to growl. "Good gears..I'm hungry but, I should work off my booze binging." Lezli groaned. 125311.content:
"Ehh I guess I don't end up being green football. I can surely burn all this off at Razorfen." Lexli shurgs and roars towards Crossroads, folowing her hungry belly's growling. At the Crossroads, Taurens and Orcs are already going to their work. Merchants and guards all of them going to their posts as Lexli parks her trike at the outskirt of the Crossroads walking in the town. Goblin lady looking over buff guards as they salute her as she passes them, Lexli heads towards the town inn to greet its patron. "Heya got good meal for hungry traveller?" Lexli greets big tauren before her. "Greetings goblin. You are in for good time, We are having goblin chef for this week making food so are you ready to order?" Big tauren hands menu to Lexli as she takes a seat. Tauren steps in. "Chef recomends big hearty meal. It consisists from two big fishburgers and lots of fries. and it is very reasonable priced." Lexli pauses for moment. "Two big? I can't-" Lexli's growling stomach interupts her and she sighs. "Eeh it sounds good. I'll take that." Lexli nods and pays her meal to tauren who walks away to kitchen.

"Sigh good gears...why you gotta be so greedy?" Lexli pokes her growling green belly. Later Tauren returns with the big hearty meal. "Chef sends his best regards. Enjoy!" He bows politely going over other visitors, while Lexli digs in into her meal eating all that juicy but fattening food with great apetite causing her belly to poke out more again.

Lexli sighs in relaxation and pats her full big green belly greets her beneath her leather top walking slowly out from the in she slightly feel uncomfortable full but it was worth every penny. "Oh yeah to Razorfen." she remembers why she even drove to adventure and hops on her trike and loud belch, blushing over it as she rews up her engine and drives towards Southern Barrens and to Razorfen.

During her journey Lexli slightly rubs her full belly but it begins to growl for more food. "Damn it not again!" Lexli curses under her breath. She drives by Cataclysm caused oasises and sees tropical fruits in there. Perhaps healthier food might ease her belly?
125311.title: Girl's gotta eat! Never go on mission on em...

1253111.content:
Goblin sighs in defeat her belly not letting her focus at all to her driving. "Fine you greedy gut! Let's have extra meal then! Can't let those quillboars hear your growling in Razorfen.." Lexli rolls her eyes and drives at the closest oasis. Parking her trike and hoping off it, Lexli groans holding her bloated belly as it sloshes around.
"I've got some serious work out ahead of me.." she sighs and walks around the oasis looking over the tropical fruits. Big purple ones and red ones with spiky like yellow parts. Lexli shrugs taking each of different fruits biting big bites from them. "Mmhh.. not bad. gulp! Not bad at all. I should gather these and sell for good profit." Lexli begins to grin as gold-green goblin woman binges with her heartful of tasty juicy fruits, she gets so lost into all the binging to forget her full growling belly as it grows to peek out fully from her leather top a dome of gold-green flesh pouring out. Lexli herself begins to grow softer all over.

"Mmmh good gadgets that was deliciou- hiccup! s good." Lexli wipes her fruit juice covered mouth and blinks until screaming. "What?! Who in goblinity!?" Lexli watches in shock how past her slightly grown bosom peeks big dome of belly sloshing and gurgling as she pokes it.
"Damn it damn it... keep your head cool girl.. I can lose this..I just need to get that stupid amulet to get rid of my debts and then I can start some serious workout."

Potbelly or not I can't be defeated by my own greed." she snickers and drives over the bridge that crosses the chasm made by Deathwing. 12531111.content:
The gluttonous Goblin rode on through the Southern Barrens, her purple hair whipped back in the wind as the rumble of her bike and the bumps of the road beneath her gently jostled her already stuffed and chubby form.

The plump emerald beauty stopped her trike at a crossroads, three paths presented before her, the first, leading to her destination of Raxorfen, the other two, appearing slightly more interesting to her food drunk mind.

The fist alternate path was old, easily missed if it wasn't for the sign, hordes of plants overgrew the dirt road and climbed up the rotten signs post. Spring of the Slo--. The second path was more obvious, clearly having seen more traffic. If it had a sign at any point, the short stomach-on-legs couldn't tell, though she thought that she could detect the sent of roasting meat down that path.

131.content:
Su Jin, the lovely cook at Halfhill's Tavern. With an appreciation for food known only to cooks, she's often eating whenever she's not making a dish for a customer. She's already rather heavy, with most of the attention placed on her upper half. Her sizable DD breasts were hard to contain within her clothing, as was the potbelly that reached only just further than the breasts. She is definitely above average for a pandaren woman.

But how will she move past just 'above average?'
131.title: Su Jin, the tubby Halfhill Cook

choices: Su Jin continues stuffing herself can't let delicious food go waste.
Su Jin's button goes pop!
1312.content:
Morning sun washes over Halfhill, which leads Gina Mudclaw opening the market. Early bird farmers are bringing groceries for the busy cooks who each of them are preparing food at their spots. Heavy cook Su Jin walks slowly from Lazy Turnip to her cooking spot, humming herself she puts on her apron with little struggles regarding her big DD bust which threatens to pop her top button.

"Good morning Su Jin!" Gina greets happy rotund chef. "Hello Gina, Will it be busy day today?" Su Jin smiles to market girl. "It will be normal day, since Horde and Alliance are no longer fighting for Pandaria, we have a bit overstock of food." Gina ponders for moment grabbing a little notebook.

"So it will be regular day!" Su Jin smiles and starts cooking. During the day more regular customers appear on the busy market selling and buying products and food, but after Horde and Alliance's focus being elsewhere all the extra food is stashed along the cooks.

"Can't let these dumplings go waste." Su Jin ponders and starts munching her extra food, its all delicious and filling but it didn't bother the happy cook so Su jin spent rest of the day after busy morning by munching her delicious dumplings and other delicacies she had training for. Slowly but surely tubby cook's belly begins to bulge out more and leaving Su Jin to catch her breath a bit. "Huff.. mmh these are so great! If only I had more customers." Su Jin taps her chin frowning to think how she can attract more customers, before letting out small little belch after her stuffing. " urp! Whoops... excuse me." She blushes a bit while other market people just offers her neighborly smile and laughs before returning back to their business. Su Jin pats her stuffed belly, thinking her next move.
1312.title: All the delicious food

Someone decides she could stand to be a bit 'more' of a lorewalker
132.content:
Wandering Yi has been around most of Pandaria east of the Serpent's Spine, and all that walking keeps her form in check. Though, needless to say on a pandaren diet, were that walking taken away the pounds would pack on quickly. Especially given her form, which was quite eye-catching. Her breasts may have been just slightly below-average for a pandaren, and her belly was only just there, it was her wide hips and round rump that stole the day.

As a lorewalker, Yi is a lover of adventure. Perhaps the next adventure should be gaining a few pounds, perhaps even while exploring the world outside of Pandaria?

133.content:
Among the pandaren few are respected more than the enigmatic Brewmasters. Skilled in the mystical martial arts of Pandaria, as well as the art of making a damn fine beer, they bring good cheer and good drink wherever they go. Mai Beerbelly is one such Brewmaster, on the quest to perfect her Simmersweet Stout, a delicious beer with fruity hints, and a good deal of fizzy bubbles to tickle the throat. It is quite clear that she taste tests every batch by drinking the whole keg, because this huge brewmaster has a double belly that is easily her most noticeable feature. Not that the lovely breasts, rump, or thick legs could be missed, either.

How shall she get even bigger on her quest to make the perfect stout?
133.title: Mai Beerbelly, the downright obese Brewmaster

choices: Valley of Four Winds! Always plenty to eat there!
Kun-Lai Summit. Something sturdy from the high slopes to bring the right taste?
Krasarang Wilds. Excotic jungle of Pandaria, filled with ingreadents!
1332.content:
Mai is determined to brew her perfect batch of Simmersweet Stout, so she is constantly looking and tasting different ingredients for it causing her to swell up in weight.
While our lovely pandaren is on look out for the correct taste all that tasting and drinking has to go somewhere eh?

Our Brewmaster is heading on quest to travel across Pandaria to find the ingredients that would help her brew to be the best! Where our big Brewmaster is heading first?
1332.title: Unintentional Gain

choices: Towards the Mogu ruins. Perhaps they have the perfect ingreadent?
Mai steers clear from the ruins. Who knows what darkness lurks in there.
13323.content:
Mai Beerbelly was slowly walking down the path towards Zhu's Watch at the borders of Valley of Four Winds and Krasarang Wilds. Slight sweat beads forming on her furred brow as obese lady makes her way carrying her huge keg on her back. Mai's belly sloshes and jiggles heavily with each step as it's escaping from Mai's shirt.

Mai arrives to Zhu's Watch, greeting happily its denizens and guards who greets her, Mai already gathers some admirers over her large fat physique and of course her profession. "Aah, welcome honored brewmaster. Come to find new taste for your brew?" Local guard asks from heavy set brewmaster. " Huff.. Yeah, I am." Mai nods to guard as she continues her journey. After visiting local merchant to resupply herself she continues down to jungle.

The humid hot weather of jungle does number on obese pandaren and Mai sits down on huge sturdy root that creaks beneath her weight. Mai rubs her white belly fur that is not covered by her shirt and begins to eat. Springrolls, rice cakes and tiger meat, eating her fill while her eyes begins to search the nearby land for ingredients for her brew. In distance she can see old Mogu ruins. They are abandoned but could be hunted by menacing mogu constructs and the spirits of the vile masters of the past. Mai belches when she has finished her large meal, enough to feed two pandarens, ready to think her next move.

info.brief_description: The heroes of Warcraft level up and out, in this fat focused interactive.
info.description:
This is an interactive story focused on fattening up the varied and colorful races of Azeroth, but first a few ground rules.

1) Females only.
2) Please, just make it reasonable. There is no ceiling for how much or how quickly these girls can gain, but please avoid sheer laziness like "She ate a magic cake and instantly gained 30,000 pounds."
3) Slobiness is allowed, but absolutely nothing excessive.
4) Remember, story and good characterization can be just as fun to read as eating scenes and weigh-ins.
5) Please use proper grammar, spelling, and capitalization. I will try and fix anything I catch.

Other than that, go crazy!
